review.positiveRemarks: NOT FAR FROM SAN FRANCISCO PIERS
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING EVERYTHING WAS GREAT
review.locationRemarks: LOCATION IS GREAT DRIVE TO DOWNTOWN SAN FRANCISCO WAS ABOUT 15 MINS AWAY

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
6 mi north of the airport with free airport shuttle service. Therefore, you can take the shuttle to the airport & also pick up the BART into the city.
Negatives: The on location restaurant is expensive & there is a lack of outlets in the rooms!
review.positiveRemarks: Yummy warm cookies upon check in. A standard experience in all Doubletree hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: More in room outlets!
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to downtown via the BART.

review.title: Nice & clean close to the airport
review.reviewText: Has a Comfortable experience cookies are delicious! Has the things in the room a traveler could need during their stay such as coffee or hot tea, fridge, microwave & hair dryers . Rooms so spacious & beds are quite comfortable as well.

review.title: Very nice hotel, very tasty food
review.reviewText: Delicious food, very friendly hotel, nice surroundings near the sea

review.title: Avoid At All Costs, Period!
review.reviewText: Two nights, stayed in Feb. Room was not ready on arrival. First room had gross unchanged bed sheets with pubic hair in bed! Called housekeeping to complain. Two housekeepers arrived and changed all sheets and blanket. Then I turned on the heater and noticed the drenched wet carpet under the heater. With red mold stains! Reason: Water continuously dripping from heater onto carpet while the heater was operating. Contacted front desk, got coupon for free breakfast, moved to a different room, which had a central-air wall thermostat. By 2 AM, it became apparent that in the new room, the heater was not working. Called maintenance. By 3 AM after 40 minutes of troubleshooting, they found that the wall control unit had a busted circuit board, had to be opened up and reattached, alleviating the problem. Second breakfast coupon for the new trouble followed promptly. Morning, departure day: an odd power outage disabled only the restaurant (but not any other part of the hotel), so I could not even use the breakfast coupon! I have traveled in challenging places (India, Myanmar, mainland China) and have never seen a hotel even there in such profound shambles. This Radisson is an abject failure! No 24-hour room service. No food within walking distance. Restaurant, if even open, closes at 10pm. They are converting to a DoubleTree - an attempt to start fresh after the bad reviews? They promised further compensation at checkout - a month later, I received only half of what was promised. Avoid!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff! They are incredibly patient and they do their darnedest best to compensate the guests for the awful conditions. Roksi and Jonas rock!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. This is one hopeless dump. It has to be demolished and rebuilt from scrarch. I am a frequent traveler and have never seen such a disaster.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do in the immediate vicinity. Total boondocks. Shuttle to/from BART station at the airport is your lone link to the outside world.

review.title: Nice Hotel...but nothing within walking distance!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice and comfortable. They overbooked and I did not get the room a had originally reserved.However, the staff was more than accommodating in finding something comparable. They ultimately upgraded mt room to the top floor with a bay view, but it was 2 queen beds instead of 1 king...They do however get an "A" for all the effort. The staff was great with EXCEPTIONAL customer service. The downside of this hotel is that there is NOTHING within walking distance. The only restaurant nearby is the one inside the hotel. I took a Taxi to nearby shopping center that cot $30. Just for this reason alone, I don't think I would stay here again!
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing within walking distance. You must take a taxi.

review.title: Great hotel, great staff
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and the rooms were impecably clean. The view wasn't what I expected but great hotel and Staff.

review.title: Becoming a Doubletree Hotel on March 4
review.reviewText: Pleasant experience overall. Easy access to Highway 101, but quiet. Highly recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Next to the water. Perfect for walks or bike rides.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality is being improved to Doubletree standards. Should get even better.

review.title: Changing to Doubletree March, 2014
review.reviewText: To be honest, the carpets of both rooms that we were in were gross. Mine had huge spots of dark stain when you came in the door and other places in the room. Looked like car oil or shoe polish, best guess. I took a picture to the front desk, but they were unwilling to help in any way. They mentioned that when the Doubletree takes over, they will be renovating the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Re-doing the rooms would be great. It would also be nice to have regular coffee mugs in the room.
review.locationRemarks: About 10 minutes from the SF airport.

review.title: Close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel and wait staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a problem next to our room and called the desk and they took care of the problem. We stayed seven years ago here and the same friendly helpful service.
review.positiveRemarks: It is close to everywhere we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Really I don't anything needs to be changed.
review.locationRemarks: Half Moon Bay, Stinson Beach, Goden Gate Bridge, Chinatown Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Convenient to SFO Airport, Free Shuttle
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights at the Radisson because of the location, quality of the brand and price. The sleep number bed and good pillows, which allowed for a few good night sleep, were a big plus over the other hotel brands. We took the BART downtown from SFO and rented a car downtown which was much cheaper than at SFO, especially if you are going to be staying and renting a car for more than a couple days.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: Staff is the best! Friendly, helpful, and professional! Only problem was a squeaky bed that made noise whenever I turned over.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to beaches and city of San Francisco. Easy to get to off the 101. Staff was awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was squeaky.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to city, Golden Gate, Beaches.

review.title: Convenient, quiet, and clean
review.reviewText: I had concerns about noise, based on the close proximity to the SFO airport, but there was no discernable noise at all from within the rooms. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom space was generous. I would definitely go back!

review.title: Nice hotel close to S.F. airport
review.reviewText: Check in went smoothly. The room was very nice and the hotel staff was very friendly. The room condition was excellent. The hotel has a nice restaurant. The waiter there was extremely nice and very professional.

review.title: Bed was comfortable but shuttle service terrible
review.reviewText: It took over an hour for the shuttle service. Not a place to stay for a late night layover.

review.title: Dirty sheets and duvet
review.reviewText: The duvet and bed sheets were dirty. Housekeeping only offered to change the duvet cover but was totally grossed out that I requested them to re do the whole bed, which they did. They also apologized and gave extra bottles of water.

review.title: Great Hotel with a gym and indoor pool and Jacuzzi
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I wanted a place half way between my work and his to stay in and this was perfect. Not too far from downtown San Francisco and the Peninsula. We had a great view from our 6th floor room. Originally, we had 2 queens, but upon check in I asked for King and was given it. I liked that there was gym and Jacuzzi, in fact those were requirements. Room was clean, staff was friendly, and I would definitely go there again with my boyfriend when we want to have a night away.
review.positiveRemarks: Gym, Jacuzzi, that there was a restaurant, room was clean and a nice view.
review.locationRemarks: Ten minutes away from San Francisco. Also, right next to the airport and Downtown South San Francisco, which has more restaurants.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This is our second stay at this hotel and we were very pleased. Our room had wet carpet so we were moved to an upper floor and given complimentary breakfasts. The staff were so friendly and helpful. It was my husbands birthday and the restaurant wait staff went above and beyond their normal routines to wish him well. The restaurant staff were the best ever and always greeted us with a smile. I wish I could remember their names to give proper thanks to those individuals. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Working beds...:)
review.locationRemarks: Very close to San Francisco...

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to San Francisco Airport (SFO) and there is a free shuttle service from hotel to the airport. The hotel is clean, well maintained and the rooms are well furnished, including, with microwave oven and refrigerator. The fitness center has decent quality cardio equipment and the hotel is adjacent to Bay Trail which is excellent for jogging. The hotel is in office park and, as such, few miles from decent restaurants. It has an inhouse restaurant of fairly decent quality. I was very pleased with my stay at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, close to Bay Trail (excellent for jogging, hiking), in-room microwave and refrigerator
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant did not have decent vegetarian options.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to San Francisco airport with free shuttle service from hotel to airport. It is convenient located next to Hwys 101 and 280.

review.title: Nice airport hotel
review.reviewText: Clean and convenient access to the Bay Area and SFO.

managementResponses.response: We apologize for the disappointing service you received from the staff. We want to make sure our guests are comfortable and receive the best “Yes I Can!” service. We want our staff to look engaged and we want our guest's to always feel comfortable. We are sorry to hear we did not meet these expectations.

review.title: Weekend stay
review.reviewText: Staff was not friendly at all! The shuttle driver looked as if he was not interested at all in his job. The front desk not cordial at all. The restaurant staff also seemed bored with their work. Too far from the city.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel was pleasant. The staff was friendly especially in the restaurant. The food was good for hotel food. There is OK buffet breakfast… I had a rack of lamb for dinner that was nicely cooked.
The room was clean but showing its age…could use a coat of new paint or wall paper. The windows in the room needed to be cleaned. Over all the room was clean though. The price seemed reasonable for SF. Being close to the airport was a plus and I did not hear many planes flying over head.

review.title: Nice hotel not to far from downtown .
review.reviewText: Very clean room, comfortable and great price. Not to long of a drive to downtown SF. Good to recommend to friends.

review.title: Nice New year Vacation
review.reviewText:
I always read the reviews of the hotel before I make my reservation , here I'm writing it is Excellent
1- if you visiting San Francisco the hotel is 10 min away from Pier 39 (9 miles) by car or 30 min. if you use the hotel free shuttle then BART from the airport $8.50
2- if you are transit , 5 min to the airport with free shuttle .
review.negativeRemarks: NON
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Cleanliness should be taken seriously
review.reviewText: I stayed with my wife and in the morning she noticed that the pillow she slept in the night before had dried blood on the pillow case. When we went to make coffee in the room and opened up the coffee mug, we noticed that it had never been washed. It seems that details are not a priority when it comes down to sanitary conditions.
review.negativeRemarks: Attitude

review.title: Close to SFO Airport & Candlestick Park
review.reviewText: Chose hotel as it was close to Candlestick Park and drove there from LA to see the Forty Niners play their last game there... There were numerous other Niners fans staying at the hotel.

review.title: It very easy to access Freeway to downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location and clean. Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: The internet signal need to be more steady and strong.

review.title: Short visit to SF area
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and the staff are friendly. The location is too close to Hwy 101 and railroad track, you can hear the traffic noise from the room.

review.title: best at SFO
review.negativeRemarks: offer park and fly

review.reviewText:
I will never come back or recommend your hotel or restaurant. Your hotel chain and Expedia should work better together. I requested a tub, I or a shower only. I was told by Expedia I would have continental breakfast. Did not exist. The only item Expedia got right was the free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel.
The hotel restaurant was over priced. Few food items were not available on the menu. I had better eating experience at a "two star establishment".
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia and your hotel chain should work better together

review.title: Wonderful hotel,
review.reviewText: I have never seen electric blankets in a hotel. FIRST CLASS ALL THE WAY.

review.title: Very quiet. Friendly and efficient staff.
review.reviewText: We stayed on Floor 8. Beautiful room. Bar closed at 11. Nothing else close. No food available at 9:30 on. Seems there could have been a little something available.

review.title: I love it all
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. I love all the amenities. I will stay there again for sure

review.title: Good deal and was close to the Candelstick Stadium
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for us since we were attending the last 49er game at Candelstick Stadium.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: I really like this hotel. It's a few minutes from the city. Unless you want to stay in the city and pay for parking this is a great place. The staff is very friendly. I had forgotten my tooth brush so I went to the gift shop to purchase one and one of the staff members just gave me a sample brush with toothpaste wich was awesome! Overall a great hotel I would stay there on my next visit.

review.title: I loved it!
review.reviewText: I was really impressed with the staff, very helpful and friendly. Plus I really enjoyed the pool, spa and gym . I found the bar and lounge very modern and a fun place to entertain. Definitely coming back every time in in town !

review.title: Expected Better.
review.reviewText: Although the staff was nice enough, you really had to dig to get any information or help from them. Rooms OK. But age shows a lot. No screened window to open. View of a wall with rocks and trash, so had to keep curtains closed, felt a bit closed in. Room service got the breakfast order wrong. Nothing close by to walk to, $25-$100 cab ride to get to ANYTHING. If We weren't so excited about going to the football game, might have really let these things put a damper on the stay. I/We really expected more for "Staying at The Raddison"
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Candlestick Park. Bed was comfortable. They did have a shuttle to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the view/Trash from the 2nd floor (The Rocks), fix the peeling ceiling in the bathrooms. Offer Shuttle to nearby attractions, Not just SFO.
review.locationRemarks: Candlestick Park.

review.title: Close to airport and Union Square.
review.reviewText: Dependable hotel for all the above reasons. Great restaurant too with very accommodating staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep doing what you do.
review.locationRemarks: Airport and Union Square SF

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Pros: Near the freeway, close to SF, quiet area/away from crowds, refrigerator & microwave in rooms, comfortable beds, flat screen tv. Cons: Front desk person (who btw was pretty impersonal not friendly) played around with me or lied stating that there was a deposit fee for an extra third key card to my room (although I booked in advance for 3 persons). When I checked out another person at the front desk told me there was no such fee for a third key card and that the guy who told me that was playing around?????.............room was terribly drafty (could be due to a big crack I saw in the window, hair dryer didn't work, antique looking microwave didn't work really well, stains on the bed, floor & foot rest, nothing in the immediate area (i.e., restaurants, shops, etc)- you have to drive out to SF, no view (only of the fwy/parking lot) & pretty pricey for an ok place. Wont' be returning after the staff experience- not worth my money.
review.positiveRemarks: close to SF & fwy, quiet area/away from crowds, microwave & refrigerator avaiable
review.negativeRemarks: nothing in the immediate area, no shops, stores, restaurants
review.locationRemarks: near 101 fwy, 15-20 mins away from SF

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Although it's not close to airport or any restaurant, but it has free shuttle to airport. Free Wi-Fi and free parking also. Even better than the Hilton in the financial district. I definitely would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely competent and helpful. They upgraded our room to a King Suite with a spectacular bay view, gave us directions and visitors tips. The room had everything we needed and then some.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff, mini frig and microwave, view, exercise room, pool, nice quality personal items in bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: coffee pot instead of the individual cup brewing system. free breakfast vouchers
review.locationRemarks: Muir Woods, Lombard Street, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Presidio, Museums, China Town, Trolley Ride, Coit Tower, Ghardelli, Boudin

review.title: Nice & clean!
review.reviewText: Convenient with great airport shuttle service. Front desk staff was very nice. Will definitely stay there when flying out of SFO.

I had a positive experience at this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The gentlemen at the front desk were so accommodating. They even had first aid supplies on hand when I needed them. The shuttle was efficient and on time. I will definitely recommend the Brisbane Radisson.

review.title: More than expected
review.reviewText: This hotel was located close to candlestick which is why we choose it however it ended up being a great stay. Very quite with a nice bar/ restaurant downstairs. Hotel staff was amazing got help with early check in and just the room we needed.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: This was the first time that we stayed at this location and we were pleasantly surprised on how close to everything this location was.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Staff, Clean and Comfortable Beds!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Hotel was close to Candlestick Stadium
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at your hotel, convenient to airport. Xebec restaurant had good breakfast and dinner menus.

review.title: Great property and best value
review.reviewText: Everyone was very nice and accommodating. Had dinner and breakfast in restaurant and everything was great.

review.title: Awesome only one night.
review.reviewText: Great service! Great restaurant! Great staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing but it could be cheaper
review.locationRemarks: 49 er game

review.title: Nice hotel. Good People Sleep # Beds 0
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. After sleeping on the Sleep Number Bed, there is no way I would ever purchase one.
review.negativeRemarks: Next time no sleep # beds
review.locationRemarks: Sfo Airport location handy to explore SF and a head start to points south.

review.title: close to san fransisco
review.reviewText: room was roomy & quiet
review.negativeRemarks: everyting was great
review.locationRemarks: the location was close to san fransisco. good value for the money.

review.reviewText:
The only problem I had was that the button for "Wake-up Call" didn't work. I went to the front desk and told clerk who immediately set wake-up call. I don't know whether it was the phone or me, but it was taken care up.

Otherwise, the stay was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet - No traffic noise.
review.locationRemarks: I was there on a business trip, so didn't do anything. I arrived about 8:00 p.m. and left at 7:30 a.m.

review.title: Great Nights Stay
review.reviewText: Spent one night in the hotel before flying out of SF the next day. Had a very enjoyable experience. The room was quite, faced the bay and had a relaxing nights sleep. The restaurant was first class and had a wonderful experience with excellent service. Not your typical hotel close to the airport. Would recommend for a longer stay if visiting SF again.

review.title: Bumped by the airline.
review.reviewText: Called after midnight. They arranged a nice room with a late checkout. Ended up extending through expedia... good rate and smooth transition. We will stay again!

review.title: A very nice first class hotel
review.reviewText: It was a only a one night stay for us but enjoyed every minute of it. We upgraded to this hotel and got what we expected and not dissappointed. Wish that we could have stayed longer and enjoy the facility like the gym, pool, and restaurant/bar. If you like to sleep like most of us, this is the hotel. The rooms comes with a Sleep Number bed and luxirious bedding which makes for very good night's sleep. The location is also very nice and located on the bay shore away from the congestion and noise of the city. You can take a peaceful walk and see the view of the bay and city from this hotel. You do need to drive a short distance to get to restaurants or shopping but that's a fair exchange with what comes with this hotel. Once in the SF area, there's unlimited venues of anything you want.
review.positiveRemarks: Fast check-in, friendly staff, Sleep Number bed and bedding was heavenly, nice new furnishings, fast elevators, plenty of safe, lighted, free parking
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary breakfast would be nice considering the rate that we paid. Even a coffee and breakfast pastry stand in the lobby would be cool.
review.locationRemarks: Uncongested & peaceful, freeway close, nestled on the bay shore, nice view, just 5 miles to SF with unlimited restaurant/shopping awaits

review.title: Hotel with spectacular view
review.reviewText: This hotel is adjacent to the Brisbane Marina and in the center of some of the most spectacular scenic views of the Bay Area. If you stroll along the walkway at the Marina, you will see Mt. Diablo, Oakland Bay, East Bay, San Mateo bridge, South San Francisco, Daly City and Brisbane. You will encounter wildlife i.e. wild rabbits, different species of bird. Its a beautiful relaxing walk. The hotel staff is fabulous. The restaurant, Xebec is also highly recommended. The food is good and the prices are not too terribly expensive. The only derogatory remark that I have of the hotel is that the maid/housekeeper forgot to change the sheets from the previous guests and I had to request sheets in the late night, When I was ready to lay down to sleep, I noticed the stench from the sheets and the stains. It was quite disappointing and do not really know how it could've been missed. Oh well, maybe the person was having an off day! Overall, my stay was ok.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful and friendly. Xebec was good and served all meals, but some may find it a bit costly; however, the service was great
review.negativeRemarks: The maids/housekeeper need to be reminded to replace the sheets with fresh new ones. My room's sheets were not changed from the former guests.
review.locationRemarks: The location is fabulous. Easy access to the Hwy 101. The walking path on the Brisbane Marina is spectacular.

review.title: Quick Visit
review.reviewText: For the short time that I was there the staff was excellent, very friendly and helpful. I had made an error and they assisted me seamlessly no hassle. Highly recommended!

review.title: Easy to find
review.reviewText: I love the size of the room and how nice the hotel was. Staff was extremely friendly! Thank you!

review.title: A very clean hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, our stay was very pleasant. We were there for 5 nights. The rooms were clean, but the bathrooms were a tad outdated and in need of a reno. First day, there was a mix up with our room...we had a couple walk right into our room! We reported it to the front desk and they gave us a new room card. The disappointing thing was the young girl who served us did not apologize, but you can tell clearly someone made a mistake and assigned the same room to two different parties. They gave us two complimentary drink coupons later for the inconvenience, but the bar lounge staff that served us was not knowledgeable and quite rude about the use of the complimentary drinks.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms. Beds were a tad too soft.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing around us...out in the boomies, but close enough to get to the downtown core...roughly 20 minutes.

review.title: AAU greet and meet.
review.reviewText: Went with my son to visit a potential college in downtown S.F. The hotel was convenient to the downtown by car (not sure if shuttles were an option), and very comfortable in a very quiet and beautiful area. Walking trails are available right outside the door along the bay. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly stuff and clean rooms nice location, value of money

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Only downside: have to get on freeways to get anywhere, no convenience store near by, and little hotel store was very expensive.

review.title: Close to airport and very comfortable
review.reviewText: Only one night on our way back home. They upgraded us to the top floor which was great. Very nice comfortable sleep number beds and a great room size and nice TV. Restaurant was quite good.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, clean and comfortable room to make the flight home more comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel, next to the airport
review.reviewText: Great and inexpensive hotel, next to the airport. Free and often complimentary shuttle service. Great restaurant. Excellent service.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It was exactly what a person who needs to stay next to the airport needs.
review.locationRemarks: Great view to the bay. The airport is 10 minutes away with the free shuttle service.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, better than expected restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: not much nearby.

review.title: Great hotel but shuttle horrible
review.reviewText: The room, bed and service was perfect. The shuttle to the airport great. The pick up horrible. I waited 45 minutes watching other hotels pick up 2 to 4 times. I was alone so had to make my way to the service phone with my suitcase since phone was dead. I had a timetable which said no need to call the always come. By NOT. Should have been every 20 minutes. The hotel had to call the shuttle to find out where he was, he was at the first pick up which means I should have been picked up 10 minutes ago and 30 minutes ago. They do not circle the international section of airport. He picked up at least 10 of us. Not happy still had a 3 hour drive home and it was after 7 pm.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Just needed a ride to sirport and back thought they would be convenient will go somewhere else next time

review.title: Nice hotel close to stadium, lacks nearby eating
review.reviewText: Staff really nice food really great at bar but the beer was a lil warm. Needs more nearby restaurants/bars.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Nice accomodations,everything was neat and clean.Courteous and helpful.Provided information and answered our questions.Had nice lunch in restaurant.Close to airport(10-15 minutes) and 101 which goes into San Francisco.Shuttle was timely and driver polite.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to the highway
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 2 nights. The coffeepot and refrigerator in the room were great. Also the hair dryer in the bathroom was great. Plenty of towels. The room we reserved wasn't available so we were upgraded to the suite. Very professional staff. Love that there is free Internet and no charge for parking overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: The hair dryer was coming off the wall. Seemed like there were a few maintenance things could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Our daughter lives in San Francisco and we were able to pick her up in the financial district from Starbucks in 15 min. Half moon bay. Muir woods.

review.title: Great location close to SFO
review.reviewText: This hotel is great for a location close to SFO with free airport shuttle running about every half hour. The room is a standard Radisson set-up with everything you need and nothing that you don't. We booked this room for much needed sleep after a looong flight from Dubai to Singapore to Seoul to San Francisco. The pool is indoor so the water temp is not too cold. The hot tub isn't too hot. The small gym is adequate. We had dinner in the on-site restaurant and it was ok. Not great, but the food was hot and tasty.
review.locationRemarks: There not much of anything within walking distance. They have a shuttle to a shopping area, but we didn't use it.

review.title: Beautiful room but bring your own food
review.reviewText: Everything is greAt except nowhere to eat after 9pm so bring your own food if you plan on eating late night snack. Pool and bar close early too so be prepared. And make sure u fuel up if low on gas cuz that can be hard to find somwhere close to get gas. A little overpriced for being so far away from shopping or retail businesses or restaurants but bed is so so comfy its wortg it.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Went to SF on business and stayed at Radisson for 4 nights. Room was clean, service was good as well. It's not close to anything so be sure to have a vehicle.
review.positiveRemarks: Bartender Mark. Also the hotel was clean, the service was good and the restaurant had good food. Restaurant and bar pricing wasn't fantastic, however.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't really think of anything. It was a hotel where we slept.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do near by. Everything required a car.

review.title: Good hotel close to ST international airport
review.reviewText:
Reception staff very helpful
Not so the restaurant waiters who seemed to eager to remove your starter in order to bring on the next course.
Easy and free parking also complementary wi fi
Would definitely use again if in the area.

review.title: Convenient and expedient shuttle service to airpor
review.reviewText: Hotel staff friendly and efficient. Shuttle on time and according to schedule provided.

review.title: Nice staff. Comfy beds
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and the beds here are really comfy. It's close to the airport and only 10-15 minutes from the heart of the city.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I thought I was in Marriott once we entered the room. Free wifi!

review.title: Great hotel in bay area close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed recently during the Americas Cup weekend. The hotel is in great shape and rooms are spot on with views of the bay. The staff are very helpful, polite and always eager to assist. The restaurant downstairs serves good breakfast and dinner at a reasonable price. The complimentary shuttle to the airport was a great help to catch the BART to the city. Complimentary wifi in room worked very well.

review.title: Lots of restaurant around
review.reviewText:
Close to lots of places to visit and good access to bus and train.

You can walk to Hockey stadium and lot of restaurant along the way
review.negativeRemarks: Try to get vegrant people away from park outside of hotel, always begging.

review.title: Excellant
review.reviewText: Very convenient for an early flight. Staff great and restaurant very good

review.title: Very good business hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were quite good. Unfortunately, we had a very unpleasant experience with the hotel's airport shuttle. After waiting nearly 30 minutes for the shuttle at the airport and then collecting a full load of travelers, the driver (a trainee) and the trainer decided it was time to fuel up. No announcement was made. We ended up driving to a natural gas fueling station and waited several minutes for an outlet. Then they shut off the van, and more importantly the air conditioning, then exited the van without opening any windows or doors. After several minutes I opened the driver and passenger doors, much to the relief of all of us. There were no apologies when the trainee and trainer returned. Not a pleasant experience after a day's travel. But again, the staff and facilities were very nice.

review.title: Nice view from dining room with incredible pizza
review.reviewText: Super happy hour specials with great appetizers. Quiet spacious room and comfortable pillows and bed

review.title: Cheap hotel stay before flight back
review.reviewText:
Tired, rough around the edges and in need of an update but cheap and convenient for SFO.

Friendly staff, about 15-20 mins trip to Airport from Hotel via free shuttle service. From there you can catch BART into town, although I wouldn't recommend this hotel as a base to visit San Francisco downtown simply because it's too far.

Chose to stay as we were flying out from SFO the next day which made it convenient and a value for money option. NOTE: SFO International has really really nothing there to help pass the time other than a small SFMOMA shop landside, so this hotel came in handy to hang around in and prevent any unnecessary airport time.

Rooms have paper thin walls. They're not pleasant but not too bad.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a massive update to modernise but sure this won't happen as it has a captive audience of travellers.
review.locationRemarks: The Airport and some aeroplanes.

review.title: QUIET, CLEAN, RESTFUL
review.reviewText: HOTEL STAFF HELPFUL IN DIRECTING ME TO BART SO I COULD ENJOY SF BEFORE MEETING MY PARTY. BREAKFAST WAS REALLY GOOD BUT NOT INCLUDED IN PRICE OF ROOM. COMFORTABLE, QUIET ROOM WITH USUAL AMENITIES. CONNECTED TO SFO BY VAN WHICH COMES AT FREQUENT ENOUGH INTERVALS.
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: HOTEL IS NEAR A LARGE PARK BUT IT'S HARD TO GET TO BECAUSE IT'S ACROSS A FREEWAY.

review.title: Good location for SF stay if flying or by car
review.reviewText: The front desk welcome was great, and was contrasted by the distinct lack of service in the restaurant. The room was fine but the big problem was getting to the hotel! There were no directions on the hotel website for getting there by car, so we did not know which turn off to take from the highway. It looked like 425c on google, but that did not exist going north. Going south was not much easier either. The hotel might get more customers if it had directions on its website for finding the place! Management take note!
review.negativeRemarks: the distinct lack of service in the restaurant. There were no directions on the hotel website for getting there by car!
review.locationRemarks: Very hard to find & nothing to do

review.title: Good airport location but far from action
review.reviewText:
This hotel is great location if you need to be near the airport or the football stadium.
However it is far from downtown where all the action is. There is no public transportation from there.
We were giving the designated disable room which has no counter space in the bathroom and view onto a cement wall. So disappointed.
The concierge was wonderful and helpful. The best part of our stay.

review.title: second visit to this hotel
review.reviewText: good location for the airport and the city. Second visit to this hotel although evening meal was spoiled by delay due to a 20 person party being catered for despite restaurant being half empty. This was a one off as we have eaten there before with no issues and good food.

review.title: Nice quiet hotel.
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel. it was clean and quiet. The staff are very nice. After driving 5 hours, it was nice sleeping in a comfortable bed. The a/c was kind of loud and we could not control it very well however, we opened the window as much as it would open, and we did not need the a/c any more. The location of the hotel is good because we were close enough to every thing. The good part of it is that it is very close to the freeway exit, which means, you don't have to drive all across narrow streets and look for names to get to this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Not to far from actually any thing and any where!

review.title: eazy off from htghway
review.reviewText: staff extremely helpful and kind, helped us with our airline tickets and luggage. repairman was kind and prompt in solving our room problem.
review.negativeRemarks: everything was more than we could ask, our heat didnt work properly so they upgraded our room to a sleep no. bedroom which was greatshuttle to the ai
review.locationRemarks: the train service is nearby if a person wants to go to sanfrancisco

review.title: Great attention by the staff
review.reviewText: I was disappointed to find out that there wasn't a hotel connected to the airport since my flight arrived at 11 PM, but this is one of the nicest Radissons I've stayed at. One thing they need to work on is that they only have one shuttle running and it took about 30 minutes waiting while I watched several of the other area hotels come 2-3 times, but I will say that the front desk staff was tremendous! When I called to inquire about the shuttle after 15 minutes, they truthfully told me that it would be another 15 minutes, and apologized and took my info over the phone to check all of my party in so we would not have a wait when we arrived. Upon arrival my room was ready & I had been upgraded. I will stay here again, but next time I will check on the shuttle from baggage claim and if I've already missed it- I will take a taxi...
review.negativeRemarks: They need an additional shuttle. the wait was too long.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport and a nice view of the water.

review.title: Convenient hotel for airport
review.reviewText: 20 minutes using transfer service from airport terminal. Hotel clean and staff helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: No room service in the evening
review.locationRemarks: Location convenient for airport but otherwise not an attractive part of town and little else to do it seems

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: We wre able to check in early without a problem. They also upgraded us to a bay view room. The food was good in the restaurant- especially the bread.

review.title: Football weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and clean. Staff was friendly but overwhelmed when it was busy. The rooms were great and the beds were awesome. The public transportation in San Francisco is great, but cabs and shuttles are the worst I've ever dealt with. I would stay in Fishermans Warf area if you want walk to shops and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff was friendly, but extremely unorganized.

review.title: Very good place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for two days. Staff was very good. The place is clean and comfortable.

review.title: Hotel in nice area.
review.reviewText: Was a very pleasant stay as always. Only down side was that our dinner took a very long time to be prepared and served to us. However, the restaurant did comp our meal for that night.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is close to airport and candlestick stadium.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at this time.
review.locationRemarks: Candlestick park nearby to attend football game.

review.title: Our stay was okay.
review.reviewText: The room was fine, there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom which led to a very humid room. The bar was fine, but the restaurant was less than average - large portions, poor taste.
review.positiveRemarks: Ease of check in and check out. Parking was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant leaves MUCH to be desired
review.locationRemarks: None.

review.title: Hotel staff was perfect.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was perfect. Got the room with the sleep number bed. Don't like the sleep number bed it's not for me. Just a over priced air mattress. But the hotel was on point. Clean, great bar and food. Location was also good close to stadium and they had a shuttle that was cheaper than parking or taking a cab. Traffic is horrible after game. So being that close is a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of sleep number beds
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: Nice hotel by the bay, about 7.5 miles from city
review.reviewText:
2nd stay. Great experience. Pool & jaccuzi just perfect for me & my daughter. My parents love this hotel. We had partial mountain & view of the fwy. We like the convenience of having a refrigerator & a mini microwave & the coffee maker in the room. Room service was great. We had some appetizers reasonably priced & tasted great. We were too tired to drive out to eat so this was perfect.
Beds & pillows were comfortable. Room rate was on a Saturday night so I figured it was a little bit much but we had a great stay so that's that. Staff was nice & friendly. Free coffee, some fruits & some breakfast bars were offered in the lobby in the morning. I thought that was a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: We love the indoor pool & jacuzzi & it was open till 10:00 pm so that's nice. Perfect water temperature for a night swim. Free water & coffee in room
review.negativeRemarks: Can leave a note stating complimentary water or coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Would have loved to visit Alcatraz but maybe on our next visit. Lots of things to do around the area.

review.title: Nice hotel near San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: Was looking for our last night in San Francisco to be closed to the airport and at cheaper rate. Met all my criterias. Also had dinner at the hotel and it was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near to the airport and shuttle availability from and to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: We had to wait 40 minutes for shuttle at the airport to get to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Room was nice, bathroom was comfortable however sleep number beds could be improved. The beds seemed older and not as comfortable as expected.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and there were two queen size beds in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds.
review.locationRemarks: Highway entrance is close by. It's right by the bay so when you leave your hotel there's nice scenery to check out.

review.title: Good hotel near SF Airport
review.reviewText: had a pleasant and nice stay, would definitely book at this hotel again if I visited SF. Staff was super friendly and nice. Room was really spacious and comfortable with lots of amenities i.e. refrigerator, microwave, etc.
review.locationRemarks: near SF Airport but if you have a car, it is within driving distance to downtown SF, the only bad thing is paying for parking.

review.title: convenient, clean stopover
review.reviewText: check in was efficient. dining options are limited in the area. the happy hour menu is good if you are there at the right time.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the hotel's effort to be energy efficient and environmentally conscious. They offer choices for the guest.
review.locationRemarks: great location for people using SFO or a stop over before going into the city of SF. Numerous public transportation options are available.

review.title: Don't worry about the Airport noise! Quiet
review.reviewText: Absolutely quiet rooms. Great beds, frig in room. We stayed in 3 different hotels in the San Fran area and this by far was our favorite. The beds were much better than other hotels. No airport noise at all
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of the room, staff was great. Towels were much nicer than usual hotel ones. Just overall our fav out of the three!
review.locationRemarks: This was just a quick one night on our trip.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Expedia Traveler,

Thank you for recognizing the quality of our hotel and how our friendly staff keeps the property cleaned. I apologize that we did not have a perfectly operating Sleep Number Bed and regret not know or repairing this before or during your stay. Given our staff’s commitment to details, I am certain you, your family or friend’s next visit to our property will be outstanding, see you soon.

Todd Neuenschwander
General Manager

review.title: Nice Hotel, but.................
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but.......The Sleep Number Bed did not work and we had the worst night sleep immagenable.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Sleep Number Bed did not function properly
review.locationRemarks: Near airport

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very near airport. Excellent shuttle service. Very clean room and friendly staff.

review.title: This is an excellent location just north of SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient to downtown, easily reaches excellent restaurants in South SF and is great for that one night stand type trip to SF
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was courteous, property was clean and no airport noise.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, quiet location, clean room (and overall building), great customer service.

What more can you ask for?
review.negativeRemarks: Not mush to say about improvements...maybe, better selection of food in the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: One Night Stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the location of the hotel and some of the amenities; however, our sleep number bed remote did not work (yes, we should have called for maintenance, but it was too late) and the main problem was that there was no bathroom fan at all. There were no windows we could open for ventilation. It was disappointing because we expected a little more from the Radisson.
review.negativeRemarks: See above

review.title: So So Hotel
review.reviewText: It was fine, clean enough and everything went well. Was just disappointed at the quality for the price paid. That said, I would still stay there again if needed, but I would probably look for another place first.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms seem run down

review.title: We enjoyed a very comfortable 1 night stay.
review.reviewText: Hard to locate the hotel, suggest more directions, otherwise very nice as advertised.
review.negativeRemarks: We needed directions for off ramps ets.

review.title: Excellent airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed the day before we flew back to uk
Caters vry well for the traveler
Good free shuttle to and from the airport
Good bar restuarnts not overly priced
Would happily stay again
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do if you don't have car.

review.title: Nice hotel but far from San Francisco centre
review.reviewText: Good hotel but if you don't have your own transport it is very far out !
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport which is a plus! However again about 20 minutes from tourist attractions

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: When they found out I had just gotten out of the hospital two weeks earlier, they were very nice.

review.title: Close to the city and airport
review.reviewText: Accommodation were excellent everything you needed was there
review.positiveRemarks: Everything you needed was there Did not have to drive to get a bite to eat

review.title: the rooms were comfortable
review.reviewText: comfortable rooms were very clean, the restaurant very good for any time, good staff attention

review.title: Nice hotel near to the airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel is close to the airport and has a free shuttle running every 30 mins, it's quite with really nice views of the bay. The hotel is clean and staff are excellent
This is a great place to stay if you don't wan to drive or pay for parking in San Fransico. You can get the free shuttle then take the BART to the centre of the city, this takes about 45mins from the hotel and is $8.25 each way. If you get want to o to Alcatraz book in advance we could not go because it was fully booked up for the next 2 weeks.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle and free parking, view of the lake

review.title: Radisson San Francisco Bay Front
review.reviewText: I had stayed in that hotel before on the bay side and was very pleased. But was deceived the second time, the room I had on the other side and was noisy from highway 101 too close!
review.positiveRemarks: Location very convenient & Bay side quiet
review.negativeRemarks: Highway 101 noise in the room with window closed on one side of the hotel

review.title: Poor services
review.reviewText: Service from airport is very poor it took an hour and all the other hotel shuttles arrived 5 times.

review.title: Problems solved, with a smile
review.reviewText:
We had some issues the first night.. they switched rooms for us and solved them all. (no microwave, uncomfortable sleep number bed, non-working phones, pool too cool, and a poorly working fridge). They took my complaints with genuine concern - they even summoned d the head engineer - and gave me a new room with a smile. Everything worked perfectly in that one, the real mattress was comfortable, and the pool was a better temp too. We ended up staying a third night, on which I made a mistake booking the reservation, and the hotel and expedia waived the chang fees as I called immeadiately.
Not all rooms have microwaves since the remodel.
There are no grocery stores for 7 miles.
No gas stations within 4 miles.
review.negativeRemarks: sleep number bed. Virtually no padding between air bladder and sleeping surface
review.locationRemarks: 12 minutes to sf. no gas or groceries nearby

review.title: Reasonable hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very professional, polite and friendly. The room was clean, nicely sized, and well appointed. We stayed there for 3 nights, and had no problems with the room or the staff. The only drawback was that the shuttle between the airport and the hotel was not convenient late at night. We were relying on it for transportation and it didn't come 2 nights in a row. The 1st night, we called the hotel and they sent someone right away, but the 2nd night we just took a cab.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness of the room and the friendliness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle from the airport to the hotel late at night didn't come two nights in a row, but we called and they sent someone to get us.

review.title: Nice hotel and friendly staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff upgraded us for free to a beautiful room with an amazing view. They are very welcoming and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Making the most of SFO at leisure
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely comfortable and although out of central SFO the free shuttle bus service to the airport BART station provided and excellent and easy way of getting into town without needing to worry about parking. Having a car the free parking available was a big money saver and made us feel like our rental vehicle was very secure. The overall staff were friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were really comfortable and there was no traffic nose. Really slept well!!
review.locationRemarks: Great having the free shuttle bus to take us to the Airport BART station. Made getting into central SFO easy and cost effective.

review.title: quite good hotel
review.reviewText: Thanks for Roxy, and guy I forgot his name he was the guy with a mustache, working the morning of July 11th. both of them worked at front desk, they did their best to meet customer's requirement. Appreciated their service.
review.positiveRemarks:
Front desk customer service.
Computer Room & convenient kitchen
review.negativeRemarks: It will be better, if the paper towel has more than half roll in the convenient kitchen

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: very nine hotel in past all we has been stay. good sleep and stay.

review.title: So comfortable
review.reviewText: We were so exhausted after a really long trip and the Radisson was what we needed! We recommend this hotel!

review.title: Great hotel - terrible bed
review.reviewText: great hotel but they need to upgrade the beds - our felt as if the Radison number beds lost their inflate and rather than replace them they just let the air out. the number one reason you stay in a hotel is to get a nice bed and a comfortable sleep. This hotel has everything but that - weird how they got so much right and this one basic thing so wrong - I stay in hotels about 75 nights a year - this was simply the worst mattress I have ever slept on.
review.positiveRemarks: new feel - renovated - excellent service to the hotel from airport
review.negativeRemarks: the bed is terrible
review.locationRemarks: great - about 10 minutes from airport

review.title: A good base!
review.reviewText:
A great hotel, friendly staff, free shuttle to the airport making it perfect for using the BART to get to the center of SFO or straight to your flight.you can check in and print boarding passes at the hotel too.
Food excellent and i thought reasonable in price.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy with the road and nothing much to walk out to other than marina.
review.locationRemarks: Business area , no walkable shops or restaurants but ideal for the airport

review.title: A Stopover
review.reviewText: A very good experience pleasant helpful staff, good transport system to and from airport. Good food everything smart and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Bill
review.locationRemarks: Convenient.

review.title: Room had a wonderful view. Better than I expected
review.reviewText: Nice room. Great view and Craftmatic adjustable bed was a nice surprise.
review.locationRemarks: 2 exits away from candlestick park

review.title: Good for overnight prior to flying out of SFO
review.reviewText: Air conditioner was quite loud. Walls were not well sound insulated; could hear people talking and baby crying in the next room. Reason for selection was proximity to airport; shuttle was efficient and large. No other facilities within walking distance. Cookies on check-in were tasty. Coffee, tea, and fruit were in the lobby in the morning. Newer facility. Staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise transmission through wall.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport with complimentary shuttle. No other stores or food/beverage service within walking distance except for the Hilton.

review.title: My stay
review.reviewText: Clean close to airport and San Francisco. Quiet also.
review.positiveRemarks: Price and beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Fan in bathroom did not work

review.title: tourist
review.reviewText: Affortable prices, however, they should have informed us about their hotel construction. We were supriced about the noise and dust of their construction. The room itself was very clean, no complaint what so ever.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely view of the bay and convenient to freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Always notify guests of all the potential major constructions so guests won't be suprise when they arrive at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Sight-seing of San Francisco Bay and Golden Gate, and Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to freeway, very quiet.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay very much, would definitely stay here again. Only ten minuets to downtown S.F., can't beat the price and free parking!!! On checking in, the man behind the counter was going through the motions, not very friendly. When I asked if they had any rooms with a sofa bed, he replied Embassy Suites has rooms like that..... We got our room, nice, great view, at the end of hall, Perfect! Then we found the carpet under the air conditioner was soaked. We called the front desk, within 10 minutes they had changed our room, just as perfect as the last and gave us complimentary breakfast!!!! WOW that was really nice!!! The beds were way comfy and I think that was the first time staying at a hotel where I wasn't awake all night with the noise, very quiet!! Love that!!
review.positiveRemarks: Smelled clean when we walked in. Comfortable, quiet, nice amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Friendlier staff upon check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to freeway, not much near by, but close to S.F.

review.title: nice, remodeling though
review.reviewText: hotel is nice but in the throws of remodeling floors, rugs
review.negativeRemarks: hotel under construction, not really any problems with that other than hottub closed intermitti
review.locationRemarks: really not as close to downtown as mentioned at least from a taxi stanpoint...50.00 cab ride to downtown, shuttle and bart available.

review.title: Good value and handy for SF if you have a car.
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights to explore San Francisco. We had a car so we drove in early and found parking easily. We were told that you can also get their free shuttle bus to the airport, quite close by, then take the train straight into SF. We ate in the hotel when we first arrived and the food was good but a little expensive. The room was very nice, everything you would want, clean and a good size.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable, spacious room. Generally a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: They kept removing the carpets, then cleaning the new ones with very noisy machines!
review.locationRemarks: About 15 minutes drive from SF, or you can get a train from the airport. Nothing much within walking distance of the hotel.

review.title: Nice, clean hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Good nights sleep after a long day (over 8 hours) of flying!!

review.title: Quality not consistent
review.reviewText:
As soon as I arrived, I was bombarded with loud noise of various equipments in the entry way/reception area. Since there was no front desk in operation there, I looked around and found a small sign to proceed into the next room. The front desk personnel was handling another customer, and even after she had finished, he had started to speak to another staff though he had seen me waiting. He thought for some odd reason that I was with the lady who was just there before me. Convenient assumption.

The construction noise was loud even in my room... I went back to the front desk for the phone was not working, and they informed me that the work for today will finish in half an hour or so. That was already 8pm.

With that kind of renovation work, the customers should be notified in advance; it's not like a repair work of sort, they must have planned the work. After a long international flight and hoping to rest just overnight for another early flight in the morning, this was quite disturbing.
Also, there should have been a sign outside the entrance door, notifying of the construction and the temporary front desk location.

On top of that, the room was rather old and outdated. Clean enough, but not entirely comfortable.

Later on in my trip, I stayed at Radisson at PDX, and I had a pleasant surprise that it was much better there than this location.

It seems the brand quality is not consistent with Radisson.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: The only issues that I had with my stay were the people who were being really loud into the night in the room next door and when I asked for an extra blanket and pillow I had to call an hour later for them because they had still not arrived. Other than that, it was a pleasant experience even through the construction that was happening in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort and up to date design.
review.locationRemarks: The city is not a far cab/car ride away, but a VERY busy place.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: Good shuttle service to airport. Good airport hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Very disappointing experience
review.reviewText:
Awful experience!
I reserved and paid for a room in advance from expedia.com which listed king size with bay view cheapest rate available
Arrived as late check in due to red eye flight, hotel staff notified a few days in advance and I was not told about the renovations occurring.
Arrived at hotel around 2:30am to find the hotel in complete renovation...it was very creepy... tiles on floor being replaced with two workers, hotel room hallways on two floors completely gutted without carpet or wallpaper. I was given a room with two beds and no view. I went to exchange room for the king size with bay view and was given a king room with a view of brick wall. Wanted to stay somewhere else but no rooms available anywhere close so had to take what they gave me.
Was told later that my room was given away earlier in the day and they didn't know why. Being exhausted from long late flight and felt like I was in "Bates Hotel". Was told in the morning that I would be comped for the room which I have yet to see.
Getting to a gas station was terrible..had to get back on busy interstate and off again to gas station.
review.positiveRemarks: I wouldn't consider this a hotel ... it is a glorified motel. Not much space in bathroom and without a counter. Coffee canister dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Reserve the room for the customer that was prepaid. Inform the customer of what to expect out of the ordinary such as extensive renovations.
review.locationRemarks: Right off interstate.

review.title: close to airport:
review.reviewText: The evening we checked in, they were jackhammering the lobby floor. The checkin staff said it would be over in 15, but they worked the whole night. We had trouble finding parking if we returned late; they worked on the floor the entire 5 days we were there. Thank goodness they had finished our floor, but we saw many people staying on floors they were working on. The last full day we were there, we got back late and could not get into the room. Went down to get new keys and they told us we were supposed to have checked out that day. Our original stay was to leave the next day and they did find that in the system. The office staff did not ever apologize for the inconvenience of no parking, key problems, and why in the world they would have chosen the fourth of july weekend to do major renovations. The hotel was obviously sold out.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very nice; liked the small kitchen and location.

review.title: Family travelling.
review.reviewText: Hotel is having renovations. Lobby literally a building site as is breakfast room. We could hear the work going on all night as tiling was being done. We were however given complimentary breakfast which was fantastic quality. When the renovations are complete the hotel will be a place to revisit. We had booked adjoining rooms but were allocated rooms down the hall from each other after originally being given rooms on different floors.
review.positiveRemarks: Nicely decorated rooms and great breakfast with great breakfast staff
review.negativeRemarks: We booked 2 adjoining rooms,were allocated rooms on different floors, when I said no got rooms down the hall from each other
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Hotel rooms were very nice, quite, and clean.
review.reviewText: The loby was under construction. It was scheduled to be finished but was not, making it very dusty, and confusing to find the restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: The view of the bay. Another plus was the sleep by number bed, great night sleep. Quite.
review.locationRemarks: It was easy on and off freeways.

review.title: Dreadful - construction zone!!!
review.reviewText: Stay away from this place! It is a construction zone, with paint, plastic sheeting all over the floors, construction equipment in the corridors, and nonfunctional elevators. They do not inform you about this and charge you the full rate. The smell of paint is everywhere and they are entirely unsympathetic about their deception. Unhelpful and disgraceful behaviour. I will never stay at this chain again. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. Happy I could leave after one night.
review.negativeRemarks: The state of the hotel - the construction, carpet and tile replacement work, the strong smell of paint, etc.
review.locationRemarks: A 15 min shuttle ride from the airport.

review.title: Frequent traveler to Bay area
review.reviewText:
Renovations were going on, so some associated mess. Not an issue but would have been 5 minutes work to tidy up some of it.

Had to wait for a room to become available, would not have been a big issue except for the manner that the message was delivered "Your room is not ready, go away and come back later".

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: Very dirty and run down for Radisson. Would not stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Needed to be renovated, Microwave was from 1980s ect....
review.locationRemarks: Very good location lots of things to do next exit.

review.title: Great hotel north of SFO
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel located north of SFO. It's clean, convenient, and has a lovely view of the water. The most striking thing about this hotel is the staff. They are personable and go out of their way to be helpful. They gave me detailed directions when I called and encouraged me to "stay safe". When I arrived and asked for a "de-feathered" room, they changed the pillows and comforters immediately. Their attitude is all about comfort and convenience for the traveler which is a rare commodity today!

review.title: Clean rooms with some extra comfort features
review.reviewText:
An entrance to 101 north is maybe 200 feet from the hotel. SFO is 10 minutes away, downtown SF is 10-15 minutes away. No access to public transportation, (bart, caltrain) but there may be shuttles.

Rooms are exceptionally clean. They feature sleep number king sized beds which was an unexpected surprise. Room came with a microwave and a little kitchenette.

The hotel lobby and common areas were undergoing renovation which was a little inconvenient. Bar was closed for a bit, gym wasn't available, etc. Pool is small. Hot tub can only accomodate 3-4 comfortably.

Restaurant service was decent, so was the food. Prices were a bit high for quality received.
review.positiveRemarks: Sleep number beds, close to freeway
review.negativeRemarks: pool, restaurant quality
review.locationRemarks: An entrance to 101 north is maybe 200 feet from the hotel. SFO is 10 minutes away, downtown SF is 10-15 minutes away. No access to public transportati

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great location, close to airport. Great quality hotel.

review.title: Nice staff.
review.reviewText: Room is clean and nice, the hotel staff I dealt with was fantastic. I would like to stay in this hotel next time again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Quiet and nice hotel which close to SF airport. Good location both to airport and downtown
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: San Francsico vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel was undergoing major construction making our stay unpleasant. Very dusty, loud and confusing traffic patterns. Two out of three elevators were reserved for construction. The hotel may be nice in the future but that doesn't help our stay.

review.title: Remodel
review.reviewText: If you don't mind being part of a remodel then enjoy! We had to walk around workers, no carpet, no tile, no wallpaper, mislabeled hallways, don't mind the noise of a jack hammer, and had to use only one of the three elevators due to construction then have a great time!
review.negativeRemarks: Let us know prior to making a reservation they are remodeling.

The hotel is very well located and the room was perfect for our needs. Dinner in the restaurant was vey good ,complimented by attentive staff and a wide ranging menu. Overall a fine well run hotel.

review.title: nice hotel, but be prepared to buy expensive food!
review.reviewText:
The staff were quite friendly and helpful, although they seemed to be understaffed when we checked in. We had stopped by that morning to drop off our luggage (too early to check in) and spend the day in San Francisco. It was nice that we could store our luggage even before we checked in, but when we finally did check in around 8pm, we had to wait 20 min or so for someone to retrieve our luggage because the staff were busy checking in other people. The guy who finally came to help us did apologize sincerely, but it was irritating after a long day.

The floor we stayed on was being renovated, so walls on every part of the hallway were down to the sheetrock with strips of old glue, so that wasn't what you would expect for the price. There were chocolates on the beds (one on each bed), which the kids were excited about, but when they unwrapped them, it was obvious that the chocolate was quite old, and it tasted stale.

All that said, the room was well insulated and clean, and we didn't hear any noises to bother us in the night. The bathroom was a good size, and the shower worked well. There was a lot of room to spread out and use laptops, and the wi-fi worked well.

But be prepared to bring your own food or buy it in their overpriced restaurant. We dropped over $40 on breakfast - one cup of coffee, one waffle, one stack of 3 pancakes, and two orders of scrambled eggs, toast & breakfast potatoes.

Checkout was easy and quick.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Easy access to SFO for those early-morning flights. I was able to park my car on the premises for the 6-day duration of my trip. I do think, however, that the Radisson needs to just offer *free* parking in its lot and not pester the client with questions as to whether a "package" was bought online.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: I went to run the SF Marathon and stayed at the Radisson by the airport. The rooms were very clean, staff were very helpful and kind. I appreciated the free shuttle to the airport where I was able to jump on to the bart into downtown. One night we took the wrong bart and last shuttle pickup was at 12am, I called the hotel and they contacted the driver to be aware that we were arriving late so he can wait. That was a plus.. Very quite and peaceful hotel, just what I needed after a 26.2 mile run. I will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are very clean, comftorble and staff were very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't complain had such a great experience.
review.locationRemarks: I liked the location, away from the busy streets and noise. It's nice to leave your car and jump on the bart.

review.title: Marathon weekend
review.reviewText: Had a great stay and got lots of rest night before marathon. Had late check out with out a problem and staff was great too!
review.locationRemarks: Close to down town

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: We stayed one night, it was the nicest of the hotels we stayed at in California, but it was a little more expensive than the other two hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Price was a bit high.

review.title: Great Place to stay.
review.reviewText:
The hotels at Fisherman's wharf were too costly so we chose to stay out by the airport for less than half the nightly rate. The drive into downtown is only about 10 minutes and access to the freeway is easy. Parking is free at this hotel.
Parking at pier 39 tops out a $40/day which is less than what some of the downtown hotels charge per day.
We would definitely stay here again. Rooms were quiet and clean. Beds were comfortable. Cleaning staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Comfortable, quiet room, pleasant staff, and convenient shuttle ride to the airport. We arrived early enough to just chill out in the room, repack and savor memories of our trip. The hotel gave us a chance to do that. We'd stay there again.

review.title: Affordable Lodging in SF
review.reviewText:
Note: This might show up under my husband's name, and I can't seem to control that. I'm a grandma!

Excellent location, affordable in SF, large comfortable room for my daughter, my little grandson, and me over Mother's Day Weekend. Sleep Number beds were very comfortable. The swimming pool was closed for renovations, but we were allowed to use the pool at the adjacent hotel. Special note: the hotel delivered a Mother's Day treat to our room, which was very much appreciated! I will be happy to stay here again when I visit SF again.

review.title: Wouldn't return.
review.reviewText:
Stayed on our final night in California, pending flight from SFO. Chose this hotel due to being a reasonable brand plus free transfers to the airport. Think they knew we'd booked via Expedia due to the pokey room they gave us right behind the elevator meaning lift noises through the night.

The beds in our room came with a control panel to adjust comfort, but the control pad was clearly broken as it required some manipulation to work, very comfortable when it was set up though.

Final disappointment in the morning when the breakfast was not complimentary, our fault for not checking but surely this can be the only hotel in America that doesn't throw a few cereals & coffee out in the morning time?

We stayed at the Millwood Inn & Suites just down the road on our arrival night in SFO and in every respect they were better than the Radisson, price; comfort; breakfast. Please do consider this latter option as a good quality, local, independent alternative.
review.positiveRemarks:
The bed was very comfy when setup correctly.
Extremely close to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks:
Only fancy paid-for breakfast available.
Not enough coffee provided in room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport with connecting shuttle very convenient. Thus some intrusive aircraft noise, not the most relaxing hotel ever.

review.title: Good place to stay

The rooms were nice and clean. The sit down breakfast was good also but priced for business people. There a great little breakfast place across the highway with great chocolate croissants and egg and cheese croissants. we went there for breakfast.

The hotel is very convenient to hwy 101, easy on and off so getting into San Francisco is convenient by car. There are no BART or CAL Train stations within walking distance though.
