review.title: Best place to stay on the close outskirts of San F
review.reviewText:
Fabulous hotel to stay at if you are visiing San Francisco. There is a regular shuttler buis to the International Airport and the BART from there into the centre of the city. We are seniors and we got a discounted $9 each return from the airport to the city.
The hotel is fantastic and as we were Club Carlon members we got an upgrade to the 8th floor (executive). The restaurant here is 5 star with a superb choice of meals.
Disappointed that the pool was under renovation during our 4 day stay but overall; we could not fault this hotel.
Just one thing, beware of the sprinklers if you are waiting early in the morning for the shuttle bus. They come on with warning and drench the space underneath the awning at the entrance.
review.negativeRemarks: Sprinklers near the entrance
review.locationRemarks: So easy to ride get into San Francisco and a 10 m in shuttle bus ride to the International airport

review.title: Easy and stylish
review.reviewText: Easy to find and easy to travel from. I've stayed here several times over the years and its still my favourite when arriving from Europe. Next to 101 and five minutes from the airport by rental car. Tasty food and a good nights rest before sightseeing or business. Gorgeous outlook over the bay.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway, with great outlook across the bay

review.title: Clean & spacious but uncaring employees & isolated
review.reviewText:
Pros: The hotel is clean, large rooms, location within 4 miles of SFO's rental car return building.

Cons:
1. Staff was not rude but not friendly, either. The woman who checked me in utterred only a few mono-syllabic questions and ignored my questions..
2. At 3:30 AM, there was a fire alarm that continued for 20 minutes. Most guest left the hotel and sat in their cars (it was a cold night with a strong wind blowing. Many other guest gathered in the lobby or in other spaces on the first floor. Firemen and police came looked around briefly, and went. During the entire episode, no hotel employee was in evidence nor, more importantly, did any employee, fireman, or policeman make ANY announcements.
3. The hotel is located in an office park to the East of Hwy 101. There is a restaurant in the hotel but no other businesses located less than a 10-minute drive away.
4. The hotel's Web site, and Expedia, neglected to mention that the Fitness Room and Swimming Pool had been closed for renovations for some time.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, spacious rooms, convenient parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Unfriendly employees and the fact that the fitness room and swimming pool were closed.
review.locationRemarks: In an office park distant from stores, restaurants and businesses.

review.title: Restaurant inside horrible. Gives bad reputation.
review.reviewText: I liked that the bedding and towels where white so that you are able to tell they are clean. However the restaurant in Radisson-Xebec was horrible. Do not eat there! My friend and I went there for breakfast. We were starving and weren't planning on leavin the hotel until later in the evening. We sat down and glasses on the table were dirty. One cup had lip marks, the other had crumbs or particles of something. We were grossed out. So then I asked for another cup. My orange juice came and it tasted thick and old or something was WRONG. The waiter brought my friend a soda she ordered and there was a CHUNK of food floating at the top. She brought it back to him and he was irritated we kept going up to him. He didn't even care! He was just staring at the cup like he never saw a cup before. He was very rude and inconsiderate and didn't care he lost customers. So as we were leaving a lady asked us what happened. We told her and she said that she was the supervisor and that she has been trying to get her crew to have teamwork, pay attention to detail, and to bleach stuff. So what the hell else isn't clean?! Just because we're young(I'm 21) doesn't mean you can't take me seriously or tell me things like that. It's disgusting.
review.positiveRemarks: The view was nice, spacious room.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant. No other restaurants nearby. Big inconvenience since the restaurant in hotel sucks.
review.locationRemarks: Away from everything. You have to drive a distance to get anywhere

review.title: Awful Experience
review.reviewText: We ordered room service and asked for delivery between 8:45-9:15 AM. They delivered at 8:15 and said we know it's early but here it is. but before all of this happened we got 3 phone calls that woke us up at 8 freaking AM. we didn't answer the first 2 but picked up the phone the third time and guess what they wanted to know how the room service was before the food was even delivered so we told them to go to hell in the nicest way possible. overall was a terrible experience, I had my board exam that day and was hoping to sleep till 9 and have a relaxing breakfast but they totally ruined that. Everything else was OK minus the pool which was of course out of order. I have stayed in better hotels for the same price in South SF. NEVER AGAIN here.

review.title: Good stopover

review.title: Wounderful Hotel . Good Value for money

I strongly recommed it

review.title: Good Airport Hotel at San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel provided good value for the price for a hotel close to the airport. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The bar and restaurant have a good menu with daily specials. We would definitely stay there again when we need a hotel near the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and facilities in the room and the friendly, courteous staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Not the nearest hotel to the airport so the shuttle wait can be up to 30 minutes.

review.title: Great for access to SFO
review.reviewText: We stayed here after five nights in San Francisco. Our room at this hotel was as comfortable, if not as spacious, as the room in SF that cost almost twice as much. The Sleep-Number bed was very appealing to us; we have one at home and miss it when we're away. Our room was clean and quiet, the temperature control worked well and the airport shuttle service delivered us to the airport on schedule. We ate at the hotel restaurant and were not particularly impressed, but the menu and the food were adequate and our server was extremely pleasant and hospitable.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a strange odor in the elevator lobby the day we arrived. I didn't notice it at all the next day.
review.locationRemarks: We had a view of Oakland Bay and a marina from our room, and the location is pretty handy for access to San Francisco International Airport.

review.title: Fun Weekend
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a weekend and was very satisfied with the room and the services. Front desk was very nice and helpful and cleaning staff did a great job. The bayside view was present but nothing spectacular. The small window was located at the corner of the room right above an AC unit so couldn't stand and admire the view comfortably. Otherwise the room was spacious and well kept, and loved the king sized bed. Overall a great stay, look forward to coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: The AC Unit In The Way Of a Comfortable View
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, Nice And Secluded, Nice Get Away Spot.

review.title: Shuttle Service
review.reviewText: The Shuttle service to and from the airport was terrible. Indeed, I waited an hour to get picked up from the airport.

review.title: Good value and comfortable
review.reviewText: Pool was closed due to construction. Fitness room had been relocated but was adequate. Bed was very comfortable. Had a very nice dinner in dining room. Waiter was excellent.

review.title: Great hotel for layover, clean, and great staff!
review.reviewText: One night layover flying out of SFO next day. We'd come from Napa with an unsealed box of wine; Daniel at the front desk immediately helped with tape to seal it so we could check it as luggage. Great bay view room on 7th floor, with Sleep Number bed. Nice bar with friendly staff. Pool and spa were undergoing renovation but website clearly said so. Expedia rate was better than hotel website by $20 per night.

review.reviewText:
A very well-kept, clean, well-furnished, high class hotel at a surprisingly reasonable price. My colleague and I use this hotel for short business trips to the San Francisco area. Reliable wireless service included in the price, and there is a nice restaurant on the ground floor, convenient for a business lunch.

The staff were a little bit slow to bring a second chair to the room for an impromptu work session there, but generally the place is very well kept.
review.locationRemarks: Good location near SFO airport, with great views of the Bay

Breakfast waiters really confused!
Honesty because i m in the business price really over the normality!
I dont want suggest this place to friends.

review.title: Be careful in restaurant
review.reviewText: Hotel at overall is good. Although at the check out I had an incident with a bill for the breakfast. I paid it cash at the restaurant a day before but was charged again at the check out. The receptionist told me that they appologize for that and everything is set. Finally I found that I was charged twice. You know , the bill was less than a $20, but it spoiled the entire impression.
review.locationRemarks: Good and a very easy access

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel as a brief resting spot between long flights, opting for a place with a view and a decent restaurant. The hotel is across the street from the San Francisco Bay, so I was able to walk along the shore and enjoy the wildlife. The location is relatively quiet and beautifully landscaped. The room was really quiet and reasonably dark with lights out (one of my requirements for good sleep). The service is possibly the best experience I've had. The entire staff was caring, helpful, and outgoing. They bent over backwards to make sure my needs were taken care of promptly. I had only one meal and was not fond of my selection (eggplant and portobello lasagna), but that can come down to personal preferences. The salad, though? Excellent. All in all, a really positive experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, quiet, clean, great service
review.negativeRemarks: My menu selection
review.locationRemarks: Across from San Francisco Bay--lovely

review.title: Hotel with class
review.reviewText: This hotel has beautiful decor. The room was large, comfortable and clean. The restaurant was first-rate - judging by the breakfast we had there.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the airport

review.title: Some of the Important Items:
review.reviewText: Relatively close to the freeway to get anywhere. Very comfortable room though on the third floor we hard traffic. As in most hotels near the freeway, the higher the better for exterior noise. Easy check in/out. Noticed in a couple of areas the carpet was coming loose but did not proved to be a major problem. Bathroom was kept well. Nice stay for the price.

review.title: Stress Free Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: I was only in this hotel for one night stay, connecting to a flight in the morning. I found the staff to be very helpful, and the hotel room was very comfortable. I really appreciated the fact that you had van service to the airlines. It made the experience of getting to the airport stress free.

review.title: A family hotel
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to everybody esp to those family with small children. Its clean,spacious,quiet and just few minutes away from SF attractions.

review.title: Great Home Camp
review.reviewText: My wife and I had an overnight stay at this hotel twice in the last month. Excellent value for the money. A nicely-appointed clean and comfortable hotel. Helpful and courteous staff. Not much in the neighbourhood, but a great "home camp" if you have a vehicle & want to explore the Bay Area!

review.title: Affordable and Clean
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay. Our stay was pleasant. Rooms are very quiet and clean. Beds are comfy, and easy access to City. 5 min drive. Staff was friendly as well. Overall a great płace. We had no problems at all here. Best part... it was affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool was being renovated
review.locationRemarks: Easy access. Right off highway 101.

review.title: good solid hotel with a great restaurant
review.reviewText: restaurant was great. excellent service and great food. a little outdated room, but clean and acceptable.
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to from airport on way to san francisco

review.title: Great for a couple of nights
review.reviewText:
I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights (after a business trip to Milpitas). The shuttle to/from SFO was regular (so it was ideal for me to get the Bart into the city on my free day).
The hotel in Milpitas (Beverly Heritage) was twice the price of the Radisson but I felt the Radisson was the far superior hotel i.e. cleaner/newer.
The only downside is there didn't seem to be other bars/restaurants nearby but the hotel bar had a nice enough atmosphere. If I were to stay longer this might be the only negative point i.e. lack of options (apart from other hotels nearby) in the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of other options nearby in the evening. (Pretty much confined to the hotel if you don't have a car).
review.locationRemarks: 10mins by Shuttle to the airport. Ideal for a short stay.

review.title: free shuttle bus to the airport is helpful
review.reviewText: free shuttle bus to the airport is helpful. the room is clean. nothing special but it's enough for business travelers to get to the airport efficiently

review.title: Dreadful food and inadequate window views
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel out of downtown and near the airport because we had an early flight. I chose the Radisson because it had a full restaurant and bar so we would not have to search for a place for dinner because we were not downtown. I also thought, because it overlooked the bay I could relax in my room and enjoy the view. Wrong on both counts. The dinner was dreadful. I ordered sea bass and it smelled when they brought it to the table. I took one bite and spit it out. I asked for a salad instead (how do you mess that up?) and it also was inedible. As far as relaxing in the room and looking at the views? There was a very small window in the corner of the room next to a desk. If I sat on the desk I could get a small view of the water. If you are looking for either of these things in a hotel I would not recommend this particular Radisson.
review.positiveRemarks: I did not like anything about this Hotel. Not a good ambience.
review.negativeRemarks: Horrible food. Views that you can't see
review.locationRemarks: Location was good for getting to the airport in a hurry.

review.title: Superior
review.reviewText: Very family and kid friendly. Accommodates variety of guest types! #5 great rating from me!

review.title: Nice launching pad to SFO
review.reviewText:
We were staying here as a launching pad for our return trip to NC from CA. We had just driven down the coast to Big Sur from SF for an overnight and had a need to stay one more night. We wanted something close to SFO and with free shuttle service to the airport.

This Radisson was a breeze from start to finish. Fast check-in, a very decent breakfast menu in the attached restaurant "Xebec" and a shuttle that ran on time to get us on our way.

The room was clean and accommodating with a nice view of the SF bay. Compared to some other hotels in the area, this hotel was priced a bit lower which was nice considering the "complimentary" shuttle service and proximity to the airport. We would probably not choose this as a primary destination hotel, but if you're looking for an easy transition spot and have an extra night to kill, this is certainly a good choice.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel restaurant + kitchen closed at 10pm
review.locationRemarks: Close the SFO. Located in a business park neighborhood. There is a walking/jogging trail around the water right across the street.

review.title: Recommend highly
review.reviewText:
Valet returned Hertz rental!
Shuttle to airport excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Small double size beds
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Maintaining a 100% Non-Smoking Facility
review.reviewText: Everything was fine and efficient except that for a 100% Non-Smoking Facility, people should not be allowed to smoke within 15 feet of the door, and the hallway adjacent to the back entrance was filled with nauseating cigarette smoke. Staff should monitor and police this activity so that guests do not have to confront other guests about this policy. Management begins at the top, so management is accountable for directing staff to maintain standards of quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Number Beds.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access.

review.title: Fabulous value
review.reviewText: Great stay - staff were excellent and bed super comfortable. No airplane noise! restaurant was superb!

review.title: Great hotel, near to San Francisco, free parking!
review.reviewText: Hotel has a a great location, the room was very clean and comfortable, helping staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Just one bottle of water free per day
review.locationRemarks: Near to SFO and city downtown, no more than 15 mins driving.

review.title: Great bed, restaurant, for stay before a.m. flight
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel in all respects. But what makes it superb for me is Xebec restaurant. When I have to stay overnight before an early morning flight, it is very hard to find a place to stay near the airport that has access to good food. This is the very best I have found, with Xebec (apparently the names of some sort of sailing ship) having very good food in a very classy setting with good service (and even sushi if you want it).
review.positiveRemarks: Xebec restaurant. TAlso, this trip, parking was $5 a night for my extended 5 day trip. Cheapest around, though in the past they have charged more.
review.negativeRemarks: It can be tricky to find the right exit when you leave the hotel to go south on 101. You actually go north for a while.
review.locationRemarks: Reasonably close to the airport.

review.title: Clean, convenient place to stay.
review.reviewText: A decent place to stay. Room was clean. Nothing special, just an average hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Tacky flashing menu board next to the check-in desk.

review.title: Great Value For The Price
review.reviewText: Just there for an overnight stay, we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. Clean, attractive, comfortable - perfect for our needs. Great value for the price! We've already rebooked for a night later this month.

review.title: great hotel for single travel
review.reviewText: neat and convenient,it would be better if there were free laundry machines,

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel. A small drive to downtown SF was worth it. The quietest hotel I've ever
stayed in. Everything worked, air conditioner, refrigerator, robe on the bed etc. Staff weren't very friendly but quite efficient. No issues whatsoever.
review.negativeRemarks: unfriendly staff
review.locationRemarks: perfect for us

review.title: Great hotel close to the bay and the Airport
review.reviewText: I love my room,the location by the bay is nice, the restaurant food is good, all the staff are friendly and nice :) ill stay here again :)

review.title: Clean, comfortable, & high quality at a good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable, well-appointed, and well-priced for such a fine place. The little Xebec restaurant downstairs was excellent. The service was excellent too.
review.positiveRemarks: The little Xebec restaurant downstairs was excellent
review.locationRemarks: Nice views of the Bay and a nice walking/biking trail nearby for morning exercise

review.title: Worth Considering.........................
review.reviewText:
I don't "Over-rate" so "5"'s are a rarity. Check-in was delayed (stood in line) for 15-20 minutes due to a computer problem but they were apologetic and gave us a bayview room. Room was as-expected.........comfortable bed/pillows, strong wireless internet signal, clean/nice-sized bathroom with plenty of hot water.

I booked this in a rush and felt it was a good value for the price and didn't realize the price doesn't include a continental breakfast (which I often shoot for). Hotel restaurant is pricey and there are no other restaurants in the immediate area. However, room has a microwave and small refrigerator, so plan ahead, grab some muffins and juice and save yourself some money and headache.

Freeway access from Hwy 101 (southbound from S.F.) is a little weird.........same for getting back on (southbound).

"Might" consider this hotel again next time primary due to being priced fairly and being quiet/comfortable. Will work around "access" and "breakfast".
review.negativeRemarks: See Narrative
review.locationRemarks: See Narrative

review.title: A Radisson but not as Europeans would understand.
review.reviewText:
I like Radisson hotels across Europe - they are generally extremely well run, have exceedingly well equipped rooms, good wi-fi, service and can be wonderfully quirky too.
Radisson in the US is a terrible disappointment.
Other than the name I failed to see anything Radisson about this hotel. It was soulless, the rooms were entirely typical of an average mid-range US hotel room. The decor is like every other chain hotel in the US, corporate and lacking imagination. Wi-fi coverage is below par - speeds are low and there seemed to be busy periods when service deteriorated badly.
Rooms are comfortable and reasonably equipped but with none of the great flair that makes Radisson in Europe so good.
review.positiveRemarks: For this trip the position was excellent - close to 101 (with obvious noise)
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, room, noise
review.locationRemarks: Good if you need to be in both SF and Silicon Valley

review.title: Busniess Man's Special
review.reviewText:
Good business hotel located close to SFO. Rooms are clean and comfortable, w/ no charge - no password wireless.

Got into the hotel after 10:00 pm and the front desk clerk got room service to stay open long enough to allow me to get something to eat.

review.title: Wonderful staff and hotel
review.reviewText: The staff here is wonderful. They are welcoming, happy and very easy to work with if any problem should arise. We loved staying here as everyone at the hotel seems to really care about the guests!

review.title: Good hotel for travelers of all types!
review.reviewText:
Our third stay here. We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway and were able to get a room at a good rate. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We didn't use the pool or gym area, but did eat there on a friday night. Not inexpensive, but there is nothing else out that way. The food was good.

My only complaint is the coffee they are serving everywhere in the hotel now. Lavazza may have a great amount of caffeine, but it has no flavor to speak of----bring your own pucks to brew.

The staff has always been pleasant and this trip was no different. Thank you for a quiet stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Sitting area in the room, so you don't have to sit on the bed just so you can sit down. My son loved the cookies in the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: The coffee "lavazza" is horrible, bring your own pucks
review.locationRemarks: Close to the freeway, but the rooms are quiet. Easy to find

review.title: Short but comfortable stay
review.reviewText: It was a quick stay of one night, but everything was perfect. We continúe travelling .... Room, service, people were ready to make your stay good

review.title: Airport shuttle was an hour late
review.reviewText: It would have been a wonderful stay until we had to wait an hour for the shuttle to arrive. There was no shuttle for the 2 scheduled times. It was really cold outside the SFO Airport.

review.title: Warm reception staff
review.reviewText:
Close to airport, warm staff at reception, breakfast is fine as we paid.
Room is big and clean.
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location if u don't want to stay in the city. Reasonable rates, free wifi, good restaurant. I stayed 3 nights for business, will definitely repeat.

review.title: Perfect for airport access
review.reviewText: Convenient and comfortable. Nice staff and the check in was simple and handled pleasantly and quickly. The breakfast was good and people were very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel for family and business
review.reviewText: The hotel is good, near to San Francisco, Silicon Valley and Pacific Coast, perfect to stay if you are looking for a place to avoid the high rates in San Francisco city. Front desk and service always ready to help and restaurant with excellent menu.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Location is great for easy access to the entire San Francisco Bay area if you are driving. There was a shuttle service, but I had a rental car and didn't use the shuttle. Restaurant was pricey and food just average. Free breakfast was advertised on Expedia's website, but that wasn't true. When staff was informed, we were given a voucher for one free breakfast during our 7-night stay. Staff was friendly and accommodating. I was very disappointed with the Sleep Number bed. Finding a parking space at night was sometimes a challenge.
review.negativeRemarks: Food, Sleep Number bed
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to entire San Francisco Bay area

review.title: Breakfast Blues!
review.reviewText: The only disappointing thing for us was the full Breakfast menu was only available until 10:30 am which when you are on a vacation seems a little early, we arrived at the resturant at 10:40 am and then to get a hot breakfast had to drive down the 101 to find an IHOP!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Bay, walking path near by.

review.title: Location, location, locarion
review.reviewText:
So close to the airport and yet in a beautiful quiet corporate area on the bay with great areas for walking.
The high point of our stay was our lunch and dinner at their Xebec Restaurant.
Kudos to the chef!
Disappointed with the Sleep Number beds. More of a "come-on" I guess.
And even at the popular "35" setting, not as compfortable as many mattresses.
Would stay here again if the occasion arose.
review.negativeRemarks: Sleep number beds- over rated.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Nice, but not outstanding
review.reviewText: They advertise a free shuttle to and from airport, that is true unless you get to SFO afetr 11.30 PM, because if you do, then you are on your own. Once at thehotel its perfect and service is good
review.negativeRemarks: The shuttle is limited to certain hours

review.title: Good night sleep!
review.reviewText: After flying 12 & 1/2 hours the bed was amazing. I do have to say the food was terrible! I have never seen eggs Benedict with orange sauce before. It had no flavor!
review.negativeRemarks: the food
review.locationRemarks: Perfect by the airprot.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Stayed here a couple times love the place,fair price
review.negativeRemarks: Access to freeway
review.locationRemarks: Quiet and private

review.title: Quiet airport hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived late in the evening after a long plane trip and were appreciative of the helpfulness of the staff in getting us checked in and to our room expeditiously. We were pleased with both the selection and quality of the food at the hotel's restaurant as well as the promptness of the wait staff. The room was very quiet given that we were near SFO.
review.locationRemarks: Near San Francisco International airport without airport noise.

review.title: Not recommended for Business traveler
review.reviewText:
Hotel did not appear to be at capacity and I was placed in a room facing Highway 101. I could hear traffic most of the night.
The desk chair would "sink" from Desk height because the hydraulics were failed.
The Bartender couldn't answer basic questions about soda machines to as hotel Guest.
The Bar had stock (beer, wine, etc) lying on the floor next to the storage closet the entir time I was there. The Bartender did not put away one single bottle the entire time I was there.
The Happy Hour appetizers were terrible. The Fish Taco was extremely dry and the Fried Tempura Vegetables were grossly greasy. No sauce was provided with the Fried Veggies. I had to ask for Ranch dressing or any type of Aioli for dipping.
review.negativeRemarks: Food,room location and desk chair

review.title: Convenient overnight stay
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, so-so dinner in restaurant. Long wait for shuttle at airport.

review.title: Great stop for a night
review.reviewText: Comfortable, safe area. Only stayed 1 nite. Had dinner at the bar and the food was great! I would recommend the Chicken in a mushroom marsala sauce. Great flavor.

review.title: Overall good experience.
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, and had a nice view of the bay. It did smell a little musty or something, but other than that I had a great experience.

review.title: Very comfortable.
review.reviewText: great location to visit sf, and to visit friends in palo alto. close to airport and beautiful view of the bay.

review.title: Great for after a long flight
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very comfortable. The bed was particularly great after a long flight from the UK. The staff were not overly friendly, but they were okay. The concierge was useless and recommended we take the BART into the city as it would be cheaper and quicker. He was absolutely wrong. It cost a fortune and took hours!
Breakfast on the second day was disappointing as the restaurant had staffing problems, however, on the first day it was fantastic.
I would recommend this hotel after a long flight if you want comfort and a good standard.
The gym was good as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff problems in the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport. Not too far from the city. You need a car.

review.title: Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has a nice swimming pool and Jacuzzi. My boys and I could enjoy very much !The room is clean and also the location is good. It takes only 15-20 minutes to downtown SF and a few minutes to SF airport.
review.negativeRemarks: not particularly
review.locationRemarks: Very good as I wrote at section 3.

review.title: A good "airport" hotel
review.reviewText:
A higher standard than many airport hotels.
Our room was not ready when we arrived at 4pm so we were given an upgrade and free breakfast which was very fair treatment.
Service at breakfast could have been faster in view of the fact that we and many of the guests had a plane to catch.

review.title: Business traveler
review.reviewText: Modern, clean facility with an easy commute to downtown. On-site restaurant had a good variety of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner if needed. Rooms were quiet and had free wifi. Enjoyed my 2 night stayin November 2012.
review.locationRemarks: A bit isolated in that you cannot walk to other restaurants or shops.

review.title: Amazing Hotel
review.reviewText: i stayed in this hotel for a night before going to SFO, and it was fantastic. Right from the get go i was impressed. Checking in couldn't have been easier and the staff were extremely nice. The room was very modern and updated. They have very comfortable sleep number beds, and a good sized tv. Another plus their wi-fi was free. In the morning, i was woken up to my wake up call and in room coffee. Then went downstairs and was picked up and taken to the airport in the complimentary airport shuttle, and the driver also couldn't have been nicer. in the end i would i would recommend this hotel for anybody.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Should provide guests with Bath robes and stocked refrigerators, water, snaks, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The dining room and Room service and food were top notch! Excellent food quality and preparation!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms without snacks, bath robes.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco By the Bay Airport. Great hotel overall.

review.title: Close to airport, but $35 cab to downtown
review.reviewText: Ok hotel, close to airport, but too far from downtown, it cost approx. $35 one way, so unless you need to be close to airport, I will not select this hotel

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The restaurant service and food was very good also. The Radisson is a great hotel to stay at for easy access to Bay Area fun!

review.title: San Francisco Treat
review.reviewText: The entire staff from front desk to housekeeping were very friendly and very accommodating. The location was excellent and afforded us the convenience of traveling around San Francisco and surrounding cities, and conveniently located near the San Francisco airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Even though the hotel did not provide complimentary breakfast throughout the work week, the hotel did provide coffee and tea as a "grab & go" option.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport AND the home of the San Francisco 49ers Candlestick Park.

review.title: Great hotel for overnighting for a flignt
review.reviewText:
This Radisson Hotel is the best I've stayed in. The room was large and comfortable
with free wifi. The staff were very helpful, and the restaurant served interesting
and great food at a reasonable price. The roundtrip shuttle to the airport was on-time
and much appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes to airport by shuttle bus

review.title: A great little hotel
review.reviewText: They upgraded us to the best room. The hotel was a little far from the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: How far it was from downtown
review.locationRemarks: It wasn't close to the places I needed to go to.

review.title: Friendly, comfotable and convenient
review.reviewText: well, this hotel was wonderful. Spent the weekend with my sister and two neices. Our only thing was that they only had one bottle of water for the four of us in the room. In the morning we asked and were given four on our way out for the day. But when we returned, there still was only one bottle of water for us. This is my only pet peeve but everything else was great. Maybe they figured everyone drank wine? (Which we did enjoy) definitely would come back again. Love the closeness to the airport and the view of the Bay!
review.positiveRemarks: free paking which is a premium in San Francisco and easy drive to airport
review.negativeRemarks: no free continental breakfast, only coffee without any flavor creamers :(
review.locationRemarks: great, quiet, convenient. minutes from the airport

review.title: not what I expected
review.reviewText: When we got there the front desk people was great, but when we got to the room I saw that the night stand was dusty, the desk was dusty so just wipe it out with paper towel. Then when my sister lift the comforter the cover has stain. On our first night, when I went to take a shower I saw that there were mold on the grout of wall tiles and edge of the tub. One of the bath towel has 3 stain good thing we brought our own bath towels. On the hallway, we encounter with a manager or supervisor or inspector of the rooms checking the room attendant, when we said Hi and smile at her she looks like she is in a bad mood.
review.positiveRemarks: the sleep number bed was great had a great night sleep.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: This is a basic, clean and comfortable airport location chain hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Service in the bar/restaurant was not very professional
review.locationRemarks: Nothing special, fine for a overnight stay near the SFO airport

review.title: Awesome Service!
review.reviewText: Everyone was very welcoming and determined to make sure I would return.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and updated with slab granite and nice bedding!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Not to far from downtown SF, however quick access on and off hwy 101.

review.title: Only ok
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok - problems with sending a package and a promise from the front desk that management would call and they did not. Restaurant was good. Mediocre at best.
review.negativeRemarks: Management follow up
review.locationRemarks: Scenery was pretty but nothing else around the hotel

review.title: Centerlocation
review.reviewText: Only a short walk to the wharf so you dont need taxi

review.title: HOTEL COMMENTS
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel, just outside of downtown San Francisco. Whether you have a rent a car or access to getting to the train. Transportation from this location is very convenient. Room was very clean and the beds extremely comfortable. Hotel's restaurant had excellent food but lacked the skill of a decent waiter. Their only goal was to get you the food and your bill. Very unprofessional and greedy, which is a shame. Hats off to the chef in the kitchen. Other than that employees need to care a bit more about the customer there. They have a good business and for something so small that is an easy fix they should consider this.
review.positiveRemarks: Food in the restaurant and cleanliness of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer care. ex: waiters and waitresses only cared about one thing.
review.locationRemarks: 10 min. outside of downtown San Fran.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: There was some hair left in the tub from someone who may have shaved their beard. I didn't want to make a fuss so I didn't say anything. It was late and I was too tired to say anything to anyone.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel. Location, cleanliness, restaurant, service, this has it all.

review.title: Great Staff!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience. The hotel was nice, but the staff really made our stay better than expected. We were on our honeymoon, and they upgraded our room, and brought us a complimentary bottle of wine. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was much better than I would expect from a hotel restaurant.

review.title: Easy to get everywhere
review.reviewText: Easy to the airport, easy to downtown San Francisco and Oakland
review.locationRemarks: easily accessibe to everything we wanted to do and the airport, too

review.title: Ideal airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Ideal hotel for anyone using the nearby airport. Myself, my husband and two friends had driven from Yosemite and arrived tired and wanting to chill out before our next day's flights back to Europe. Bar was friendly and good choice of light food and drinks. Bedroom spacious and very good bathroom - we had a wet room which was the only one in all of the places we stayed over a 3 week holiday! One small point - we cannot understand why American bathrooms still have shower curtains around their showers or baths - its so old fashioned compared to Europe.
The shuttle to and from airport was great as we dropped our car off at airport after checking in and then returned to hotel so that we were able to just get the free airport shuttle the following morning.

review.title: Good business hotel
review.reviewText: Good, clean hotel with a very good breakfast offering

review.title: Quiet, clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: The Radisson was clean and very comfortable. Slept really good in the comfortable bed. It helped that my cat wasn't there to wake me up. ;-) Had dinner in the lounge. The food was really good and not high priced. It was quiet and the staff were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing it was all good
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for our stay. Close to freeways and easy to get back to after driving around.

review.title: Good Hotel Near SFO
review.reviewText: Quick and efficient check-in. Excellent guidance regarding local geography and routes. Easy access via shuttle to/from SFO. Only glitch was being assigned to a handicapped-friendly room which for us was not necessary and made use of the bathroom a bit more unpleasant (shower water over the entire floor, limited space for toiletries, etc.)

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location is perfect if you don't want to stay in San Fran. Great views and a very comfortable room. Restaurant was very good. Nice dinner and a couple of breakfasts. We would stay here again on our next visit to the area!

review.title: Nice, pleasant stay
review.reviewText: We have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and very quiet. However, it was a little inconvenient to get downtown...required taking a hotel shuttle to the airport and then taking the BART from the airport. Certainly doable over a short stay, just a little tedious if you are staying a week or longer.

photos.caption: Found my pot of gold RADISON
Snapped from the Rear Parking Area

review.title: Great Hotel and Service Give yourself a Treat
review.reviewText:
This was our second stay. Spent five days last Sepember and six days this month. The most outstanding service from all employees. Reception staff friendly and most helpful. The Front Desk Manager welcomed us in such a delightful manner and saw to our check-in procedure with great finesse. Wish I could recall all names.

Our food server both in bar and dining room (Jose) was a true delight.. beyond words, great service he is a true asset to the hotel . The F&B Director inquired as to our dining selection and had we enjoyed or meals. The Chef made a point of informing us of the daily specials ... we really enjoyed them all. Food was tasty and well prepared as well as attractive to the eye. Coffee in the foyer a blessing and cookies in the afternoon who could ask for anything more.Tim from Sales was also a pleasure to see again. Thank you all for making our stay such a pleasure. Until next time.
review.positiveRemarks: All employees, Great Food, Very Clean Room, Lovely View of Bay, and very quiet rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Having to leave
review.locationRemarks: Easy to reach, close to public transport if needed.

review.title: Great airport hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We needed to stay close to the airport as we had an early flight the next morning from SFO. The Radisson by SFO was perfect. The room was clean, spacious and everything was in working order. The restaurant in the hotel served cocktails and later dinner without a problem. The waiter service was very good.

The shutlle service to the airport was prompt and all worked out great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for quick access to SFO

review.title: Better values are available in the airport area.
review.reviewText:
The housekeeping staff and the young men at the concierge desk were great. The people at the check-in desk and who actually answer the front desk phone were not. We were stuck at the airport for approximately 1-1/2 hours waiting for the shuttle. After three telephone calls they finally agreed to reimburse us for the cab ride back to the hotel. The shuttle is supposed to be available at 30 minute intervals throughout the day. SFO is a busy airport, cabs to the hotel from the airport are expensive and unreliable transportation just isn't acceptable.

The restaurant is adequate but closes early, and the only options are vending machines and a limited "snack bar" area. There are better values available!
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby staff
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by office buildings and construction.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Well maintaned and clean. My room had a great view of the ocean/bay. My only compliant would be that the exit from the highway was very odd. The exit to get to the hotel was isolated and seemed almost like a service road.

review.title: Priced Right!!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel and Great Price for San Francisco. Will stay again if I am ever in the area. Room had fridge, microwave, flat screen tv's. Hot tub was awesome at the end of a long day wandering the streets of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant a little pricey but food was good
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport. Free shuttle to airport and bart station.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: It was OK for the price. Nothing special. The pillows were a little too mushy. Make sure you get your snacks before checking in a pint of ice cream was 6.00! Clean nice stay, just nothing really spectacular.
review.locationRemarks: Bay view suites really aren't worth the extra money

review.title: We loved it
review.reviewText: Great place to be for going to AT&T or candlestick. Great pool/jacuzzi area. Good coffee & plenty of pillows! Nice stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Was hard to find.
review.locationRemarks: Good location business area

review.title: need to improve the front desk staff
review.reviewText: in my first 20 minutes arrival the hotel to check in, front of me has one customer in the counter talking to the only one staff of the front desk, but they talk the topic is not regarding the hotel, not regarding the check in, is regarding they study the major in the university. even though later on three persons coming after me, they still talking about regardless the check in the hotel! let us wait for over 15 minutes! I feel such big hotel should training the front counter staff how to handle with the customer. which one is priority, which topic you can talk to later if no customer waiting in the line. I feel front desk staff is important, it just like the window of your hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: room is super clean,

photos.caption: My bayside view that cost extra

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The only complaint that I have is the fact that I paid extra for the Bayside view, and the way the hotel is situated, no room really has a bay view. Plus my room was right above the air conditioning units so the only thing that I saw looking out was the air conditioners. That was disappointing. Wi-fi worked well.
review.positiveRemarks: Wi-fi and easy to get to.
review.negativeRemarks: View

review.title: I hope it was not what I think it was
review.reviewText: I woke up to a bug crawling across my sheets. Gave it to manager, asked for them to check if this was a bed bug and address. They were magnificent in moving me from my room but as I have asked numerous times, I did not get a report on the bug that saved and gave to them to tell me what it was. I really think it would have been appropriate to let me know the type of buy for at least my benefit but no word. Very disappointing

review.title: Near Nothing
review.reviewText: The hotel is near nothing. It sits in the middle of an office park. You must take a taxi or have a rental car to get anywhere. Upon check-in we were told that breakfast was served from 6am to 11am, however failing to tell us in was in the attached restaurant at an additional cost. They did have a sorry looking coffee area where nutrigrain bars were the only food choice. I have stayed in many "lower quality" hotels and this by far was the worst. Parking was at a premium during our stay having to circle and circle the lot, finally giving up and driving next door to the Homewood Suites to park. They did offer an excellent free shuttle service to and from the airport every 35 minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: they did have a select comfort bed which we found great
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast and parking
review.locationRemarks: near nothing

review.title: Great service!
review.reviewText: This hotels staff was friendly. The restaurant served good food.

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
I liked having the sleep number for the beds.
The only thing I didn't like were the pillows and blankets. They made too much noise when you moved around.
review.locationRemarks: A little inconvenience and far from the town

review.title: great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: This hotel was great sits by the bay and close to downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: None that I've found.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great Hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, very clean & quiet. The Staff was very helpful and friendly. I only recommand the Radisson Hotel.

review.title: Great family hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, good facilities, very helpful reception staff, had our plans not changed would have stayed longer and if back in the area will consider this hotel first
review.positiveRemarks: Pool and gym facilities, the helpful reception staff
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for the airport and transport into san francisco

review.title: Great stay. Clean and convenient.
review.reviewText: The microwave and refrigerator in the room were a nice convenience. Free wi-fi and comfortable Sleep Number beds with a good choice of soft or firm pillows made it a very comfortable stay. But breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was a little expensive. Other hotels in this range offer free full breakfasts.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: the location was excellent.AndI enjoyed the food in the restuarant . the Tv was pretty good.and the computor room was also very good.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the food in the restuarant . the Tv was pretty good.and the computor room was also very good.
review.negativeRemarks: I could hear the people in the next room
review.locationRemarks: the location was excellent.

review.title: Nice, clean, good deal for the price.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to the water and candlestick park.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Candlestick park, good running/walking paths by water.
review.negativeRemarks: No restaurants or shopping within walking distance

review.title: no airport noise
review.reviewText: nice, convenient/close to the airport without any airport noise
review.locationRemarks: near sf airport

review.title: Close to airport - service so so...
review.reviewText:
We knew we were in trouble when we tried to get our previously checked bags from the concierge. We asked the hotel desk clerk to call him so we could get our bags and get settled for the night. After 10 minutes of waiting, we asked again. 10 more minutes goes by and still no one shows up. Mind you, there is no one but us and the desk clerk in the hotel at 6pm. Finally I see someone go into the Executive Office and I knock on the door. No one answered. I started to knock harder and finally a man came to the door. I asked him if we could get our bags. He then went and got them.

We had breakfast at the hotel, we watched our food sit on the counter and then watched the waiter look at it three times and each time go and do something else. Finally we received cold food. We sent it back. Rather than remake the food, they took it behind the counter and put it back on the grill. The waiter told me that everything was fine and didn't need to discuss it.

Last, our "smoke-free" room reeked of smoke.

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: It was nice and quiet. Easy to find. Pool was nice and they had a gift shop.

review.title: Fine, if you don't want the pool
review.reviewText:
I was disappointed, because I choose hotels based on availability of an indoor pool for my health issues. The indoor pool here is small, shallow, and too cold to be usable except by kids who don't know any better. The lighting was so limited (bulbs out) you could hardly see the area.

The rest of the hotel was just fine and had what we needed.
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to SFO airport, easy to find
review.negativeRemarks: the pool
review.locationRemarks: fine

review.title: Good hotel for airport access.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you have an early morning flight like we did. Quick, easy drive to airport. Hotel is clean and well-kept. Nice view.

review.title: Great place for the traveler and their family
review.reviewText:
We had a very nice meal in the hotel dining room, much better than most hotels. (Salmon and osso bucco) The chef came to the table, to make sure everything was up to our standard. He was very personable and offered us a free dessert.
Breakfast in the morning was prompt. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was very quiet. We took a walk along the bay in front of the hotel to stretch our legs, before we went to bed. We would certainly stay there again as it is one of the nicest/quietest airport hotels we have stayed in.

review.title: Great food
review.reviewText: Resturant and room service is outstanding. Really great hotel, a little out of the way from downtown but well worth the savings.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Near the SFO airport, maybe 10 minutes away with free shuttle

review.title: Close to The City and Comfortable.
review.reviewText:
The rooms were clean and the view from the bay side was great. I don't sleep well when I'm not at home.The sleep number beds were very comfortable and I slept like a baby. The pool and spa were nice, although the towels were always empty and the restrooms were out of order during our stay. The staff was professional and very helpful. The restaurant was comfortable and well lit but the food was less than expected considering the formal surroundings. The pizza we ordered was kind of cold and though I wouldn't bet on it, I think it may have been previously frozen. The french dip was small and somewhat flavorful. I would say the restaurant was convenient but the food was over priced and mediocre. In the morning we went down had coffee for breakfast. Our server Phil, was very pleasant and we sat by the window with a beautiful view of the bay. That was nice...

All in all we enjoyed our stay and will visit again.

review.title: Rude housekeeper
review.reviewText: Had a terrible experience with housekeeping staff. On the second day, I took used towels to the housekeeping person and asked for 4 sets. She didn't speak much English, but insisted we get our room cleaned. I told her I wanted towels, a spare roll of toilet paper and a box of klennex because we were out and didn't want the room cleaned. She refused to give me the towels I requested. She only gave me two sets. She spoke very loudly in her native tongue to the other housekeeper nearby obviously talking about me. I walked away without the toilet paper or tissue. We reported it to the front desk and they figured it was a communication problem. She knew I didn't want the room cleaned and she refused to give me the towels. There was no communication error. Later that day we came back from sight-seeing and saw the 'supervisor' checking the rooms. She spoke more English so I asked her for the toilet paper and tissues. She walked to the cart of the housekeeper and the housekeeper started 'spouting' off again in her native tongue. The supervisor had to shhh her. I don't want to ding an excellent hotel for a rude housekeeper, but this made for a somewhat unenjoyable experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping and no vent in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: super close to freeway onramp and in a business area so really quiet.

review.title: Overnight in Brisbane, CA
review.reviewText: Our plane was 3 hours late arriving, but this Radisson kept our reservation for us. The shuttle was quick to pick us up, and quick to deliver us. The receptionist was kind and courteous, though we were tired and grumpy. The room was cool and clean. Loved the ironing board and iron they provided for the next day's clothing. Plenty of room in the bathroom for toiletries. All the lights were in working order, and the tub/shower was clean. Sure would have liked a flexible wand in the shower, however. We were glad the room was large enough to open both of our suitcases completely for repacking. Our breakfast the next morning was quite good, although prices were rather high. All in all it was a good experience.
review.positiveRemarks: bottled water provided, quiet room, iron and ironing board provided
review.negativeRemarks: a bit pricey
review.locationRemarks: near the freeway but the hotel windows kept the noise out

review.title: Comfortable bed and good price
review.reviewText: Really comfortable bed and nice staff. The common areas could use new carpet, but not bad, just noticeable. The restaurant has good food and a nice staff as well, although the service was slow. They seemed understaffed when we were there. A few things for me, no gluten free choices and no sugarfree syrup or jam. But, I get used to that! Good thing the food is good at the restaurant because there is REALLY no where else to eat, even one freeway exit up or down from the hotel, unless you want Subway. Noticed a few cleanliness issues with our room (we stayed 3 nights)-coffee pot not emptied regularly, a little skimpy vacuuming. Not bad enough to stop you from going. The price is very affordable, especially compared to in the city. Just be prepared for SF traffic!

review.title: Great base location
review.reviewText: Great place close to both airport and San Francisco. Great base location.

review.title: Great for business travel, close to SF city
review.reviewText: Went to SF for business, stayed at this hotel for a few nights, excellent overall! The city is just a few minutes away on car, the 101 is right there will get you everywhere.

review.title: NOT VERY HAPPY WITH EXPEDIA & THE HOTEL
review.reviewText: We were very upset with the hotel over booking. We paid for three rooms with queen beds for family and us for four days in San Francisco. Because of the hotel over booking we were given one room with a king size bed with a sofabed. The king size bed was great but my daughter had a cast on her left arm and the sofabed was very uncomfortable for her. When we booked the room it said complimentary breakfast which was a lie they have a restaurant in the hotel which you have to pay at to eat. The restroom was dirty and the control for the TV was broken. The initiation of our stay sucked but as we accomodated it got better.
review.negativeRemarks: everything else

review.title: Great value minutes from San Francisco
review.reviewText: The sleep number beds let everyone get a good night's sleep, once we stopped playing with the controls. The staff was very friendly and the room was comfortable and clean. The Radisson is very close to San Francisco- about 20 minutes to downtown. There were several families with children, and they all looked happy. The restaurant was kind of bland, but convenient, and the wait staff was very attentive. We took a walk down to the nearby marina, and it was lovely.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly hotel staff, and the sleep number beds were comfortable for everyone.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant food was kind of bland.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco, nice view of the city and the bay. The path to the nearby marina was a nice walk.

review.title: Great for relaxation
review.reviewText: Nice and quiet to have a comfortable stay. It is close to the bay that we could visit and see mountain view. Fairly close to both Airport and Downtown san francisco.

review.title: good experience
review.reviewText: Good experience, convenient location, erasable price
review.locationRemarks: near SFO as well as the City

review.title: Fantastic Deal
review.reviewText: Quality hotel of course, great room. I couldn't get there going south on the 101 (had to go north). An airport hotel with not much around... Got a great internet deal for a July weekend.

review.title: Convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: Very clean and acceptable. Close to the airport. only no real services near by.

review.title: Great hotel close to the SFO and the city
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. Great service in the bar. Clean and comfortable room.

review.title: Nice SFO hotel.
review.reviewText: Everything was great, except for a broken toilet. We had to remove the tank lid to flush. Nice location by the bay and SFO. Only about 15 minutes from the heart of San Francisco. Free parking which is very hard to come by in the heart of SF.

review.title: Superb Stay
review.reviewText: Great location for catching the BART system to San Francisco. Hotel provides shuttle service every 35 minutes to the airport to the BART station. Hotel employees extremely courteous, helpful, and efficient. Any question or request was answered quickly w' a smile. I'd highly recommend.

review.title: Nothing close by
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and nice, however there is nothing around the hotel. It is located in an industrial area and there are no shops, restaurants, nothing. If you are going to stay just to be at the hotel you are fine but with a family it is not a place to stay unless you are ok bein captive to the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel at low price but away from action
review.reviewText: The hotel room was clean and well thought out. There was a refrigerator and microwave and several other things that I appreciated in the room. The staff was also very good, they were prompt in fixing the issue with the refrigerator temperature as soon as I reported it. There is free parking, but parking was a little hard to find in the lot. It was probably because I visited during a busy time. The surrounding area is nice and safe. The only issue I had was that it is a little far away from downtown SF and there are no grocery stores, restaurants, coffee shops nearby. You have to drive 10-15 minutes to South San Francisco for all that stuff and downtown SF is about 20-30 minutes away depending on where you want to go and at what time. Since we had a rental car we didn't have any issues, but if you prefer to pay some more money then staying in downtown will be better.

review.title: Wonderful airport location
review.reviewText: The beds were sleep number beds and were very comfortable. All the staff were friendly and helpful, most remarkably was the most courteous housekeeping staff.

review.title: Great hotel for sleeping...not eating.
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is very convenient to the airport and only a few miles from downtown. The beds are top quality and the baths are very large. There were two areas we felt needed improvement. The coffee was sub-par and we had to ask 3 times for regular instead of decaf. They only provided 2 small creamers and 2 packets of sugar. We had to run downstairs almost every day to request more and in the end we drove to Starbucks.

Also, the hotel chef leaves a LOT to be desired. Lunch was terrible! Nothing had any flavor and they really skimped on the condiments. Not sure they've ever heard of salt. Everything was bland. When we did receive more condiments they were just as tasteless.

I would recommend a stay here as the rooms were nice, but your best bet is to plan to eat somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: The food was awful.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to the Embarcado, but not many restaurants local to the area.

review.title: Inside Scoop
review.reviewText:
Arrive early, parking in the evening is a major problem =((
No close restaurants if you are looking for an option to the hotel restaurant
Rooms are a good value for the price.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great hotel service. Especially Michael at the front desk!

review.title: Great hotel near airport!
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect. The sleep number bed was awesome, the room immaculate and the staff was friendly and helpful. Its great if you want to be near the airport, not too close to be loud but a really quick drive away. Plus it had a marina view that was really pretty.

review.title: Hotel was adequate
review.reviewText: We weren't overly impressed from the start when we tried to get their airport shuttle to pick us up. It took over an hour as the shuttle driver stopped at our location and then proceeded to tell us he wasn't going to the same Radisson that we were going to so we waited another half hour only to fund out we should have gotten on his shuttle. The driver was extremely difficult to understand. The hotel was just OK.
review.negativeRemarks: Airport shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Good for what we were looking for

review.title: An Unusual Situation
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel about midnight, checked in and our room keys did not work. My husband went to the front desk to get a new set. He told them the key lock displayed red and green lights which indicate the deadbolt is engaged. The manager told my husband that someone from our party must be in our room and the deadbolt must be engaged. How can that be....we had just arrived! So a security guard accompanied him back to the room and put his key in to disengage the deadbolt. He then attempted to open the door but the security chain was engaged. He told us that someone must be in the room, so he called the front desk to verify whether or not the room was vacant. In the meantime, my husband went back to the front desk to request another room. Fortunately, there was another room available right next door. The security guard kept wondering aloud why no one from housekeeping was responding to his request to open the security chain lock system. We thought it was careless of the hotel to assign us a room that was apparently "occupied," and we also thought it was unusual that whoever was in the room did not respond to our attempts to open/unlock the door. We contacted the manager later and he told us that there are times when the previous occupants check out but fail to vacate the room, and remain there illegally. In conclusion, we were disappointed that we had to ask for another room and was not offered one right away when our situation occurred.
review.positiveRemarks: Our alternate room was clean and the bed was great. The security guard who helped us was very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: The night management's response to our dilemma was disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel was convenient, as it was very close to the airport.

review.title: Good for everyone - especially going to SFO!
review.reviewText:
The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient. The shuttle bus was convenient to SFO and was about 10 min. drive from hotel to airport (could have used a bit of cleaning, ripped seats fixed) - driver was great!
The room furnishings were very comfortable and clean. Beds were comfy. Liked the nice sized fridge too!
review.positiveRemarks: Ease to find, convenience to airport, ease of getting back on 101 N.
review.locationRemarks: Great for airport - even though right off of 101 S, never heard planes or traffic.

review.title: Vacation Disaster
review.reviewText: Our "Bay View Room" was more than disappointing. There was a single 40 inch wide window with an AC unit underneath. If you lean over the AC and turn your head as far left as possible you could see the Bay. Other than that we recieved the typical "back of another hotel" view. The police were dispatched and spent some time under our window Friday night in the early AM. The staff didn't seem to understand what a non-down(foam) pillow was. When we requested them we received another nice stack of down pillows. The housekeeping staff didn't speak English so that attempt was futile as well. The shuttle bus driver begged for tips with signs all over the bus. Housekeeping came in without knocking to catch us in our underwear and less. Morning coffee in the lobby was removed by 8AM on Saturday. We actually left early and went home. We will NEVER stay at the Raddison again and suggest that you don't either. The worst vacation of my life.
review.negativeRemarks: The service was dreadful (except Steven at the desk) and the room was not as advertised.

review.title: Great for the traveller
review.reviewText: Well located on the bayfront and 10 min from the SFO airport, the Radisson offers a great facility for travellers and visitors to San Francisco. The hotel is well serviced by a shuttle service from and to the airport that runs on time and provides a great service to travellers and visitors like me seeking to catch the BART to the city. Rooms are comfortable, well maintained and a few lucky guests have an uninterrupted view of the bay from their room window. The lobby is clean, front desk staff always cheerful and the restaurant serves great food. The only downside is that there are no nearby shops, so if you have to buy something, you have some serious searching to do.

review.title: No bang for your Buck!
review.reviewText: Hotel is way over rated - prices for simple drinks was a joke - should've stay in the City for the same price -
review.negativeRemarks: Price(s)

review.title: Good value for nice accomodations!
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable room. The sleep number beds were a nice a touch. The front desk staff were very nice.

review.title: Good choice in San Francisco, for self-drivers.
review.reviewText: My mom and I chose here for 3-day staying as the 1st stop of the American tour. The room is clean, the bed is comfortable, and we have microwave, refrigerator, coffee machine, and iron, almost everything you need. There is no toothbrush & toothpaste supplied, but I think that's normal for this kind of hotel. So, just bring them from home. The complimentary parking is good. Nearby highway, easy reaching everywhere you want in Great San Francisco area by car. If you didn't rent a car, you have to take the free shuttle bus offered by the hotel. We drove to the opposite site of San Francisco Bay to see USS Hornet that just takes 22 mins around. The experience is great, but if you don't speak any English, that will be a little bit harder, since I didn't notice any bilingual staff there for Mandarin Speakers. The price is not low, but in SF, perhaps that's the fair rate. Will considering living here again for next time.
review.positiveRemarks: The in-room facilities, free-parking, clean environment.
review.negativeRemarks: The price for the restaurant in the hotel is very high to those clients sensitive to pricing. If you want to save money, don't try there.
review.locationRemarks: Good for self-driver. Not sure for those guys without cars. Of course, you can rely on the shuttle bus.

review.title: Clean hotel, inconvenient location.
review.reviewText:
The biggest problem with this hotel is location. It takes a LOOONG time for the Airport shuttle to come. I planned on staying here and using the BART to get in/out of the city - I spent lots of time waiting on both ends for the shuttle to arrive. The location means that there is also nothing in walking distance in terms of food or entertainment, so if you are not renting a car, you will be trapped.

Staff was nice, rooms were clean, just not a good location
review.negativeRemarks: Length of time to catch airport schedule
review.locationRemarks: Nothing in walking distance.

review.title: Very nice and good price

review.title: Hard to find in the dark!

review.title: Texan

I have to commend the lady that cleaned my room. The same person cleaned it for the 4 nights that I was there. She was very thorough, polite and helpful.

review.title: Great room but terrible shuttle
review.reviewText: The room was good as well as the happy hour. The shuttle, on the other hand, was ;ike taking an "e" ride at dsineyland. I believe therer were times whne i went airborne, at least sxi inches, off of my seat. The rear seat were crooked so we never sat therer again.
review.negativeRemarks: shuttle vehicle
review.locationRemarks: very nice; quitet which is what my wife appreciated.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: This is our first stay in this hotel with our two kids and their families. In order to get the rooms together as we needed they even upgraded one of the rooms for no charge. The staff were as friendly as any place we have stayed and extremely helpful. The pool and workout room were very nice. A great place to stay and highly recommended. We will stay there again if we are ever back to San Fransisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent desk gentlemen and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Only able to stay one night!

review.title: Tell Us Up Front
review.reviewText: One thing it would have been nice to have know was that the room was a Handicap Room, and no mention of it was made at check-in. I do not need a handicap room, and would have preferred a bath tub and counter space in the bathroom--things that a Handicap Room does NOT offer. Once a customer arrives and settles into the room, it is unlikely that he or she will want to go through the hassle of changing rooms, so if you would tell someone in advance, this would make customers happier in the overall experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Food was great in the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheap tissue in the bathrooms.

review.title: Sleep Number beds are weird.

Also, sleep number beds are weird to sleep on - but if you can handle that, you're gold to spend the night here.

review.title: A Must Stay place..:)

review.title: have car...will go
review.reviewText: near airport, with shuttle service. but nothing else around for food options. need a car to stay there. nice rooms/ services. good bay views.could provide breakfast.

review.title: Cigarettes and Freeway view
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel is very good, but we had unpleasant experience with checking in.

First, we asked for a room on higher floor with a bay view, but they told us, because we are going to stay too long (7days) they couldn't offer it for us. We went to the room suggested. It smelt on cigarettes. We went down to ask for another room. The second room was with a freeway view, noisy and with dirty looking windows. We were very disappointed, and went to speak with the receptionists that if they cannot offer a better room, at least for one night, we will start looking for a new place to stay. At this point the receptionist succeeded to find a nice room with a bay view and clean windows. After that all of our stay in this hotel was fine. The cleaning service was very good. The room was nice.

The hotel was not full and we could not understand why they tried so hard to give us a room with an unpleasant view.

Overall the hotel was good.

review.title: Our night at the Radison San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Slept very well, very comfy king bed and quiet! Restaurant Xebec was fairly good. Enjoyed the bar ambience. Overall I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The coffee

review.title: Would stay again

review.title: Great Experience

review.title: Very satisfactory all around
review.reviewText: The staff were efficient and friendly. The wifi was free and easy to connect to. The room was beautiful. The room service dinner was delicious, and they were happy to make substitutions for me. Breakfast was equally good, and again I was a difficult customer, asking for combinations not on the menu. Check-out was easy and the shuttle bus to the airport was waiting for me. I've been travelling a lot lately, and this hotel really stood out as being the best.
review.negativeRemarks: all was good

review.title: Good Business Hotel.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay. And will book there again if I return to the area. Easy to get into the city from this location. Enjoyed the restaurant. WiFi not the fastest in the world. That caused some frustration.
review.locationRemarks: close to San Francisco

review.title: Overnight at SF...
review.reviewText:
From the minute we walked into the lobby, we were treated like valued guests. We had to move to another room at 9:30 p.m. due to a crying baby next door. I called down to the front desk and was assisted promptly. Within 10 minutes, we were settled in our new room and totally happy with the service. We even had a beautiful view of the marina and the San Mateo-Hayward bridge! I do recommend asking for the "quiet side of the hotel" due to freeway noise.

I used the fitness room twice while I was there. Both times, I had it completely to myself. Not a lot of equipment, but enough to get a good workout. Towels and remotes for the TV are provided, with a view of the indoor pool area, as well. Clean and well kept.

The restaurant is a bit overpriced for the food quality, but it is convenient if you're in a hurry. There really isn't anything else to choose from at this freeway exit. For the price and proximity to downtown San Francisco, you could do better with a 15 minute drive north.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable price. Great service from the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: No other services at this freeway exit.
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco Hwy. 101(Brisbane) across the street from the marina.

review.title: Radisson a very pleasant surprise
review.reviewText:
When I booked our LA and SF hotels with expedia the LA was ranked as 4.5 stars hotel. As a result I was expecting something less from the Radisson Hotel in SF. I was wrong. Our Radisson room was better and bigger, with a comfortable king size bed, a small fridge, and microwave oven and a larger bathroom The facilities in general are great including a very clean and reasonable priced restaurant and large free parking lot. The location is ideal some 6 miles or so from the airport and from Down town San Francisco. We were very pleased with this hotel and we will stay there again when in SF.
George and Angie

review.title: 5-star hotel experience at 3-star prices

review.title: Just Shy of a Perfect Review!
review.reviewText: Close to the airport and the location of the conference my husband and I attended. It was a great experience! Our only complaint was the cab company utilized by the Radisson. Yellow Cab Company I believe......$50.00 to drive us 2-3 miles to another hotel. That is ridiculous. I have been to New York, Chicago, and Boston and never spent that on a 3 mile cab ride. We made the staff at the front desk aware as directed by the staff at the Marriott (location of the conference) because they too felt that we were overcharged. Needless to say, we quickly obtained a rental car! .

review.title: TERRIBLE!

They first put us in a room that was already occupied then had to be moved. This hotel and hotel service was terrible. There are plenty of good hotels in San Fran so stay away from this one.

Don't stay on the 2nd floor unless you are assured of better drapes.

My wife spoke to the manager and he apologized and offered to comp us the appetizer and bring it to our room. Good enough but the damage was done. The bartender should be fired. The place was NOT busy and we felt ignored and like our patronage didn't matter. SO - we'll pick a different hotel next time - one that might care we book there.

The Restaurand is simple, without much luxury, detail, much smell of food since the machines are in sight.
The breakfast should be included in the price, as it charged separately. The air-conditioned control room is not working properly.
The hotel has an efficient internet service, except in some areas not covered. You should have a parking area with some coverage for occasional rain.
In general, no different from a hotel chain that should be a plus.
