review.title: "Everything we hoped it would be."
review.reviewText: The hotel had everything we were looking for... exactly as described. We stayed in early September 2011. Clean, comfortable rooms, plenty of free parking, close to the airport, yet close to downtown and all of the San Francisco sites we had to see. The restaurant was nice for breakfast, yes, it was a bit pricey, but, hey, it's San Francisco. Good food, nice friendly staff. There are not many other hotels/restaurants in the vicintity (Brisbane). I would recommend this to those who just cannot be without a car when they travel and don't mind driving to get where they want to go, navigating the city and surrounding area on their own. I would definitely stay here again if I get to the "City by the Bay" some time in the future. Great value for the price. Highly recommended in my book.

review.title: Very Clean, Excellent Service, Convenient
review.reviewText:
We had a bay view room, which was very clean and comfortable. The location was excellent, located close to the airport (there were no airplane noise issues) and about a 10 minute ride into the city as it is directly located off Highway 101. It's an ideal location if you want to be based outside the city. You can take the hotel provided airport shuttle to the airport and connect to the BART train from there if you don't want to deal with the extreme difficulty and expense of parking in San Francisco.

The hotel restaurant is adequate, has a good variety of entree selections and the food is tasty. We found it to be a little pricey, but it's the bay area so we chalked it up to the overall pricey-ness of the area. The staff was very friendly and the overall cleanliness of the hotel was impressive. Being able to park at no additional cost (another benefit of being based outside of the city) was a great benefit. Overall this hotel was a nice contrast to the sometimes hectic pace of getting around in San Francisco. We would definitely stay at this hotel on a return visit and recommend it to others.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Good for businesses nearby.
Needed few more choices of restaurants

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Great location if you are going to the airport the next day.

review.title: Clean rooms, great beds, great area!
review.reviewText:
I think the reviewer noting that the hotel needed to be refurbished has his hotels confused. There were no holes in our sheets, or other major signs of wear and tear. I've stayed in some awful hotels. This one wasn't one of them.

The hotel staff was extremely courteous. While they don't have a complimentary breakfast, parking is free, the beds are the second most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel room, the rooms themselves are spotless, and they put out snacks (fruit and cookies) in the lobby. It's just a few minutes away from SFO, and a short drive to San Francisco.

The ONLY problem with our room was a broken phone. It didn't really matter, though, since there were two others (one in the bathroom even!).

If you don't want to drive into the city, the main business area of the town Brisbane is just on the other side of the freeway, and has a few fast food restaurants as well as some local eats. We didn't try the restaurant in the hotel, since there were other, cheaper places so near.

We rented a car, and it proved to be a bit confusing getting around the various major roads, along with parking inside San Francisco, but we had a disabled man in our party, who was unable to take public transit. Had he not been present, I think we could have easily made our way to and from the city via the metro and buses. There's a transit station inside the airport, and the hotel has a shuttle, so traveling without a car is feasible.

review.title: San Francisco's Finest!

The employees were very friendly, helpful & everything from housekeeping, dining, and in general, the atmosphere was almost like been at home. Next trip to San Francisco, we will look for staying again at this wonderful place, thank You!

review.title: Very nice place to stay...the staff was very friendly!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went down for a 49ers game. The hotel was very nice, clean and a very friendly staff. We will definetly stay here again when we come back for another game.

review.title: Clean, modern, convenient
review.reviewText:
This hotel worked out great for what I wanted which was: convenient to both the City and the Peninsula with a gym, free wifi and free parking. I got all of those things and was pleasantly surprised by the comfortable sleep number bed with nice linens, and the proximity to the Bay which provides a pretty view and a running trail.

I was very happy with my stay, the only upgrade I would suggest is to the lattes served in the hotel cafe. Oh well.

review.title: Nice Hotel but will cost you
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel because it's close to Candlestick Park. The staff was very nice and the hotel was nice as well but if you plan on spending any time in actual San Francisco, the cab fare is going to cost you. If you have a rent car then this hotel is a good choice. Average cab ride to downtown SF was around $45 one way. Just food for thought

review.title: Great for kids!
review.reviewText: We took our eight year old twins to San Francisco for a science event at the Exploratorium. We originally looked at hotels right in the city, but settled on the Radisson because it had an indoor pool (and because it was half the price). Total score! We had the pool pretty much to ourselves and the girls definitely made the most of it. The hotel was clean, the staff was wonderful and we were only about a ten minute drive to the city. We will definitely make it our base of operations when we are up in the Bay area.

review.title: Needs a refurb
review.reviewText: This hotel is run down. Our bed blankets had holes in them and the sheets were worn. The restaurant needs and upgrade. The food is okay but over priced. We had a waiter who had no clue about service. He got my order wrong, served the meal and disappeared. Management in my view have no interest in delivering a quality product and that is a shame because the location is ideal for an overnight stay.

review.title: Hotel worked out just fine!
review.reviewText: Location, Location, Location! Perfect for those that have an early flight to catch out of SFO. Also, close enough to enjoy downtown San Francisco at a great price. On-premise Restuarant is only adequate, but, you can easily find your way to the Wharf from this spot, if you have a rental car. Will probably use it again.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and accommodating staff. Very clean and quiet. Good place to stay ... UNLESS your daily activities take you downtown or to the fisherman's wharf area ... do NOT recommend rental car from this hotel. Otherwise, hotel would be hard to beat. Loved it.

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: NIce comfortable stay. No dining options other than the hotel within walking distance. Many other dining options a few miles away by car. This was a good place to stay outside of the city and near the airport.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText:
Our experience was positive the moment we stepped into the lobby. We were tired from a long day of traveling from CT and wanted to quickly check in and grab a bite to eat. The front desk rep was extremely friendly and in no time we were unpacked and back downstairs for dinner. Dinner was a pleasant surprise as we were served a top class meal. We enjoyed 3 more meals over the course of our stay; all consistently good. The hotel gym had enough for our purpose, and the nearby walking/biking trail was a great way to start each day.
We would DEFINITELY stay at this Radisson again!

review.title: 2nd Stay in a few days!
review.reviewText:
The room was clean, but bathroom was not cleaned well - certain marks in 'facilities' I wouldn't expect! Coffee machine - had an old coffee pod in it!
I appreciate that the hotel did accommodate my early arrival at 2.30pm, but standard of cleaning was not good.

I ordered room Service supper, at 8.20pm - was phoned at 8.40pm to say the restaurant was very busy and there would be a delay on my order - fair enough - when I phoned down at 9.30pm and the no one answered, I was concerned - 10mins later the waiter arrived - apologising and patronising! 'I have given you a free Pepsi and extra scoops of ice cream for your patience! $39.47 bill!

When I tried the food - 'Fresh Leek & Potato soup - luke warm and powdery! Pizza cold! The tray had been thrown together - 4 napkins - 2 lots of knives and forks - one spoon for soup and ice cream!

Rang the front desk to say I was unhappy and would not be paying for this food. I was told the restaurant manager would be informed. 1hour later I got a phone call from the Restaurant Manager, who apologised, blamed the busy restaurant and said I would not have to pay! Not at any time was I offered an alternative or was there concern that I could not eat the food!

My feeling is that this hotel needs to sort out is act when it comes to providing food - as I had problems in the said restaurant on my first stay and few days earlier.

I don't think I will be back!

review.title: The good equals out the bads
review.reviewText:
Good: The staff at the front desk was superb. Quick and thorough and got us our keys in less than 15 min. Room was clean. Showers were hot. Cleaning crew did a good job. Parking was easy and location was good and regardless being close to the airport it was very quiet and comfortable (business district is dead on the weekend so it was extremely quiet).

Bad: Even though we booked a one king bed room, we got a two twin bed room. Seems like this always happens, but to us it was minor. We were tired the day we arrived so we decided to try the hotel restaurant, "Xebec" and boy was that a bad choice. Service was slow (we saw three groups that were seated leave because the waiter was so slow), cocktails tasted horrible, fried calamari appetizer was like chewing on a tire, chicken fettucini alfredo with no cream sauce, but a lot of sun dried tomatoes, and procsciutto on top of the risotto was so salty. And it wasn't cheap. Dinner was horrible.

review.title: Great, quiet, clean & comfortable stay and easy freeway access for business stay.
review.reviewText: Very clean, very quiet, business center, nice pool and hot tub. Sleep # beds and nice amenities. I'd definitely stay again.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay next time. This hotel offers great location, just far enough from the city to avoid the traffic & noise. It took no longer than 10-15 minutes to be downtown & the Wharf. The room was great & free parking to boot! Parking in San Francisco is expensive & be careful where you park. The last day of the trip ended with a $85 parking ticket, they ticket for everything!!

review.title: Reasonable Stay!
review.reviewText: As a solo traveller off a 10hour flight it is a good hotel in a quiet location. Decent room - Room Service I felt was average and over priced. Room facilities good. Good Coffee, but not enough creamer / sugar etc for more than one cup! I went down to breakfast - had to wait to be seated in an empty restaurant, with the greeter shouting across the room to me! The menu is confusing and when another guest nearby asked the same question as me - I knew there was something not easy to understand. For a restaurant and hotel of this standard, I would have expected a better choice on the menu - I ordered fruit and full breakfast which all arrived at once! the poached eggs were over cooked, the sausages were burnt and the pancakes were very thick and doughy! All for $12.99 for the breakfast, fruit extra and drinks on top - the 'Fresh Apple and Ginger juice' is from a carton! Having said all that - it's a nice hotel for a quick stop over, but too far away from the main SFO area for a holiday hotel.

review.title: Sleep Number? Zero! Ketchup Extra
review.reviewText:
Always wanted to try a Sleep Number bed - unfortunately the ones in our room were only settable by unplugging one and setting the other.

Breakfast was OK (if a little expensive) - but we had to pay $0.65 for Ketchup!

review.title: Impressed. Close to airport and about 15 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
The walls are not quite sound proof, I can hear the children in the next room when they are talking loud. Coffee in the room is great for morning wake-up call. The bed is very comportable and the view of the waterfront is great (we were in the 5th floor).
The breakfast was quite pricey in the dining room. We went to Grand City(about 10 minutes drive) for breakfast. This town is very old and homey.

review.title: Will go back. Great location
review.reviewText: Great location to S.F. Free parking is a plus

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: The Radisson was very nice, comfortable, and overall a very enjoyable experience. I would happily return.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: wait for travel to hotel approx. 45 mins. had to call 3 times

review.title: worth to recommend
review.reviewText: It was the perfect combination of simplicity and comfort

review.title: Very good for the price
review.reviewText: My stay us pleasant and hotel staffs are very friendly and customer focused.

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: Convenient for the airport, so met that need. Basic hotel, low grade breakfast (food and time).

review.title: Close to the city and economical.
review.reviewText: No restaurants or stores close by, but staff was helpful with giving written directions ans recommendations. No charge for parking. Easy access to highway.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is very good. I had asked for a Bayview room. The view wasn't that great.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, the only downside is the location, there's nothing to do nearby, but if you've got off a long flight and just want to relax it's ideal. Food was very good. The free airport shuttle was doubly useful as I took it back to the airport to get on the BART into San Francisco.

review.title: Radisson - Olk beds and bedding....not my favorite
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to the ariport and my room was clean. The beds are not comfortable, they seem old and they still use old school blankets and bed spreads....I much prefere the Marriott approach to beds and bedding.

review.title: Great hotel pick for San Francisco vacation
review.reviewText: Enjoyed staying at this hotel. Spacious rooms. Free water bottles, refrigerator and microwave in room. Wired intetnet was convenient.

review.title: 1st Time in SF
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and we were able to park our car for free. It is very convenient to the airport. We took staff advice and left our car and took a cab the first day. She told us it would be $12 to get to Fisherman's Wharf and that would be considerably cheaper then parking. The cab ride turned out to be $43 there and $35 back. On subsequent days we drove and parked in a ramp with a $15/day maximum. The pool was only 3-1/2' deep, which may be an issue for some.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: A very comfortable hotel for business travelers, or for tourists, though you definitely need a car if trying to tour from this location.

review.title: Great Stopover
review.reviewText: I arrived for one night between flights after an intense two-week workshop. This brief and very comforting stay allowed for some decompression. Aside from some confusion with the room service menu (not the service), it was everything I needed. Great reception staff.

review.title: Close to San Fran
review.reviewText: Not bad hotel, good price and kids had fun at the pool which no one was at, about a 20 min drive into San Fran.

review.title: Hotel on the bay waterfront
review.reviewText: Good hotel will all need facilities suitable for business and leisure. Close proximity to the bay waterfront but highway directly behind the hotel. Due to proper windows not a problem. Hotel can only be reached by car or with the shuttle bus from the airport.

review.title: A clean and simple hotel room between SFO and San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is close to SFO, so if you are on an early flight, it is a convenient place to stay.
Negative: wireless internet works only in the lobby and even there very patchy. No place to go for breakfast nearby. Hotel's breakfast is not worth mentioning and overpriced.

review.title: Very nice for the price!!!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting and flying out of San Francisco. It is very clean and extremely comfortable. It is not far from the city and just minutes from the airport, too. I was driving a rental car up the coast of California and had no problem navigating through traffic until I reached San Francisco. The traffic is really bad. This hotel sits far enough away from the city so you don't have to deal with the traffic if you don't want to. The people at the front desk were very knowlegable about the best ways to get around without having to drive. We took a tour that picked us up and dropped us off at the hotel. If we had stayed longer, we would have taken the free shuttle to the airport and then caught the Bart Train that goes into the city, too. The hotel's food was good, but a bit expensive. The only other thing that I can think of as a negative is that the hotel didn't offer wireless internet in the rooms. There is an ethernet cord for a laptop, but you can only get a wi-fi signal for a smart phone in the lobby. Overall, it was very nice.

review.title: good hotet fot the price
review.reviewText: THIS IS A GOOD HOTEL FOR THE PRICE. THE HOTEL IS LOCATED ABOUT 18 MIN FROM PIER 39. FACILITIES INCLUDES HEATED WIRLPOOL, INDOOR POOL, MICROWAVE, REFRIGERATOR, FREE PARKING, ETC

review.title: airport convenience hotel
review.reviewText: facility need to be upgraded

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice bed, love to come back again.

review.title: Will use ths hotel again if in the area
review.reviewText: Friendly and welcoming staff - very helpful in showing points of interest and accommodating our needs.

review.title: Comfortable Room at an Affordable Price
review.reviewText: This is the second time my husband, son and I stay at the Radisson and we agree that it is the best hotel considering price, cleanliness & comfort and closeness to Downtown San Francisco. I love that it is a non-smoking hotel; cigarette smoke triggers my allergies and when we stay at other hotels w/ smoking sections, I can always smell the smoke in the hallways. We will continue to stay at this hotel and highly recommend it whether you're traveling alone or with your family.

review.title: Convenient for travel from SFO
review.reviewText: This is a great and affordable hotel, high quality service, great bay-view room, immaculate room and a comfy bed. There is really nothing around this area though so to run errands or grab a bite to eat late at night, I traveled about 20 minutes by car to San Bruno.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: Our stay was just wonderful. We had the executive suite and everything was just perfect. The only negative remark was that at the time of check-in I was asked for my credit card and they added a $50 dollar a day charge just in case of incidental charges. (ex. food, missing items). That just took away extra money for me to spend. (stayed 2 days). Afterward we check-out it would be refunded if no charges were made. Other than that, it was great!

review.title: So far, THE BEST!
review.reviewText: I'm so glad we had this hotel rather than the ones downtown - free from the troubles of the city. This hotel is highly commendable for its cleanliness and comfort. The price is perfectly reasonable. Hotel's location was perfect for us since we toured Sanfo, San Jose, Daly, Bruno, Reedwood cities. (it was our first time to be in the bay area)

review.title: Great overnight spot
review.reviewText: Our trip was for the purpose of seeing two games at AT&T Park and this hotel was perfect for that. Easy off the 101, easy on the 101, and a very short distance to the park. Would only improve if there was some way to have either a shuttle or some sort of transportation directly to the stadium area to avoid driving into that mess. Highly recommend the Raddison.

review.title: Good choice.
review.reviewText: Employees are very friendly. Good Customer service. Very clean and well maintened Hotel. Location is just perfect, only 10 mins. from SFco downtown, so parking is so convenient. Executive type of atmosphere. I'll come back to stay.

review.title: Janne
review.reviewText: if u have car to go to san fran youll be ok.. other than that its quite bit from downtown

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText:
The Radisson Hotel was clean and provided prompt service. Although our room wasn't quite ready until right at 3pm, it gave us the opportunity to enjoy the hotel restaurant Xebec. Xebec was price appropriate and the servings were quite filling. It was a great meal to have before starting off the afternoon. Once we arrived into our room, within about 5 minutes of settling in and looking around, we received a call from the front desk to make sure everything was good. The hotel itself has several door notes indicating it is an "eco-friendly" hotel and that unless specified, will only clean every two days. So if you prefer having your room cleaned daily, then leave the note on the bed each day before you head out. We ended up getting a room with two queen beds, non smoking, bay view and it turned out to be just the resting place we were looking for.

Overall, it was a clean and well kept hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking to explore San Fran but needs a nice bed to end off the day!

review.title: Excellent quality at a very decent price
review.reviewText: We booked the slight upgrade ($10more) for the sleepnumber beds - very worth it. Hotel environment was very clean and high quality. Only downside was internet in roon is not wireless - one cable connection only.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place, courteous people, nice Bay view.

review.title: Nice Quiet Location
review.reviewText: we only stayed one night, but overall it was pretty good, just has a small pool but kids still had fun...

review.title: Great Value and Location!!
review.reviewText: The Radisson Bay Front Hotel is an excellent value and location place to stay. I have stayed here for about three or four visits to S. F. and I keep coming back to this place. It is a great location because when there is no traffic it only takes about 15 minutes to get to the downtown area of S. F. But in addition to that, this hotel has a great restaurant that provides very good meals at a reasonable price. One small drawback was waking up in the middle of the night to the sound of screaming children in the room next door. But this could happen anywhere. I am willing to forgive on that count. Would that we will never find outselves next to families with children.

review.title: Good for a Quick Stay but Not a Lesiurely Vacation
review.reviewText: While I expected the harbor views to be better, it was very convenient. The restaurant was a surprise and I loved the unique furniture. The rooms were fine and the front desk friendly. The only downside was the restaurant kept running out of food that we wanted. Don't be a late riser for breakfast!

review.title: Great for San Fran Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the airport and the shuttle was timely. The food in the restaurant was very good.

review.title: Clean hotel located near the airport
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel the night before I caught a flight out of SFO. The hotel is conveniently located just 2.5 miles from the airport. I booked a room with a water view and I got a room with a partial view of the water and partial view of a lower roof. The decor seemed a bit outdated and the beds weren't Sleep Number beds as promised in the hotel description, but the room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Very Peaceful
review.reviewText: Overall, it was a good experience. We would definitely book the Radisson again. We were on the 5th floor with the beautiful bay view, free internet, and free parking, and great hotel services. I love the fact that we were away from downtown SF where we weren't distracted by car alarms, homeless people, noisy traffic, or bothered by the smell of urine. The hotel was literally 10 minutes away from downtown so it was really convenient (by car). I highly recommend everyone to bring a sweater or jacket because it was very windy in Brisbane. Even when the sun was out, it was still cold and windy. Overall, I would highly recommend this place where the rate is fair, the environment was peaceful with the beautiful view of the bay, it was clean, and we were not disturbed by noises from neighboring rooms.

review.title: perfect for us
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful. Alex at the front desk was knowledgeable and very helpful to us. Room was excellent; clean,bright,fresh and charming. Very convienent to airport and the shuttle was right on time. Thanks Radison

review.title: Quiet, clean, Excellent vacation hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent stay at this hotel. Staff was very attentive to our needs; we switched rooms twice: one for being behind elevator could here it working (i.e coming/going, doors opening/closing) and second time to get away from freeway noise. Hotel is located in a business park so it's quiet and not much traffic as oppose to hotels right at Fisherman's Wharf. Even though there aren't any places near the hotel surroundings it's just a 10-15 minute drive to San Francisco many dining options. I will stay at this hotel on our next trip to this city.

review.title: Nice place with easy access to the City.
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like about this hotel was the dining facility. The food was overpriced and really not very good.

review.title: High praise for middle price hotel
review.reviewText: This was a fine place to stay, very clean, comfortable rooms, great customer service. All the things one would expect at a high price hotel, and this was at an affordable mid-price rate. Very nice!

review.title: Free shuttle to SFO, nice staff
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel because of the free shuttle from SFO, and was pleased it was still running near midnight. I was accommodated by friendly and competent front desk staff. Breakfast was served fast but unhurried. My suite was amazingly nicer than expected, though the room safe was spartan (can't hangle a 17" laptop) and the A/C thermostat indicated a "needs work" symbol. (Because there were two rooms in the suite, I compensated with the other one.) But the room itself was clean and well appointed, the Internet access no fuss and free, and the bed provided a sound sleep environment. I was in SF for just 24 hours, but this hotel would be on my short list for similar short business trips.

review.title: Great night's sleep!
review.reviewText: We both had a great night's sleep. The staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good for a quick stay, very serviceable. Needs a little attention to details though.
review.reviewText: I would say the hotel fit my needs for this stay. I guess it could have cost a little less, but that's not a total deal-breaker. The rooms are typically clean and in good working order. However, there were some details that needed more attention. They have to keep the linen dryer clean... lest there be strangers' hairs (clean tho' they may be by going into the washer and dryer) and that just does not look too appealing to lay on. Another thing was, the continental fruit selection can be very good one day, and comparatively poor the next (as in too ripe or too green). Other than those two issues, I can't really complain. People are mostly helpful when asked for something and have a nice disposition. You can't ask for a lot more in this price range. Again, it's just those kinds little details that could make or break your stay. If they pay attention to them, so much the better for you and for their image.

review.title: Convenient to Airport Quality Hotel
review.reviewText: First class in every respect

review.title: Lina at the front desk was super nice and helpful
review.reviewText: She set me up about an hour before check-in, which gave me time to relax in the hot tub before it became a party. Thanks again!

review.title: Great Staff and location
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay when visiting the Bay Area. The rooms are clean and the staff was very helpful and courteous. We would definitely stay here the next time we're in the area.

While we only ate a breakfast in the hotel restaurant once, the breakfast scrambled eggs were pretty bland. And, being the coffee lover that I am, I would have enjoyed a little more attentiveness to my empty cup! However, my wife and daughter enjoyed their selections. I'm more than willing to give them the benefit of the doubt and suspect that my experience was just a 'glitch.'

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Wife and I spent 4 nights here and enjoyed the stay very much, nice quiet hotel, good bed, speedy internet service, very clean, for the price and free parking, hard to beat this in San Francisco. Our son is in the Giants organization and this hotel provides easy access to the stadium, this will definitely be our permanent place to stay from now on when visiting SF.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: short distance from the main attractions, breakfast was mediocre and pricey, room clean and comfortable.

review.title: Close to airport and not a lot of traffic.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed our stay so much...we stayed twice! It was easy to get to and not a lot of traffic. The pool didn't have a deep end which was good for the kids. Our bathtub was stained but overall the room was very nice. Room service was excellent and the restaurant was good.

review.title: excellent hotel by airport
review.reviewText: very much enjoyed the hotel

review.title: Convenient location- great staff-
review.reviewText: great location, professional staff,- only complaint is their internet connection must be dial-up it is sooooooooo sloooooooow, other than that two thumbs up!

review.title: Cali trip
review.reviewText: pretty decent

review.title: we all had fun
review.reviewText: good clean room freindly staff a good trip

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is great but they need to improve restruant services. Waiters are very rude and very slow.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Very good value for money , for transit or if you already gave a car then it will be good location

review.title: Better Luck Next Time
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean, but not up to date on decor. Seemed a little old. We were greeted promtly and any issues we had were resolved quickly. The staff were pleasant and ready to help any way they could. The hotel was nice and close to the airport and a great price compared to most hotels downtown San Francisco but I think next time we will pay the extra money to stay downtown instead of a little too far away from everything. There wasn't much for restaraunts in the area besides pizza places and they did deliver late into the evening if you needed them to. The restaraunt in the hotel was nice for breakfast but was a little concerned when the chef cut himself and made obscenities and well known he hurt himself. Made me a little concerned as to my food being contaminated.
Overall, the stay was nice and quiet and the staff were very nice. Price was good as well but if your looking for something with things to do and walk to this wouldn't be the place.

review.title: Satisfied.
review.reviewText:
Only problem I had was Parking.
I know the day that I went to hotel was holiday.
but there was not even one parking space.
So i had to drive around hotel 10~15min and decide to park infront of hotel.
I had to wake up 6:30am and went out and move my car to avoid ticket.
but hotel room was very satisfied.

review.title: OK hotel
review.reviewText: Location is convenient, because it is half way to downtown SF and halfway to the Silicon Valley, but nothing special here. Very average hotel, clean and decent. Way better than cheaper ones, but still far from Hyatt, Sheraton or Hilton.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located 3 miles away from airport, and a few miles away from San Francisco. This Radisson does not have parking fees which was wonderful since we rented a car. Our room had a microwave and mini fridge, the bed was very comfortable, the only bad was that the walls are thin. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Decent enough
review.reviewText: Pros: near the airport. Place was pretty clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Cons: bed was uncomfortable, and the pillows worse. Stains on the carpet in the halls, broken light fixtures. Oh and don't get excited about their in room gaming console--its an N64. Didn't matter to me, I just found it funny. Decent enough place for the price really.

review.title: Nice place to stay south of Downtown SF
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice. The sleep number bed was great and the flat panel TV was a bonus. The bar wasn't open late enough. My wife and I spent all day at fisherman's warf, so we wanted to come back to our hotel, relax, and have a few drinks but the bar closed at 10 pm. We found a bar to go to locally. The 7 mile bar has good food but the area definitely isn't the nicest. But the bartender was friendly and the company was your typical blue collar worker.
I would reccomend this bar to someone who, after a long day, wants to get away from the downtown scene. Oh, and we had a great view from our room also.

review.title: I'll be back!
review.reviewText:
Awesome hotel, everything was top notch, way to go all!

Rick & June

review.title: Conveniently close to SFO, and between San Francisco and the Silicon Valley
review.reviewText: This hotel is quite confortable and it is in very good shape. It is not a luxury hotel, but it works great for a stay in the Bay Area. It has a great location: it is close to San Francisco Airport, and right in between the city of San Francisco and the Silicon Valley. Given that I had stuff to do on both locations, being in the middle was very convenient for me. I would stay there again for sure.

review.title: Good Hotel, poor location
review.reviewText: The hotel and bar are great but the hotel is located in a business sector with only offices within walking distance, no other dining options other than the hotel.

review.title: Bay Area Radisson
review.reviewText: This hotel was a little from the airport than I expected, but it made up for it in the comfort. I will most likely stay there again if I'm in the area!

review.title: 10 minutes to San Francisco
review.reviewText: So convenient to San Francisco, with free parking.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Convenient location on the way to downtown SFO
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for its location near the highway between SFO and downtown. Overall the hotel met our expectations, the rooms were clean, service was friendly, and the location was fairly quiet. Note that there is nothing directly around the hotel! For a restaurant, you will have to go south one or two exits on the highway to find anything to eat!

review.title: really enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: this was a last minute reservation as we changed hotels after just one night as we were so unhappy with prior reservation. Room was wonderful, staff was great. Ordered room service, food delivered very quickly, it was hot and very good, and staff called later to see if we were happy with our food and service. Would stay at a Radisson again due to the wonderful experience we had with this one.

review.title: Not what we reserved
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of the indoor pool and adjoining bedrooms for our family of 5 on vacation. Upon check, we were told they had booked us for two king rooms that each had only one king bed (we had booked adjoining queen rooms), and we could not have adjoining rooms because none were available (since they had our reservation wrong), and the pool was out of service (which would have been nice to know when we booked). The checkin clerk was rude and kept telling me she was "upgrading" us to the business floor, which meant we got a desk in our rooms, which did not adjoin, Big deal. When asked about restaurants in the area, the only one they would reccomend was their own. The business center printers were out of order, and the room keys had to be recoded several times (which we would find out about at the end of the day when we tried to get into our rooms, then had to go back down to the lobby to have then rekeyed). Great location for business in teh area, not for families. Had we known they were not able to accomodate us with the adjoining rooms and the pool, we would have stayed at Fishermans Wharf which was much more convenient to our activities, but adjoining rooms and the pool were important to our family for this vacation.

review.title: I would recommend any of my family or friends to stay there. Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location, near the airport and especially near by where my family lives. On the day we were leaving San Francisco our flight got delay the hotel clerk was very helpful to let us stay couple more hours before we could check out, we were three and my mom was in a wheelchair traveling with us, so it made it very easy for all of us. I just want to say Mahalo (means thank you)

review.title: great
review.reviewText: everything was great, thanks.

review.title: Nice Place & No Charge for Parking
review.reviewText: The location worked well for us and the main reason we selected this hotel was due to the outrageous rates charged by downtown hotels for parking. We rented a vehicle because we prefer to go where we want, when we want to and not depend on the tours. This was close enough for us to get to the bridge and Fisherman's Wharf in less than an hour even in traffic. The only problem was if you did not eat in the hotel's dining room, you had to travel to find other locations. There are only other hotels and office buildings at this exit. Overall, I would not hesitate recommending this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to come back!!!
review.reviewText: My wife and I went to San Francisco for our anniversary and staid here one day it was real nice we loved it!! The view was great but it was raining the whole time!! The only thing u have to drive everywhere and get on the Fwy! Other than that the hotel was just great!!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great hotel - onsite restaurant service poor
review.reviewText: Quality of Service "3" because of on-site restaurant - otherwise great stay! The location was perfect - easy access to the expressway. Friendly front desk staff, easy check in, and the room key worked on the first try! The restaurant wait staff, however, did not provide good service. And the food was not that good. My first night there I ordered an expensive steak and almost 1/2 of it was fat; when I showed the server, his response was basically, "oh well. . ." He did not offer a different cut or different menu selection. Normally, this would not have been a big deal, because I would of just found a different place to eat. But there were no close dinning alternatives in the area. The service quality remained poor my entire four day stay. Hotel comfort and service were quite good though.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Easy access, beautiful location, spacious and convenient rooms, very nice restaurant with friendly staff and good food, great atmosphere. Oh, and free parking. Truly very nice hotel.

review.title: Hop and a skip away.
review.reviewText: Hotel was excellent. We were able to check in 4 hours early. Room service was very fast. Restaurant was outstanding as well as the bar. 10 second drive to 101 FWY. 5 minute drive north of SFO. Very view of the harbor.

review.title: "BOTH HANDS UP"
review.reviewText: I really enjoy staying at this hotel. Friendly crew, clean rooms great amenities (specially the indoor pool) & good food.... OVERALL RATING is BOTH HANDS UP!!!!..... This will definitely be our place for a weekend get away.

review.title: Pretty Pathetinc
review.reviewText:
This hotel had a comparatively good review that was the reason I stayed there. Though my stay was not very pleasant. Here is the list of things that I noticed
1- One of the sleep number beds did not work.
2- Bathroom shower head was leaking so the water will spill outside the tub
3- Main Ethernet cable was not working I had to take cable out of TV
4- The chairs were chipped and looked really cheap not expecting from 3 star hotel
5- Walls were thin so you will hear next door clearly
6- I ordered breakfast for two. It was not eatable so I wasted good amount of money on that.
Overall I was not pleased. I did not bother to tell the property because they were surly very busy I was staying there for weekend only. Also the front desk personals were not friendly and welcoming

review.title: Good value for the money. Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with friendly staff. No problems. The only downsides were getting back to the hotel if you're traveling south on the freeway. There is no exit for the hotel. You have to get off 2 miles before or after. The hotel and room was really clean. The only thing I didn't like was the pillows. They all smelled sweaty and had those yellow sweat stains on them. The pillow shams were clean though. I would stay here again, but bring my own pillow.

review.title: Very Good overall stay
review.reviewText: Clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable bed, no outside or Heater noise. We had a very good night sleep. Very good breakfast options and service. Nice Bay view. We'd definetely come back!

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText:
Great little Hotel. Clean and very nice.
Airport shuttle driver was very friendly but droped us off in the wrong location at SFO. We also waited for ages to be picked up again at the airport.

review.title: weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel because a particular event we came for was being held there. Overall this was very comfortable hotel and convenient location for us. Important for me that the hotel's I book have a restaurant and room service -- this hotel had both. We only had breakfast once and the experience was excellent. Only downside of this hotel is there does not seem to be much of anything in the general area -- I could be wrong since we did not really explore -- but the good thing about this is its a very quiet and calm spot outside the hustle and bustle of a big city. Its a nice / short drive in to the city -- one day we drove in for Fisherman's Wharf and second day was China Town. So overall, this hotel was a nice and quiet home base outside the city.

review.title: Weekend in San Fran.
review.reviewText:
Easy in and out off the freeway 101, Clean rooms and nice staff.
Drinks and pizza in the bar were a little pricey, but good.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. The beds were very comfortable. Room service was on time. The food was okay.

review.title: SF hotel
review.reviewText: nice hotel in convenient location. As a bonus--great views from the room

review.title: nice stay !
review.reviewText:
Hotel was good ! very nice stay.
the only thing is that waitress was very annoying. eventough i had the dont disturb sign, she was knocking at door.
but everything else it was very good!

review.title: Just practical. Nothing more. There is NO neighborhood to speak of.
review.reviewText: Very isolated location but super practical for SFO and on/off freeway. The carpet outside of our hotel room was unsightly but the inside of our room was impeccable. Business services were lacking.

review.title: San fran trip 2010
review.reviewText: Checkin time is 3:00 pm that was a bummer for us, as we drive from la to brisbane and was there 10:00 am . Overall nice experience, staff was nice, they have complimentary cookies and milk in the lobby in the pm time, work great with young kids.will stay again.

review.title: Just what you would expect
review.reviewText: This is a good place to rest for a night on your way somewhere else.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: At first I was afraid to stay at a Radisson, but after this stay I'm not. It was really nice. Clean, updated rooms and the hotel staff was very nice.

review.title: Easy commute by car to the city or airport
review.reviewText: The shower didnt work; and the bath was dirty. Unfortunately after we checked in we basically dumped our suitcases and went out and didn't return until midnight; so it was a pain to deal with when we noticed as we just wanted to go to bed. That said; the customer service was very good. They promptly brought us keys to another room.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: This hotel was very accomodating and we would definitely stay here again on future visits and recommend it to others. We were allowed to check in early, given extra towels, sheets and blankets upon request, staff members were very friendly and helpful, there in an indoor heated pool, free parking, hot coffee and tea in the lobby in the a.m plus cookies and milk in the afternoons. The location seems a little random but I found it nice to be away from the hustle and bustle and its super convenient to SF, SSF and the peninsula area.

review.title: Not reccommended for those seeking a late night drink.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly, we got in very late and the room service/ bar was closed for the night. The front desk offered no suggestions to find a place near by to get a drink. No mini bar. Very disappointing.

review.title: Excellent restaurant at the Radison
review.reviewText: For an airport hotel, this was very nice. Good business center and most surprising was a nice bar and good food in the restuarant with an interesting menu.

review.title: Everything I expected
review.reviewText: The shuttle service from the airport was slow, but the service back was excelent.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
In summary it is disappointing to have a good hotel let down by the Restaurant Manager not doing his/her job and creating the negative feelings to the point you don't want to return.

M. Urquhart. New Zealand.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: Excellent Service

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Nice place, very comfortable, clean with friendly staff. Seemed to be a disconnect between restaurant and hotel but otherwise great visit - definitely will stay here again.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: No place to walk to get a soda or newspaper..

review.title: Nice and quiet, 15 min from down town san francisco
review.reviewText:
Very satisfied. Stayed 3 nights, the people were extremely nice while checking in.
This hotel is 15 min from down town san francisco and 3 min from airport. I sugget a rental car to cruise the town!
Hotel was very clean. My husband didnt like that they ran out of chicken wings one night and they took long to serve our food and drinks at the bar. It appeared that the waiter called out sick or something because the bartender was also the waiter and cashier! I would stay there again.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel near the San Fransisco Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel desk clerks were very helpful and really made you feel welcome. The free coffee in the lobby was fresh for late morning and they went out of their way to check us in as soon as possible. The room was clean, accommodating and quite for a hotel with a close location to San Francisco Airport. The hotel shuttle was on time to the airport. That point is important for anyone trying to make their flight. The hotel clerk was very helpful in getting us information about San Francisco for a day trip. Many Thanks Radisson.

review.title: enjoyed stay!
review.reviewText: We liked that the hotel wasn't in the city. There wasn't any traffic and it was easy to find. Liked the free parking. It was close to the freeway. The staff was very nice. The rooms were clean. We would definately stay here again.

review.title: The rooms DON'T match the rest of the hotel!
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean, yes, but so old! They looked like they had nto been updated in 20 years! I definitely expected something way different from the look of the outside of the hotel, the lobby, and the hallways. But, as soon as I opened the door, it was like traveling back in time! Not impressed at all.

review.title: Nice and Comfy
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean and comfortable I was in town for a couble of days. I requested a smoking room thru expedia travel was not aware of the no smoking policy . The staff was friendly when they explain this is a no smoking hotel they have plenty of parking and you are always greeted with a smile the large king size bed is comfy also. I am a smoker I would stay again if the had a smoking room.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel. Not a lot of places to eat breakfast around.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: The Radisson is the perfect location to visit San Francisco. It's clean, affordable and I avoided paying costly parking fees. The staff is friendly and courteous. I'll be staying there each time I visit SF.

review.title: Nice stay in SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very convenient. Now I know where to stay the next time my Steelers visit Candlestick Park.

review.title: Future Visit.
review.reviewText: Would say at this hotel again if a future visit warrants it.

review.title: Radisson Hotel San Francisco-Good place
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely situated and convenient for many locations. The room was spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and their service. Parking was never a problem. The immediate area around the hotel was quiet and appeared safe at all times. You definitely need some kind of transportation to get to other restarauntsor stores as there isn't anything else but the hotel eating area available there. The location was very convenient for the highway {101} to get to the local attatractions. We would defintely consider staying at this hotel again,

review.title: This Radisson missed the mark
review.reviewText:
The building and the grounds were clean and well maintained. The service at the front desk was timely and courteous. The bar/restaurant staff seemed rather unfriendly or preoccupied however. My actual check-in was faster than the service at my table.

My room was pretty clean and very quiet. Unfortunately the top cover or comforter on my bed did not seem very clean. It was very worn out and should have been discarded. It was covered with those little lint balls or “pills”. There was also a large rust colored stain in the bathtub. These things were a disappointment considering the price of the room.

review.title: Clean and close to the airport.
review.reviewText: The room was quite plain but very clean and exactly as purchased through Expedia (2 Q/S beds). Even though it was very close to the airport, it was not noisy at all. The shuttle to and from the airport was a bit erratic, possibly because of variances in the passenger volume. This hotel is in a business park and there is NO shopping of any kind nearby. It has a lounge, a restaurant and a small gift shop with snacks, but all closed by 11 PM. We took the shuttle to the BART station at the airport and then used public transit to explore SFO. It was economical and a fun experience. The pool, hot tub and sauna were just the thing for the aching muscles after a BIG day of touring. All 3 are open until 10 PM. This hotel is well suited for the business traveler and good value.

review.title: Good deal, despite minor annoyances
review.reviewText:
A nice place to stay despite the fact that you have to pay extra if you show up before check-in time. Service, for the most part, was friendly and professional.
The restaurant in the hotel had good food for the price, with the exception of the breakfast menu. Our last day in the area found us waiting for the restaurant doors to open, which was supposed to be 6:30am. There were two large groups waiting for their buffet on the same morning and obviously not enough staff to cover the crowd. One had to feel for the sole waitress, who was up to her ears trying to keep everyone satisfied. Who was in charge of that fiasco?

review.title: Second visit and we'll stay there again.
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel and convenient yet quiet area. Beds are super confortable and room had a micro and refrigerator for convenience. Nice desk for computer and the hotel has classy restaurant and bar were reasonable. We stayed 6 nights and the price was quite reasonable.

We'll be back there next trip to South San Francisco.

review.title: Very satisfied with the service
review.reviewText: I was here for one night before a business meeting. Check in was fast and easy, and the hotel staff was friendly. I don't think it's a great place for tourists, as it's out of the way, but it's great freeway access to both S.F. and the Silicon Valley.

review.title: Lovely, quiet location
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel in a quiet part of San Francisco overlooking the bay. We had a car so we could leave anytime we wished, but we did dine in the restaurant downstairs, which was exceptional. Some comments I read before registering didn't like the food, but it is Mediterranean and really excellent. The beds were comfortable (very important for me), we loved the refrigerator to keep medication and food, and the room was lovely. We did move next door to the Homewood Suites by Hilton for the next four days which offered breakfast as well, but still dined at the Radisson's restaurant.

review.title: A little far from the CIty
review.reviewText: The Check in time was at 3:00PM, being a semi novice traveler am not sure if that is normal, but I always thought that normal check in times were around 1. We did end up paying extra to get in "earlier" and upgrade to a sleep number bed, which my wife didnt like at all. But for an airport hotel, I thought it was nice and we didnt have to pay for parking. The only other thing was that this hotel was not near anything! You really ought to have a car to get around if you stay at this hotel. And if you really want to visit SF you might as well pay extra, ditch the car and stay in the city.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very convienent either to downtown or south. Room was clean and big enough for us (3 people) to move around. Highly recommended.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the quality of this hotel. The rooms are very nice looking, clean, and spacious. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is located in a corporate park 5 miles from the San Fran International and 7 miles from downtown SF in a quiet area along the bay. Not much of a view on my side of the hotel but not unattractive either. The restaurant in the hotel is very good, btw (much better than I anticipated). Parking is free (a huge plus in San Fran). Will definitely stay here again when I return to SF.

review.title: Clean, Convenient, Important Advantages
review.reviewText: I needed a room close enought to the airport for an early Sunday morning flight but convenient to downtown for tourism. This hotel was clean throughout. The freeway on ramp access to downtown San Francisco was highly convenient yet the hotel is far enough from the freeway that no noise is heard. Some important benefits of this hotel was the free high speed in room wired internet access; the free and easy parking. Also, the restaurant and bar area is nice to have a conversation either at the bar, table or sofa. Overall, excellent value for money with polite service.

review.title: Good SF location
review.reviewText: It was a very convenient place to stay for visits to SF. However, traffic entering the city can be VERY congested, depending on time/day.

review.title: Good Location - Great Stay
review.reviewText: Good Location. Very convenient for visiting the Mission area. There was hardly any traffic and it was very quiet. The bed was comfortable. Didn't get a chance to use the pool but will definitely stay here again. Easy access in and out.

review.title: Too far from transportation
review.reviewText: We had a two night stay and they checked us out after one night. Had to wait 30 plus minutes until we got into our room. My Son and I had to be up early the next day and we were very tired. Then they called us at 945pm to ask me for a credit card on incidentals. Very unprofessional and I hung up and went back to bed. The next day at check out they credited me the up grade that i had to take because of two beds not being available. I left satisfied but will not stay there again. The restaurant was not open when stated and had to be servised by the bar. The steak was very expensive and had to send back for being over cooked. It is clean and there is no public transportation near by to be able to sight see.

review.title: Horrible Shuttle Experience but a Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: The shuttle pick-up from the airport was a disaster. When I called the hotel they told me that the shuttle would be at the airport in 15 minutes. It didn't show up. I called again and was put on hold indeffinately. Called again and the hotel told me that the shuttle driver could not be reached. The shuttle eventually showed up an hour later. Not a good way to greet customers.

review.title: Good if you have a car.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is well located so long as you have a car. The 101 runs right past it but traffic noise was never a problem. Otherwise, it is in the middle of nowhere.
With a car you are around 15-20 mins to the City and only 5-10 mins to SFO airport on the Freeway right next to the hotel. Car parking is free and we never had any problems finding a space - sometimes right at the front door.

The hotel is clean, although the room cleaning could be a bit more diligent as we found a previous customers old sock (singular) under a bed along with a layer of muck.

The hotel has a small, but adequate, swimming pool and a seperate spa pool.

We didn't use the restaurant, so can't comment on that.

Overall, this hotel was as good as, and sometimes better than the 3 1/2 stars shown on Expedia. However, some areas could do with a refurb.

Staff were always polite and helpful.

review.title: Quiet place
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent! Especially Amy at the front desk. We upgraded to a "Sleep Number Bed" room. The room was very nice and clean. We had very noisy neighbors the first night, but the hotel staff made it "right". We returned later in the week and had excellent service.

review.title: Radisson's the best
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with the hotel, service and convenience to downtown San Francisco. Would have preferred a less formal and more casual dining area in addition to the formal restaurant.

review.title: "Had a Bad Experience"
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice for the price but unfortunately we had a bad experience with an employee lying to us about the cable being out in the entire hotel and we found out later that the employee lied since he did not know what to do about our cable being out soley in our room. So based off of that I could not recommend the hotel to anyone.

review.title: San Fran stop on way to Kings Canyon Nat. Park.
review.reviewText: I found the room to be quite comfortable and a good value for the San Francisco area. Had a bay view room on the fifth floor and was well pleased. Bathroom was clean and supplied as expected. AC worked well and the bed was comfortable. Hotel is only a ten minute drive to fishermans wharf area and is easy to navigate. Parking was good. Only dealt with the staff at check-in and it met expectations. Restaurant was good but expensive.

review.title: Absolutely perfect as long as you have a car!
review.reviewText:
PROS: FREE PARKING, we pay up to $30/day at other hotels! Hotel was affordable and extremely comfortable. Rooms are huge and the heated pool and jacuzzi are indoors. It's about 10-12 minutes from Union Square, so long as you have a car there's no reason to stay closer to downtown. Location is very safe and clean, not crowded, no unsavory characters around whatsoever. Beautiful views, well decorated. We usually stay in the boutique hotels in the financial district or union square area, but from now on this will be our first choice, it was fantastic. We spent most of our time out of the room but it was so big and the jacuzzi was so nice that even staying in would have been very comfortable. Our room had fridge and microwave in it at no charge, but I don't know if that's true for all rooms.

Cons: There is a restaurant in the hotel, but the food is AWFUL. We had the lasagna (which is usually a safe bet, hard to mess up) and it was INEDIBLE. We had to order a pizza to the room, it was so disgusting. And we eat macaroni and cheese at home, so we're not very picky! Aside from the restaurant in the hotel, the closest food is about ten minutes away, so if you don't have a car that could be a problem. The only other issue was that the hotel advertised sleep number beds, which was a big selling point for us. When we got there they told us that only certain (more expensive) rooms had them. I complained & they did upgrade us for free, but beware if that is a big deal to you.

review.title: Best bang for your buck!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, suited our needs perfectly, traveled with our 3 kids, they loved the indoor heated pool and spa, experienced the sleep number bed, it was just ok...loved the fact that they had plenty of free parking, close fwy access, approx 10 min to downtown San Fran, would stay here again., Not much nearby but the rooms come with a mini fridge and a microwave, so dont forget to bring drinks and microwave popcorn!

review.title: Feedback from a frequent customer
review.reviewText: I called a few hours prior to my arrival and spoke to the front desk regarding my requests for room of my preference. When I got there I was presented with rooms I had requested. This hotel is always clean and I had stayed there many times.

review.title: Will Definitely Stay Here Again!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! Clean! Well maintained. It was well worth the drive for our needs! The room was very clean and kept. I will definitely consider staying here again next time I'm in San Fransisco! And the bed...ah...a dream!

review.title: Be careful what you ask for.....you won't get it.
review.reviewText: Ok rooms...no 4 star. Was told they had smoking rooms available....not so. Just so so beds and rooms. Staff gets 5 stars...they were great. In fact, that was the only thing this hotel really has going for it. Oh room service was good.

review.title: SFO Radisson
review.reviewText: Nice place..

review.title: Clean, convenient, close to airport and city
review.reviewText:
Plus:
Free Parking, Free Internet, close to Airport (Free Shuttle from 4:30 am till late) and City. Spatious and quite clean rooms. Good price/quality ratio. On Bay Shore.

Minus:
In the middle of nowhere, to get to restaurants or the city you will need a car, (free shuttle to the airport). Breakfast not included and in a elderly dining hall, service nice but on the whole overpriced and not terrible clean.

review.title: No charge for parking!
review.reviewText: The hotel room was extremely clean and spacious. One great feature of the hotel is that it doesn't charge for parking....a definite plus for the San Francisco area. The only downside to the room was the very hard mattresses. The hotel boasts of the sleep by number beds but I was unable to find any setting that offered comfort. However, my family and I were so exhausted from sightseeing that the mattresses did not prevent us from getting a good night sleep. Overall we loved the hotel and location and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Anniversay Trip
review.reviewText: The clerk at check in was very pleasant. The hotel was kept very clean. The only thing that was a bummer, was we had to go to a separate floor to get ice.

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: My husband and I liked the location and we want to return with our bikes, there is a great bike path across the street along the bay. The hotel was very accomodating and provided us with easy directions to the closest groery store etc. since we were traveling with an infant. The hotel was only 10 minutes from the Pier and was convenient since the hotel was right off the freeway. I recommend the executive rooms since you have a great view and can upgrade for a refrigerator and microwave, very convenient if you have kids...

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and the only complaint was the bed. They have "sleep number" beds which I found uncomfortable. The first night they put us in a handicapped room which had a pedestal sink in the bathroom with no place to set your belongings. We asked to be moved the next day and they did so.

review.title: I will return again if I am in the area, for sure.
review.reviewText: We checked into the Radisson in the late morning after a long flight from Asia. The check in was pleasant, smooth and fast. I only spent 2-3 minutes at the check in counter, and even though we arrived at 11am, they had a room ready for us. It had a decent view of the carpark and part of the bay. Room was big, with 2 queen beds. Free wifi was working. Bath was leaking abit but the maintenance man came within 10 minutes of us calling the front desk and fixed it in no time. All in all, it was a good experience. I will surely return

review.title: OK, just OK
review.reviewText: Room was clean, small fridge was a plus, but the beds were sooo uncomfortable. Cheap mattresses, like sleeping on a board. Room would have been great if there were comfortable beds. Unfortunately, the beds are the most important aspect of a room....no sleep....Also, don't expect to fine "any" convenience stores or restaurants close by, need to drive quite a few miles to find anything. Nice view though.

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: The hotel was did not meet my expectations. The bed was uncomfrtable. At check-in my internet connection did not work. The carpet on the hallway look very tired and they need to be replaced. Fire alarm at 6:00am on a Sunday morning. Overall, it was just an ok hotel

review.title: Horrible stay
review.reviewText:
Since we were not able to find nice SF downtown hotel, we spent 2 nights there.
I requested "Smorking room" for my mother-in-law, however they did not hold it for us and gave us "Non-smorking disabled room" which is designed for wheel-chair user.
Last morning, the fire-alarm was buzzed and we had to go outside, however, there were no fire occurred actually. We did not recieve any explanation and apology from them.
I do not recommend you to stay there.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: Easy to reach from airport and then go sightseeing in city. Comfortable room with good internet access.

review.title: Not too Impressed
review.reviewText: Disappointed that I did not get a sleep number bed. It wasn't a deal breaker - but after a long flight - it would have been nice. There was also loud thumping - not sure what that was - I suppose it didn't help that we were near the elevators? There is not much nearby for food - and the on/off ramps are a bit incovenient...but the hotel was clean - so that's a big plus! I probably wouldn't stay there again - I'd find something a little closer to amenities.

review.title: free internet, free parking, hard to find in these area and short hop to SF attractions
review.reviewText: free internet, free parking, hard to find in these area and short hop to SF attractions

review.title: Loved San Fransico
review.reviewText: We loved visiting San Fransico and our hotel was only ten minutes away from downtown. The hotel staff was wonderful and helpful and we would definitely stay there again. Something else to think about is parking was free.

review.title: Nice but a little far....
review.reviewText:
Very easy to get to after you leave the airport. Although a little farther than we downtown, fisherman's wharf, china town, japan town, Golden Gates, Muir woods etc.....but the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel made up for it. Well worth the money. We had a great weekend in SF.

Just a side note, (we thought it was funny) some staff members didn't know where the emergency stairs were.

review.title: For the price I paid, it was Ok. Their resturant was great.
review.reviewText: This hotel is ok, but the resturant was great. It's few miles from the airport and few miles from SF city which is convinient. Only problem was that there was nothing around the hotel. Only few offices and that's it.

review.title: good hotel-satisfied overall
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and gave us prompt service. The hotel is very clean and our room was very spacious and comfortable. Had to go down two floors to get ice. FYI-the in-house restaurant is very slow. We sat down for breakfast, waited 10 minutes and no one ever came by our table so we just left and went in town. It is convenient to downtown San Francisco via car. It is conveniently located just off of the freeway.

review.title: Good hotel, nice location
review.reviewText:
Pros:
+ This hotel is a convenient base camp for visiting San Francisco - provided you have a rental car, which I did, and then its a quick 10-15 minute drive to downtown San Francisco from the hotel. The Free parking is a great bonus, which not many hotels in this are a seem to have. Restaurant in hotel had a good breakfast menu, though it was somewhat expensive.
+ Stunning view of the bay from the room we had, and amazingly fast wired internet in the room.

Cons:
- The hotel is in the middle of a business complex and there is absolutely nothing else around - no restaurants/shops/anything, in case you want a bite to eat or shop for any forgotten necessities.
- The hotel advertised that their concierge would be able to help with planning sightseeing trips of the city, but all the help the lady could offer us was a map and a guidebook to San Francisco. She wasn't able to make useful recommendations or provide tips on traffic/parking/restaurant options.

review.title: Great location if you have a car
review.reviewText: This location is great if you are renting a car - free parking, and easy freeway access to get anywhere in the bay area. Staff were friendly and responsive. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Price for the San Francisco Area
review.reviewText: I had a great rate during my stay, but I had to travel back and forth to downtown San Francisco with a car. Location is away from everything. The hotel faced the water with sail boats. The hotel is located apprx 15 minutes to the airport. Customer service and room service was superb. I enjoyed my stay and hope to go back soon.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, very friendly and clean, would definitely stay again

review.title: Overall OK
review.reviewText: Breakfast was not free. Hard to find a restaurant in the neighborhood if you don't have a car.

review.title: great hotel for my purposes
review.reviewText: Easy free way access; nice walking/jogging opportunity along bay; cute little town of Brisbane with a nice coffee shop. Hotel restaurant is excellent!! Will definitely stay there again. Hotel staff very responsive and helpful and well informed.

review.title: Randy
review.reviewText:
It's a good hotel in a great location. The front desk staff were very helpful, and seemed to be well trained, which was nice. There were lots of amenities. They had desktop computers in the business center for use for free. That was geat, as I don't t ravel with a lap top.

The hotel is in a great location if you're going back and fort to the city. very close. About 6 to 7 miles , much closer than the airport hotles. Probalby about 4 to 6 miiles closer, and the area is fairly quiet. There's not much to do in the area of the hotel, but that' o.k. You're there to enjoy the big cities to the north, south and east of you. I recommend it highly!

review.title: Brisbane by the Bay
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for a very personal reason and wanted to stay somewhere centrally located between San Bruno and Fishermans' Wharf and this was a perfect location. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds are well manicured and the view of the bay was magical. We can't wait to go back and stay there while visiting friends and taking care of business.

review.title: san fran radisson 2010
review.reviewText: it was a a very nice hotel and the staff were friendly. Loved that they had a gym, pool, jacuzzi and computer room that was open and easy to use until late. Also, the restuarant in the hotel was our destination one night and the decor was lovely. Pasta was OK, salmon was better. Did not particularly like the location, it was kind of a secluded cluster of hotels over in this bay area. felt alittle remote even though it really was only a few miles from the San Francisco downtown area and airport.. Overall, it was a nice clean atmosphere. Good price deal for the quality

review.title: besy deal for the price
review.reviewText: very nice locatelike the jet promotion free parking the car and everything very nice

review.title: I would return again and again without any question
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel! The staff was attentive, helpful and nice. The rooms were clean. The housekeeping staff was gracious, friendly and accommodating when I needed extra items. I paid for another hotel that was as many stars but the Radisson was less expensive at stars above in quality. If I need a hotel close to the airport I will return again.
review.userLocation: Fort Collins, CO and Xiamen China

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: My bed was comfortable. The room was very clean. This hotel was better than I expected.

review.title: Hassle-free
review.reviewText: Great in-house restaurant, room service, friendly staff, very clean & free parking. Only negative would be if you're staying to visit Downtown, entertainment & food options very limited. A Downtown hotel would be advisable.

review.title: Would Recommend to out of town guest
review.reviewText: Great for families. Enjoyed the indoor pool (3.5 ft-great for kids) and jacuzzi. Restaurant a little pricey but great staff & service.

review.title: Definitely would stay here again
review.reviewText: Just got back from San Francisco and can't wait to go back. We were very pleased with this hotel. Although this Radisson is about 15 minutes from Fisherman's Wharf and Downtown, it is right off of Highway 101 so it is really easy to get around. Internet and parking is free, the restaurant serves good food, and there is a fitness room and pool. However, I would definitely reserve a room in the Executive Tower. I had originally reserved a standard guest room and had to upgrade when we arrived. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and courteous in doing this even though we arrived at midnight. The standard guest room isn't horrible, it just didn't fit a 3 and half star standard in my mind. I recommend this hotel, especially if you are planning on exploring many areas of Northern California.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value for the location

review.title: san fran stay
review.reviewText:
Nice room. Great view. A crib was provided for our baby. Bed was comfortable.
Food was pricey.

review.title: AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME!!!!
review.reviewText: awesome hotel. happy & friendly staff, super clean hotel and rooms. excellent customer service and easy to find. so many ammentities, completely super satisfied and would definitely recommend!!!!!

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText:
Pros:
* Excellent location: 10miles drive to SanFrancisco (North), about 25-30miles for Mountain View, Stanford (South)
* Nice clean hotel
* Free parking + free broadband internet
* Rooms have a mini-microwave

Neutral:
* No shops/facilities within 5 miles

Cons:
* No shuttle to SanFrancisco city

Bottomline:
Almost all hotels in the city charge for parking per night. Parking is free in this hotel, but the free courtesy shuttle only drops you at SFO airport for transit. BART trains run from SFO airport to city but commuting turns out to be extremely expensive - $16 per person (return trip from SFO airport - SanFrancisco City)

If you find a hotel in the city that charges $10 per day for parking, then definitely choose that. Public parking in the city will be $20+ per day.

review.title: I'LL BE BACK
review.reviewText: IF YOU ARE IN THE SANFRANCISCO AREA STAY HERE.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, every thing was perferct.

review.title: Best by the bay.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, convenient and courteous

review.title: Can't wait to go back again.
review.reviewText: My wife love this hotel very much, it is very quite in the water front area, and it easy to get on fwy 101 to down town San Francisco less than 10 minute, I had been stay in this hotel for many year, each time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Overall it's not a bad one.
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly but the temperature of the room is kind of low and can not be adjusted. The pillows are not very comfortable, either. Other than that, the hotel is very clean and comfortable.

review.title: We will certainly go back.
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel close to the airport and downton. The hotel offers services as a restaurant, free internet service and free parking. I would recommend this hotel to visitors. Continental breakfast is not offered but there was a coffe maker in our room.

review.title: Brisbane close to attractions San Francisco
review.reviewText: would go back see above

review.title: highly recommended!
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. Everything was great!

review.title: Very nice hotel with pleasant staff
review.reviewText: The hotel services business people who are going to meetings in nearby buildings. There are no neighborhood businesses. You'd need a car to get to any market or pharmacy. The hotel is well-maintained. There should be better signage to get to the hotel, since it is off the main road and the area isn't built up yet. I was very excited to find the "special offer" for this hotel on your site.

review.title: Fun In San Francisco
