review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel. THe staff is great. I smelled smoking on my floor and let the front desk know and they moved me immediately. They did say the floor was half smoking and half non smoking. I would recommend staying here if you are going to be flying out of San Francisco or just visiting.

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: nice place, clean, the food was pretty good, a little pricey but it is san fransisco. the beds were comfortable and the view was pretty good. I would stay there again.

review.title: Decent Room for a Decent Price
review.reviewText: For just overnight, we were pleasantly surprised with the Radisson. The location is convenient to SF, shopping, and restaurants. Plenty of parking.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was pretty nice - the room was a bit small for the price. Everything was really clean. My only complaint was that the comforter was extremely heavy and we had to sleep without it, so it was hard to get the heat regulated.

review.title: Nice hotel, free parking!
review.reviewText: We passed through San Francisco during the Thanksgiving break and stayed at the Radisson overnight. The hotel was very nice and had some great amenties, including a heated indoor pool, gym, free internet, and free parking! (a rarity in San Francisco) We usually stay in the Union Square area or Fisherman's Wharf during our trips to San Francisco, so it was a pleasant surprise not to pay 45 dollars a night for parking. The hotel room was clean and fairly large, the staff was friendly and helpful. We couldn't ask for much more since we were only passing through. However, if you are planning to take in San Francisco on an extended stay, you would probably be better off staying in the touristy areas, since this hotel is a distance from the city. You can still drive into the city, but driving/parking is a nightmare. Public transportation (ie Cable car) within those areas is excellent and should be taken advantage of to get the full flavor of the city. Happy travels!

review.title: impressive
review.reviewText: hotel very clean, staff very friendly. very nice place to stay.

review.title: Can't wait to do it again
review.reviewText: Except for the false fire alarm wake up call on our last day we had an awsome stay. Very quiet peaceful location. Kristin the hotel clerk was aces. She not only recommended where to go but also contacted a tour company which picked us up and took us out daily. Radisson SFO Waterfront thanks for making my wife's birthday week something she will always remember.

review.title: Good, but isolated
review.reviewText: Decent hotel. Clean, well appointed rooms. Couldn't get different pillows; the pillows provided were flat and unsupportive. There isn't anything close to the hotel; stores, food, etc.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The pillows feels like rocks, the sheats were not clean, found hair in the bed.

review.title: Nice atmosphere but OK
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed being on the waterfront and so close to the stadium! Not happy with the limited control of the thermostat in the room. It was too hot so opened a window but got eaten by mosquitos because their wasn't a screen! Restaurant was elegant and tasty though so overall was OK.

review.title: Houston visitor- Impressed
review.reviewText: Wow, were we surprised with this one! We have visited SF several times and always stayed in town. This time we had a car for roadtrips and decided to stay near the AP. This was a real deal for the price. One night we went to the hotel restaurant since we were tired and didn't want to go out and it was great. Good food and a great wine list. We also got a $10 coupon that took care of dessert. Nice surprise.

review.title: nice place to sleep
review.reviewText: clean, and not to far from the city.

review.title: Good Hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Radisson SFO Waterfront. The rooms were standard but clean and efficient. The restaurant in the hotel was great and had two dinners there. We would recommend this hotel, especially if you are planning to drive a lot. It was easy getting around the area.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: For the most part it was a good hotel. Clean and the hotel staff was able to help accommodate us. My one complaint is that the bed was really hard and the pillows were very thin.

review.title: Clean and comfy hotel
review.reviewText: We got to the hotel late at night and on the way there, the street was dark and a little harder to find the location. But this is the second time I stayed at this Radisson and have enjoyed both of my visits. Hotel is always clean and comfy. The hotel also close to freeway with a nice water front view in the day time.

review.title: Loved the hotel but area around is boring.
review.reviewText: Great hotel but pool too chlorinated to really swim. Workout equipment just ok.

review.title: Mixed expirience
review.reviewText: I was visiting the San fransisco for the first time. And the name Misguided me making me think Ithat I am near Piers. During the booking there was no mention of shuttle not being available after midnight and I had to take Cab as the flight was delayed beyond midnight. With this first disappointment, The room was really good and Food too. I was very much satisfied with hotel and the restaurant and the staff in the restaurant. Shuttle staff too was great and supportive. Only disadvantage of this hotel is it is FAR off from Main City. If you are dependent on Public transport you are doomed. Otherwise Great Hotel

review.title: Clean and nice
review.reviewText: Room and hotel was very nice. We were put in a suite with a pull out (which was very hard) but the bed was VERY nice. We went to another room and that was your normal clean simple room. Good for families or just a weekend visit to the bay area.

review.title: You can't judge a book buy it's cover!
review.reviewText: By it's star rating and knowing many of the hotels in the area from previous stays I thought this would be right up there with them. The pictures and some of the feed backs, along with the sale price and the fact that the places I usally stay were booked made this attractive. I brought my daughter with me this time and when she pulled back her bedding there was a disgusting stain on the blanket and hair on the pillow. Also the mattress was terrible "very unconfortable". On there behalf they did move us to another room higher up on the 5th floor where the bedding was clean and much much nicer as well as having pillow top mattresses. I have never left a bad review and am pretty easy to please, but the room must be CLEAN! Try to get on the 5th floor or higher if you stay here.

review.title: Fine hotel
review.reviewText: The room was big and beds really good - The only thing I would say is, that the breakfast area was too small. We had to wait to have a table and there were not so much space. About the menu I have hoped for scrambled eggs and bacon, when the describtions said "full breakfast". :-) Not the best breasfast I have tried touring around i USA for 17 days.

review.title: Nice SFO hotel...
review.reviewText: Overall, nice, newly renovated hotel. Everything works, the ONE item I would pick out is that the beds could be more comfortable (competition has upped the ante on quality beds, Radisson just needs to catch up - everything else is great).

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: The hotel gave s real nice impression until we got to the room. It was ok but the bedding was very old and worn. The chairs had spots on them like an activity had occurred but never got cleaned.

review.title: Excelent = GreatPrice+GreatRoom+Free Parking+Free Internet
review.reviewText: Excelent = GreatPrice+GreatRoom+Free Parking+Free Internet

review.title: Staff is very helpful
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful in making recommendations. Kincaids was a superb suggestions. Only negative was the bathrooms (we had 2 rooms) smelled like cigarette smoke.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: It appears that there is a big difference between the budget rooms and the higher cost rooms. Our room was a budget room. It was clean but uncomfortable. The pillows were extremely thin and small and the headboard was quite hard (not a good combination). In addition, although the hotel claimed they had complimentary wireless in the rooms, it did not work. The instructions for troubleshooting were antiquated. If you plan to stay at this hotel, make sure to stay in one of the more expensive rooms. Positives: swimming pool, fitness center, tiny business center (two computers), free wireless in lobby. Note: No continental breakfast.

review.title: great hotel at agreat price
review.reviewText: Very very nice hotel. Beds are awesome. The property overall is nice, with a walk/run trail. No restaurants or mini marts near by.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: It was a great vacation. Will go back some day.

review.title: GREAT BUSINESS HOTEL
review.reviewText: Easy access to SF airport, business complex. Friendly staff.

review.title: Looks good on the web
review.reviewText: Hard beds flat pillows who could ask for anything more....spend a couple of extra bucks and stay somewhere else

review.title: Very good choice for hotel near SFO airport
review.reviewText: Quiet very clean rooms, very comfortable, OK fitness facilities (great running right outside at the waterfront), OK restaurant. After staying in the Radisson SFO a few times and trying some other hotels close by this is my preferred choice due to very good value for money.

review.title: Great Setting
review.reviewText: The Radisson Hotel SFO Waterfront is located very close to the SFO Airport of the 101 Highway. It is a very convenient location and yet is quiet, scenic and restful. All the amenities, pool, jacuzzi, fitness room, and business center made our stay enjoyable. The staff was very helpful with directions to other places of interest and suggestions on how to get around in the city. I would stay there again.

review.title: Very nice hotel, not too far out of the city
review.reviewText: Very clean, very quiet, nice location

review.title: MIGHT RETURN IN THE FALL
review.reviewText: Overall everything was great the only thing I had a problem with, was the curtains it was too bright early in the morning.

review.title: Best hotel to stay at for the price!
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty decent and it was easy access to San Francisco since the hotel is right by the highway. For the price you pay for it, it is great place to stay at. The customer service at the desk is great! The only con is that the beds are not very comfortable...

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Very nice airport hotel. Convenient to the airport, comfortable, willing to help, availability of coin-operated laundry room... can't ask for more. The only "negative" is its location in an office park, which makes it quite inconvenient to locate a restaurant, cafe, supermarket in the nearby area.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay at the hotel. The bartenders were very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. They need to upgrade the tvs in the room to flatscreens. We had a mix up with a hold on our credit card for a double charge for the room even though it was prepaid. The problem was fixed but there was no compensation or apology for the inconvenience. Overall our stay was quite nice. The location was good for going into the city.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The hotel is very modern and clean; however, I do have a couple of negative comments: 1)I'd waited 40 minute at the airport curbside for the shuttle bus. 2)Both my room and neighbor's room have their wakeup alarm went off at 6am; I was able to turn off my alarm, but the neighboring room alarm sounded for over an hour!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for everyone traveling to SF. Free parking and free high speed internet plus the opportunity to experience the sleep number bed make it attractive.

review.title: Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be very comfortable. The hotel shuttle was also first rate and they had plentiful drop off times.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: This hotel was very conveniently located for guests with cars. Driving into San Francisco and surrounding locations was easy and the hotel itself was in a nice area. Although our room was nice, the hallways and lobby had a strange odor, but for the price, I thought the Radisson was a good deal.

review.title: Slept Great
review.reviewText: Sleep number beds in the executive tower were very comfortable. The restaurant downstairs was excellent.

review.title: Good price, decent hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is decent for the price. It is within close driving distance to downtown San Francisco. It has great freeway access. The indoor swimming pool is nice given the usual cool San Francisco weather.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Would like to stay there again

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and location

review.title: Exec Tower
review.reviewText: The only issue was that they did not give me the Executive Tower level room initially that I paid extra $$ for. They did transfer us to this room after check in but it was no different than the room we had initially. They said they provided complimentary snacks and beverages but none were supplied in the room. Not a huge problem but I am not sure why the additional money was charged to me for the upgrade.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be conveniently located to all attractions and the airport. The first visit was great and on my return to the area stayed again. I travel for business and found the executive level to be fantastic. Definitely recommend.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great location from the airport and only 15 minutes into San Francisco (without traffic). Our room should have been a non-smoking room, but for some reason, we smelled cigarette smoke coming through the bathroom's exhaust. We alerted management first thing in the morning. The problem wasn't fixed immediately but management took care of us and transferred us to a different room.

review.title: Surprisingly sophisticated
review.reviewText: I love this place...the internet pictures don't do it justice. It is simply lovely with a subtle sophistication including gracious staff, grand piano, fantastic art, and delicious food at good prices in the restaurant. I sought a place to really relax and relished the walk to the marina and not being around mobs of people. The view from the room was enchanting especially as night fell and distant lights across the water came on. The complimentary shuttle even had classical music playing. Terrific.

review.title: Good Quality..Great Location,Affordable price
review.reviewText: Actually i was quite surprise when i saw the Hotel and for the price we paid for i think we got everything we need.No shopping center around but if you need to spend one night or two in transit to other destination i suggest to give it a try. The Hotel restaurant is very nice and not expensive at all and they make a good pizza as well.

review.title: If you have a car. Good location and very comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is not far from the city and the airport. It has very good amenities and is fairly priced. It's clean and service is good. The only thing I didn't like is the smell in the hallways. It smelled like garbage every time we went in and out the room. It might have been a one time thing. I would recommend this hotel anyways.

review.title: Great hotel, if you don't mind driving.
review.reviewText: I have no problem with this hotel at all. The staff service was swift and friendly, the hotel is very classy, and the rooms were complete with everything you need for a comfy stay. The standard king room was very roomy for a decent price! Free internet and parking is a plus! The A/C was noisy but it personally helps me because I like some ambient sound when I sleep, so if you are like that you shouldn't have a problem. Can't complain of any other noise as the only people you'll be hearing would be passer-bys near the front door. Otherwise, I never heard any of the adjacent neighbors. The only con I would say about the hotel is the drive to SF or any other adjacent city travelers visit. If you wanna save some money and retain a classy hotel feel, this is a wonderful hotel.

review.title: This bed is too hard....
review.reviewText: The cleanliness of the room was wonderful, location and parking however the beds were hard and not too comfortable.

review.title: Nice Hotel but inicial service was poor
review.reviewText: My family and I had picked this hotel threw expedia its location was nice if you are traveling by airport just a few minutes from it. The hotel was nice looking from the outside and in. When we booked the hotel we booked the executive tower level wich is the 8th floor. The man who gave us our room gave us a room on the 6th floor and I said that we were supposed to be on the executive tower level he told me that the 6th, 7th, and 8th floors are their executive levels I thought this was strange because expedia said we would be staying on the 8th floor but I took the key and went to our room. Later we decided to go to the resteraunt to eat dinner and while in the elevator we noticed that you have to have your room key to access the 8th floor. So I decided to go to the font desk because this was bothering me. When I told the girl at the front desk our situation she corrected the problem and told me only the 8th floor was thier executive tower level just as I had thought. She was more than courtious and very appolagettic to us gave us free room service breakfast for the rest of our stay. Im not sure why that man did that but I am glad he did because we enjoyed room service because of it. As for the room it was clean to the naked I when you walked in but the microwave had what seemed to be old cocoa old enough to create a smell that was retchid when opened, and some trash under the bed. Other then this it was a nice stay.

review.title: Great place to stay for a good rate
review.reviewText: The hotel is located 10 minutes from downtown SF and 5 minutes from the airport. There's not much in the direct area where the hotel is, but the price was great and the hotel was great quality. The highlight and big supprise was the restaurant food.

review.title: For Business Visits Only
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary. When we booked the room we were expected to get a sleep number bed and a flat panel TV. None of these ammenities were in our room. When we called room service, they wanted to charge us an additional $60 per night to "upgrade"! Also, we were told the hotel had an ocean view. We had a view of the highway. Plus, there were limited channels on the cable they provided. I would only recommend this hotel for people on business since it is located on a business-populated area.

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: As an airport hotel my suggestion would be to have half day room rates as lots of flts leave at different times but they only offer full rate regardless of time leaving/arriving. Reception staff were fairly unhelpful and had to answer phones whilst dealing with customers checking in etc. Restaurant food good but service etc not good and not much choice - free internet a great asset but this hotel is not interested in service

review.title: Decent Stay
review.reviewText: It was kind of far away from the downtown area.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: My stay there with my family was great,we all enjoyed the room service,the food kicked a**.We all had a great nights sleep the room was clean and the bathroom was also.The staff was very pleasant also..

review.title: We loved the hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel. It was close enough to San Francisco that we were able to travel there every day and sometimes twice a day to enjoy the sights. It was nice to have free parking. I felt comfortable walking on the carpet in the room with bare feet. It was very clean. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Loud neighbor, no help from the front desk
review.reviewText: The person staying next to us was on a conference call all night to somoneone in England. He kept us up all night. I asked the front desk on the second night to do something, but the guy just kept talking away. I demanded that we move to another room, so at 5am my wife and I changed rooms. The next night, a lovely coach-roach fell onto my wife's pillow. Let's just say we are not staying here again.

review.title: Not Great
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to airport and centrally located for what we wanted to do. The room was ok but not up to the standard of other Raddison's where we have stayed. The bed covering was dirty which was an immediate turn off. Fortunately, the linens and bath were clean so we sucked it up and stayed. The hotel was pretty isolated which made it difficult to find a place to eat late in the evening without driving into San Francisco.

review.title: Stay & Park
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, and enjoyable. I did the stay and park deal, and I liked the deal.

review.title: Be reasonable about your expectations--Its' Raddison.
review.reviewText: I saw other unhappy reviews, but let's get real. This is not a high-budget, resort hotel. The cab was not ready in the morning as requested the night before, and when it did come, the cab looked so poverty stricken inside. When I requested more pillows at night, I was told to 'come down get them' on my own, as the poor front girl was working her night shift alone. Neither microwave nor coffee maker was working. I felt bad for the poor employees working hard for a company like this. I left the hotel, being reminded of how well some of us have at work (or life).

review.title: Nice place with all amenities, but a couple problems
review.reviewText: I've stayed at several of the cheaper hotels near SFO and this one has been the nicest so far. The indoor pool/jacuzzi and onsite restaurant meet my requirements, and the room was clean and mostly comfortable. Only problems were that breakfast was really expensive ($36+tip for 2 adults). They have small old TV's with bad color (need to get flat screens!). Went to the pool at 7am (it opens at 6am) and there were dirty towels everywhere and no clean ones. Asked front desk and she said she'd send someone in with towels. I swam and swam and nobody came. Had to go back to room drenched. However, I'll likely go back and I do recommend it.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: The Radison was a great deal, close to San Francisco with free parking

review.title: Just another average hotel
review.reviewText: Only good thing about this hotel was the location, very convenient to the city and the airport. The internet did not work (no wireless), the front desk asked me to call the tech support, tried couple times and no one answered calls. The front desk people were not very friendly.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: very close to the airport, which is to say, a drive from all the action...good and bad all the same. right on the water. the room was very nice and the service very accomodating. i would definitely stay there again...oh and the price was a steal!

review.title: Great location for those of us going on a cruize
review.reviewText: Hotel is great, the straff provided out standing services and information with resturants, rental car service and points of interest,unfortunately I was extreamly disappointed with the bed, it was very uncomfortable, it appeared to be way past exchange for a new one, if we were staying more than one night I would have requested a different room

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was good except for the bed... It was a little too hard...

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: I was kind of leary about choosing this hotel after reading some of the reviews but I'm glad I did. Everything was great and contradicted all the negative responses.

review.title: Nice, quiet hotel very close to Downtown
review.reviewText: I travel to San Francisco often and stay at many different hotels in the SFO area. This is one of the better ones. Hotel was well maintained, service was wonderful, and it was very close to the city. Only complaint is the restaurant which is ridiculously overpriced. I had a bagel with lox and creme cheese and tea service. My total before tip was $17. There are no places to eat within walking distance so unless you have your own food, be prepared to be ripped off. Other than that, great hotel.

review.title: i will be going back
review.reviewText: Was a little out of the way from where we wanted, but well worth it.

review.title: very quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: We were there to watch our son ply baseball short drive fron sf state very nice motel quiet and clean we will stay here again

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: HOtel is at ideal location. You have to rent a car to enjoy driving in SF. This hotel provides free parking and is about 15 mins from downtown. The room are ok, bathrooms were old and hence didnt look clean.

review.title: Do not stay here!! Not the usual Radisson.
review.reviewText: I was given a room with stains on the bathtub and a bed that you could feel the springs.

review.title: NO HEAT in the rooms & apparantly no one can fix it!!!
review.reviewText: We were there for three days during Nov'08. We went there after a great experience with Radisson at Chatsworth, CA. but the minute we got to the hotel, the horror show started. The first room we got had an odor that almost killed us so we asked to change room. The second room was ok, till we had to turn on the heat, when we found out that something is wrong & asked the front desk to take care of it, they told us they'll send someone over early in the morning... to our surprise, when we came back the night after the heating still didn't work. We called again to the front desk & they said that they can't send anyone right now cause it's too late, so they'll do it tomorrow... on the 3rd day we went early in the morning to the front desk & demand that they will solve the problem till we get back, they said "don't worry". Guess what? We came back & it was still freezing in the room... then they finally send technician who told us that he aware of the problem & there's no unit inside the AC, so that's the reason there's no heating... REALLY? So they gave another room, at the last day of our vacation, which the electricity didn't work there. After an hour of talking with the front desk manager, she decided to be "nice" & gave us 2 desert & 20$ breakfast in the hotel restaurant. She said that there's nothing else to do....& she gonna send a letter to the chief executive officer.

review.title: Better than average.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable with a large room and king sized bed. My only complaint was the climate control. It was a wall mounted heater/AC unit that didn't give you the option of leaving the fan on at all times. So, every time it kicked on during the night, it woke me up from my sleep.

review.title: A good hotel.
review.reviewText: I like this hotel's location. It provides access to both the city (SF), and San Mateo. The staff is always friendly, and appart from the constant presence of a big wind off the Bay, it's a nicer hotel to stay at than many other hotels in the area . Though I'm not a fan of the restaurant. 'And the hotel lacks a pool and fitness room. The fitness room is almost a necessity today 'for those who need ro maintain a fitness program whilst traveling.

review.title: Downgraded over the years
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times before, but we had a very mixed experience this time. While the hotel property is still nice the staff needs training in customer service. After being given our room keys the same desk attendant came and knocked on our room repeatedly in the middle of the night to make sure that the room was occupied or not. The restaurant staff also does not believe in service to the patrons, they think that they are too 'classy' to wait on customers. We will definetly not go back.

review.title: Good Price/Nice Room
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. The staff was courteous and the restaurant and bar were also great. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The shuttle was great and was always on time.

review.title: was OK. Not the Radisson im use to.
review.reviewText: the front desk staff was incredibly friendly. I was expecting a higher class-type room though. Instead of a 7am wake-up call, I got a "5am" wakeup call........ not happy!! The nearest store is a car ride away.

review.title: Excellant Location
review.reviewText: Easy access to downtown San Francisco and points of interest to visitors. Close to the international airport and easy access to common daily trip locations.

review.title: We will definitely return to this hotel.
review.reviewText: This is one of our favorite places to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Comfy
review.reviewText: For the amount of time we spent in the room it was. liked that the living room had a door to the bedroom to get ready. Hotel front desk employee's were very helpful with calling the taxi's for us. And the breakfast the next day was pretty good.

review.title: The stay was great- cleaning person forgot to take a used creamer that was left from previous stay
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. We went on the weekend before Halloween. There were a couple of people in the hall way that were partying in their room but once they were inside we didn't hear them. We enjoyed the extra snacks and bottle water that were there for our stay without charge. Cleaning person forgot to take a used creamer that was left from previous person staying in room.

review.title: Radisson - Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very satisified!

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: My husband & I loved this hotel. Our room was very clean & the maid service was excellent. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. Maybe most impressive of all was how quiet the room was. We never heard a peep from any other room. The hotel staff was very friendly and always willing to help in any way they could. Just a few minutes from downtown San Francisco and very easy to get there on Hwy 101.

review.title: Extremely helpful and professional throughout the stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay

review.title: Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very good value for money. The staff and service were excellent, with very good bar and restaurant. The location was just about perfect, situated as the hotel is on the Bay, just a few miles from downtown San Francisco in one direction and the international airport in the other (with airport shuttle service). The small town of Brisbane, with its shops, restaurants and bars, is just a mile away (but no bus service as far as I could make out).

review.title: Near the airport and near the city
review.reviewText: This very new hotel is clean and efficient. It's near the airport but not so close that sleep is disturbed. It's located in a safe area characterized mostly by high-rise office buildings and other modern hotels. The drive to the center of the city takes only about 15 minutes. From this location there is easy access to all areas surrounding the city. Best of all, parking is convenient and free, which is no small matter considering how much you have to pay for parking at hotels in the city. There is a walking/jogging track next to the hotel. It goes for miles along the side of the bay. It's ideal.

review.title: it's ok
review.reviewText: hotel lobby, hallway was clean. staff friendly. Sheets/blankets look questionable. Room was not that clean. TV is small. Free internet is so terribly slow that I didn't bother to use. No nearby restaurant. On the plus side, parking is free and it's very close to 101 freeway and airport.

review.title: Room good Restaurant service Terrible
review.reviewText: room was clean and comfortable. the restaurant at Hotel terrible service for Dinner to the point were I had to ask for the manager of Hotel and let them know how bad the attention was. Hotel had no manager at all Friday 9.30 pm??? breakfast at the same and only restaurant at this hotel DON'T EVEN TRY IT. food not well done and ONE person and one cleaning boy to take care of ALL customers. manager of Hotel and manager of restaurant were supposed to call em. STILL WAITING. over all terrible experience.

review.title: Good, not great
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and friendly. On-site cafe was far less impressive-overpriced with poor service. The mattress was very hard and only had 3 pillows on the king-size bed.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel room was clean and comfortable. The use of the weight room was nice. We spent several days in San Francisco and the hotel made it easy to get there through the use of its shuttle to the airport, where we could catch BART into the city. The staff was extremly helpful and courteous and the neighborhood felt safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit San Francisco who doesn't want to stay within the city itself.

review.title: San Francisco Radisson
review.reviewText: Although, not downtown this Radisson had easy access to the freeways, and just 7 miles from downtown. Staff members bent over backwards to assist you and the food and drinks were great. Compared to downtown hotels this Radisson was affordable.

review.title: extremely happy,
review.reviewText: This was the first of three high end hotels I stayed in while visiting San Francisco. I loved it! It stands out in my mind as the best hotel of the three. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room surpassed my expectations. It was clean and fresh, quite roomy with attracive decor, a view of the water, and the bed and pillows were perfect, just like home. I found it to be quiet-I don't know if maybe I didn't have a neighbor, though. Also, it had a clean indoor pool and jaccuzzi. The location is so pretty on the bay, and is convenient to the airport, close, but not too close. I stayed here on the executive level for my first night.

review.title: It was OK
review.reviewText: This hootel was OK but it was too far from the sights we wanted to spend time at. If you don't have a car it's difficult to get into the city.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: This was a nice place to stay right outside of San Francisco.

review.title: EXCELLENT VALUE FOR SAN FRANCISCO AREA
review.reviewText: FIVE STAR QUALITY FOR A REASONABLE PRICE IN A VERY PRICEY AREA. ABOUT 15 MINUTES FROM SF BUT FREE PARKING MAKWS A BIG DIFFERENCE.

review.title: Relaxing by San Fancisco Bay
review.reviewText: The Radison Hotel SFO Waterfront is an excellent place to stay if you want to be close to the airport and the hot spots in San Francisco. It is also right by the San Francisco Bay, which has a paved public walkway that can be used by walkers, joggers, or bicyclist. I enjoyed my early morning walks and the view of the fog covered mountains right behind the hotel. Through Expedia I was able to get a super deal for a three night stay with a car rental. The hotel also offers courtesy shuttle service from the airport and you can rent a car at the hotel to avoid the lines at the airport. I will definitely visit there again!

review.title: Clean, economical but not fancy
review.reviewText: Hotel was pretty new. Rooms and lobby were all clean and updated, rooms were on the small side. Good option if you have a quick trip in/out of SFO and are looking for a decent hotel that is easy access. Not the place for your senior execs to stay.

review.title: Pleasant stay and clean hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel. Comfortable to stay. Overall it was a pleasant visit.

review.title: Great Location to city
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Very Clean, friendly staff. Easy access to the 101. Would stay here again!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and convenient to downtown and surrounding day trips. The entrance from 101 South is a bit confusing. Breakfast is pricey so it's best to get out and experience something other than the hotel food. Though not offered on the menu, bartender happily had the kitchen prepare a cheese and bread tray for takeout which we enjoyed in our room just before heading to the hot tub and pool. Stay was pleasant for the money.

review.title: Great hotel, great price!!!
review.reviewText: Nice location, excellent beds, direct airport shuttle

review.title: Comfortable, beautiful, quiet
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights and were quite pleased with the location as well as the overall comfort of our room. The staff was helpful and offered information on the shuttle service to the airport/Bart as well as local sights. There is also a scenic walking/biking path behind the hotel that winds all along the bay. We would definitely return for future stays and highly recommend to anyone visiting the San Francisco area.

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient
review.reviewText: The staff were helpful and we had a great room on the 8th floor with a view. The beds were comfortable. We appreciated the free shuttle service to the BART and airport. They ran frequently. This is a good hotel in quiet surroundings with great access to transport to the city and the airport. Would stay again.

review.title: Oasis of Calm
review.reviewText: This is the best located SFO airport hotel, on a quiet bay a few miles from the airport. The decor is contemporary, the staff efficient and friendly, and the food is surprisingly good. They have a "park and fly" program at a low rate. A good place to stay the night before your trip and to leave your car while you are gone.

review.title: Had a wonderful stay
review.reviewText: The room looked totally welcoming and the bed was just awesome! The best of all, in my opinion as well as the friends I was traveling with, was the shower-- it was wonderfully refreshing. The hotel staff was nice and friendly. We will be very glad to stay there if we visit San Francisco again. Well... you would have to drive to the city and get a parking there, but overall, if you want a peaceful night's sleep, this is a great option-- definitely!!

review.title: Very uncomfortable noise
review.reviewText: I can hear what people talk or do something else all night. Very uncomfortable. I won't recommend this hotel for anyone.

review.title: Ideal for visiting the sights of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Would highly recommend this hotel as all the staff were extremely helpful, the restaurant was friendly, and considerate even when my husband (who is vegeterian) could not find anything suitable on the menu. The reception staff could not have given us any more assitance than they did - especially as we were in the area at the time of the protests regarding the Olympic Torch!!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel had excellent service and the receptionists were very attending and helpful to us. We did not know the area well and they did the most to help us and give us useful information.

review.title: Very nice hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Although I only stayed one night, it was a very enjoyable stay. I arrived late and needed to get something to eat. The restaurant was closing in 5 minutes, but the manager was gracious enough to offer to prepare what we wanted from the menu for take out. This was greatly appreciated. Everyone we (my wife and I) came into contact with was very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: beautiful location
review.reviewText: I had an absolutely delightful time at the hotel. I loved the view of the water from my room and the beautiful mountains in the 'backyard'. would highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely be back.

review.title: Nice Location, Good Price, Comfortable Room
review.reviewText: Nice location right off highway 101, about 15 minutes to downtown or airport. Right on a marina which has a nice walking path. Internet connection is very bad. Restaurant serves excellent dinner, but poor breakfast buffet. Walls are a little thin. Has Sleep number mattress.

review.title: Very impressed. Clean rooms and convenient locations.
review.reviewText: I loved the room. The price was very reasonable and the room was very clean. The daily maid service was great too. Free internet was also a bonus, but it was a bit slow at times.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Clean room, courteous staff

review.title: One of the best I've seen
review.reviewText: Overall I had a great time at the radisson hotel. The customer service is great at anytime of the hour and very helpful.

review.title: Great location with peaceful surroundings, very impressed
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel, front desk staff very helpful, we requested a waterfront view room and had no problems with our request. It was so nice to have leisure facilities after a long drive. Our room was clean, the only one concern of mind was the bed was a little hard, this would not stop us from returning. We would recommend this hotel to any body visiting San Francisco. Great value for money.

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Nice view since it's water front.
review.reviewText: I booked 2 rooms with double beds, but when we arrived, the front desk gave us 2 rooms at different story. I told that I booked a week ago and pre-paid the fee how come they didn't reserve the rooms for me. He said we arrives late and al other same types room sold out.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The Radisson was a great place to stay for our trip to the college football bowl game in San Francisco. Although the hotel is in Brisbane, they have an excellent complimentary shuttle running to SFO airport (which has a metro station that runs into san francisco)so it is not hard to get around. The hotel restaurant was excellent but unfortunately they do not serve breakfast.

review.title: Good Choice.
review.reviewText: A good uncomplicated stay. No complaints.

review.title: Worked Well
review.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights, husband went into city to see Alcatraz, the girls and I sleep in and then swam. It was a little isolated but worked well for us. The bar looked very nice but didn't get to visit. The beds were comfty. Very accessible to town.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: Not a bad place to stay near the airport. Clean and convenient. Free Internet. Thin walls.

review.title: Good Quality San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The Radisson Hotel SFO Waterfront has all of the amenities you would expect however there is little else in the surrounding area. The hotel shuttle service provides quick access to the airport (10 minutes away) and from there the city can be accessed by the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) train for $10.30 return fare (the city is a 40 minute journey from the airport). We loved the hotel indoor pool, gymnasium and especially the hot tub! We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Hotel staff were great!
review.reviewText: We didn't stay long, just a short overnight trip. But the room was clean and comfortable. Check-in was a breeze, got to love Expedia!

review.title: great location for attending 49'rs game
review.reviewText: This hotel has great amenities, and is a great location when going to attend a 49's game. Freindly staff, and a great resturant at the location. Easy on and off access from freeway. Close to airport.

review.title: Park and fly package
review.reviewText: The best park and fly package for a longer trip I have found. Not the best base price, but they are loose on number of days parking, approx. two weeks. We are staying 17 days and they said no problem. Other packages charge extra after 7 days and you wind up paying more. The hotel quality is better than the other cheaper base packages as well.

review.title: Very comfortable and Reasonably Priced
review.reviewText: This hotel was very well maintained and the beds were super comfortable (almost all the rooms have sleep-number beds). The bar/restaurant off of the lobby had excellent food and drinks and one of the best bartenders I've seen- very professional. The pool and hot tub were also very fun. Very well priced and not that far from downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice in regards to the condition and maintenance. But I personnally would not go back. The pool was too small. The location was fine but I rather have stayed closer to the piers. It looked more the place where business travelers would go to. There was nothing within walking distance. Have to take the highway just to get gas.

review.title: Excellent choice for layover stay
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Radisson for a day and a half layover and was more than pleased. Excellent service from both the hotel staff and the restaurant. Beautiful view of the water and close to the airport, but it's a bit complicated getting to the city, making it ideal for a layover or a short getaway. All in all, very highly reccomended.

review.title: Easy access into San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Close to running/walking path along the water.Easy drive into San Francisco. 10-15 minute drive into the city. Staff was friendly,for the most part, except I had a difficult time with room service. Was told by front desk that my request can only be done by room service. Called room service, asked for two wine glasses and a corkscrew, waited for 45 minutes then called room service again. Was told "the waiter is on the way" by Gloria. Waited another 20 minutes, finally I went to the front desk where a new staff member was on duty--he took care of the situation. Gloria never sent anyone to the room. Noticed dirty plates/room service trays sit in hallways sometimes all day.

review.title: Great hotel for Monster Park trips
review.reviewText: Easy access nice mini fridge clean room good location at a nice price

review.title: bad hotel
review.reviewText: no security at this hotel be carefull

review.title: Raddison: Does anything work in this room!
review.reviewText: The Raddison is at first glance a nice place. But once you check in -- the surprises come one after another. They begin with the TV, dull and with no options to change brightness. Do you like watching a dark TV? Then the toilet had no water in the tank? The WORST part about this hotel is that the laundry room is on the 2nd Floor , the smoking floor. Why would you put a laundry room for NON-smokers on a single floor that's dedicated to smokers? If you have problems they'll offer to move you, but I Guarantee you'll run into new problems, and be faced with the lesser of two evils.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: hard bed

review.title: It worked well for us
review.reviewText: We wanted to spend a week in the Bay Area exploring by car. The Radisson SFO is close to the airport, has free parking, is in a quiet area with great walking by the bay and marina. The room was clean and the staff were friendly. We used the exercise room in the AM and the hot tub at the end of our day.

review.title: Solid Business Hotel
review.reviewText: Though I didn't ask for it, they put me in a suite, complete with living room and bedroom, two TVs, etc. More space than I could have possibly needed. This is a good, solid hotel. Very comfortable bed. Free wireless internet, though it was very slow on one of the days I stayed. Biggest gripe: the ironing board. It was a fold-down unit stored in the wall. It wasn't even big enough to fit a whole shirt sleeve on, and they didn't have any full-size versions. The restaurant on the first floor -- Xebec -- is quite good. I had the New York Strip twice, and I highly recommend it. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location is good. It's just far enough from downtown to be quiet and much cheaper. It's just off 101, right between downtown and the airport. A five-minute drive from either, if that.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: great price nice hotel great locating

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to the 101
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice and knowledgeable about the area (I asked about public transportation to get to the Giants game). Hotel was clean and the bed was verrrryyy comfortable. I'd stay here again any time.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Key to this hotel is location. One half way inbetween downtown and Stanford area. For me it is always about value for the money. This hotel was same price as many of the area's lesser hotels.

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights here and would definitely go back if we needed somewhere in the SFO area again. The hotel is conveniently located near SFO and highway 101 but with no motorway or airport noise. The room was a good size, clean, well appointed and everything worked. As an added bonus the restaurant was quite a bit better than normal for this style of hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: the first night i got there, my car got broken into, no one was helpful in the staff i just couldnt belive what happend to me i would never sleep there again

review.title: Great Looking hotel!
review.reviewText: Great looking hotel, the building is nice and clean but the room wasn't as great. The tub stopper came off easily and the coffee didn't work. It's a bummer because the restaurant is also closed, so you have to drive downtown for coffee.

review.title: SFO
review.reviewText: I would do it again which I did a few days later.

review.title: Great hotel between SFO and Downtown
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great value. Had a clean room and great staff. Got a checkout after 1pm...BIG PLUS in my book. Only 5 mins to airport, 10 mins to downtown

review.title: No response whatsoever
review.reviewText: My kid pushed the movie button, ordering a pay-per-view, I immediately called the front desk, the movie was cancelled, and I was told that I would not be charged. I was still charged, and the hotel never even bothered to respond to my question. The shuttle service does not operate during certain hours, there was no warning of that at all when I checked in.

review.title: Peace and quiet
review.reviewText: In general the hotel was great. Our only complaints, which seem to be standard with hotels. Why don't they get it? :0) First the beds are way too hard and the pillows like sleeping on layers of plywood. Please all we ask for the enormous price are comfort while we sleep. Second the cleaning staff tend to be way too talkative and noisy in the early morning hours. Yes, they have a job to do, but some guest are on VACATION and do desire to sleep in.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: nice hotel for price

review.title: OK for the airport
review.reviewText: A good airport choice if you have a morning flight. The food is good but they were less helpful about late checkouts. Transport to San Francisco is more difficult - we drove.

review.title: Not impressed, I would not stay again
review.reviewText: I would not stay again it was very noisey

review.title: Good Hotel - Good Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very nice. The rooms are very comfortable and we had a 1/2 Marina view. The front desk service was great. The restaurant is pricey and not recommended. A great location if you do not want downtown prices. Free parking is great and always available. I would definitely recommend.

review.title: Radisson Near SF Airport
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, convenient to Airport and City. Only drawback is that you will not find much in the way of resturants, shops, pharmacies nearby--you will need to get back on the freeway and travel to another exit.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: I use this hotel everytime I fly through San Francisco. I only overnight. Great hotel with free shuttle to SFO Airport.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Great hotel near the San Francisco, Ca airport...

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, nice view from our room, our only gripe was that the fan in our bathroom didn't work, front desk said it's just real quiet and you can't hear it.

review.title: cool layout
review.reviewText: nice restaurant, service was great at front desk, fast! shuttles on time limited view good restaurants 5 minute drive away

review.title: clean hotel
review.reviewText: nice and clean, good for business travel

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: nicely located, quiet and comfortable place to stay, away from all the fuzz of the city

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel for the price. It was located near a great walking trail and was also a very short drive from San Francisco. The free internet and workout room were also appreciated.

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: My stay was very satisfying. The only problem I ran into was the fan in my bathroom wasn't working and one of the phones was also not working. I called to get them looked at and fixed, but nobody showed. It wasn't a big deal though. The restaurant and bar were a big highlight. I had all my meals at the restaurant for the duration of my stay. The bar was very nice. It was a very cool and mellow place to have a drink and some good food. Also nice flat screen in the center to watch a good baseball game! I would definately stay here again and suggest it to others.

review.title: Ver nice for a night before a flight
review.reviewText: We found the Radisson a comfortable place to sleep before an early flight. The room was nice and the restaurant was good.

review.title: okay hotel for business but...
review.reviewText: This was a good option as my husband and I were in SF for business but did not want to stay in the city. The only real complaint I had was on the first night we were in the hotel, I had a cold and was feeling terrible. My husband had to go out and search for a pharmacy to get me some medicine, and when he came back he stopped off at the hotel's restaurant to get me some soup. The restaurant closed at 10PM. When my husband arrived at the restaurant it was 10 minutes to 10PM and there were still quite a few people eating in the dining room and the cooks were still in the kitchen. When he asked for a soup to-go, he was told in a cold tone "sorry kitchen closed". As restaurant owners ourselves and being in the hospitality industry for a very long time, we always bend backwards for our customers and clients. This is a big hotel and I am pretty sure they could have reached into their walk-in fridge or from their stove and simply poured some soup into a to-go cup. When my husband got back to the room and told me the story I was not so happy. On top of that, we had three pillows and we both use 2 each. We looked around the room for an extra one and when we saw there weren't any, I suggested he call down to have someone bring us one, and my husband's reaction was "yeah right - if I can't get any soup from an open restaurant, do you think they'll bring me a pillow?". I found that sad that that was his reaction.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Being only 1 mile from san francisco this is a great deal simply because of the free parking.

review.title: Nice hotel near where I needed to be...
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before. The rooms are nicely decorated and comfy. Free internet via a cable in the room. Ate at the restaurant/bar downstairs. Looks like they turned the bar into a sushi bar and it was good sushi. I had some sushi as an appetizer and one of their Angus burgers. All in all, it was quite good.. but of course expensive but that is to be expected as this is a hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Highly recommended! Short distance to everything you want to discover in SF.

review.title: I will return to this hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a very nice, clean hotel. The hotel clerk was extremely friendly and helpful. I will definitely return to this hotel again.

review.title: Best accommodations for the price
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff combined with convenient and comfortable accommodations assisted in making our stay very pleasant. We will return whenever we are in the area. Oh, by the way, if you enjoy a fine martini, the hotel bar offers a unique and refreshing selection at a reasonable price.

review.title: Wonderful Service
review.reviewText: The employees (especially the front desk staff) were wonderful!! They were extremely friendly and very helpful. The only problem that we had was with the location of hotel. If you are planning to do most of your exploring/visiting in downtown SF, the cab rides to and from can get pretty expensive (if you don't have a vehicle). The food in the lounge was pretty good, however, a bit on the expensive side. Overall, our experience with Radisson Waterfront was great!

review.title: I can't Believe it
review.reviewText: By far, this has been one of the best hotel i stayed at. You got to try the sleep number...Love it. it's quiet and remote..very romantic!

review.title: Ask for Sleep Number Beds
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Brisbane Radisson last year and were very impressed particularly with the sleep number beds. This year, however, our room was not equipped with sleep number beds even though the hotel brags that the rooms have sleep number beds. Also, our beds were smaller than last year's beds and a bit hard. Overall, the rooms are decent and the staff is pleasant. If you stay at this hotel, be sure to ask for a room with sleep number beds. They are a lot more comfortable.

review.title: San Fran lover
review.reviewText: I love to visit San Francisco and this is the best place to stay if you rent a car. I have stayed in the city, paid more for a smaller room and had to pay $25 a day just to park. The room was very roomy, beds were comfortable, bathroom was big, towels were fluffy and the internet worked! In addition, the staff at the Radisson were extremely friendly, helpful and made our stay that much nicer. IF you are in San Fran to visit and tour this is the hotel for you. I felt safe. I traveled alone with my 11 year old son and never worried about our safety when we got to the hotel late at night. In the city, you have to dodge the bums. I will always stay at the Radisson when I travel to San Francisco!

review.title: Good trtasnsit hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is good for a one or two nite stay while travelling thru S.F to another destination.It is good value for money and has a good restaurant on premises.

review.title: Less than impressed
review.reviewText: Completely unfortunate experience. Difficulty upon arrival contacting anyone helpful at the hotel. Called 4 times from airport before able to receive any service of value. Misdirected by hotel staff regarding the "free shuttle service" and waited over an hour. While room was probably the best the hotel had to offer and the view was nice, it was certainly not great. The lobby and hallways had a strong and unfortunate odor. Situated in an office park near the marina, I was able to walk around a bit, but finding nothing, I felt completely stranded. Trying to find a restaurant was impossible - the only one available within walking distance wss the hotels - just ok. Impossible location if you do not have a car. San Francisco is a good cab ride away, and there is NOTHING around the hotel. Not a great experience - would never recommend this or stay here again!

review.title: Sleeper Bed
review.reviewText: love the innovative sleeper bed that allows one to change the firmness of the bed. very clean and decent hotel. has a microwave oven, refrigerator, iron & board, has laundry facilities as well.

review.title: Good stay at good price
review.reviewText: The room is very big and comfortable. It is also very clean. Although it's quite far from downtown SF, it's worth the drive. Highly recommended!

review.title: Will stay there again.
review.reviewText: Great location, near airport. Very comfortable, great restaurant, good room service.

review.title: Very Nice For the Price
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 8th Floor which is the Executive Level. It's newer construction, very fresh-smelling and clean. Comfortable bed. Would have been nice to have a mini-bar, other than that, all was great with the room. My room service was really slow, though my brother's was on time. Most of the desk personnel were warm and friendly, with one exception. I checked in VERY late--4:00 a.m.--and he greeted me by looking at his watch and saying, "Wow." Excuse me? But, I would stay there again, and I was overall pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. A real bargain.

review.title: very good price/value hotel
review.reviewText: excellent cuisine (seafood linguini) exc. service in bar and dining room

review.title: Great bang for the buck
review.reviewText: First of all, the hotel room was very clean and the service was very good. The hotel is right off the bay and provides a fresh scenery outside the city. Location is also in the middle of it all, even though dining options directly around are limited. However, numerous eateries are located within a 7 minute driving distance. You are just 5 minutes north of the airport and 15 minutes away from Fisherman's Wharf (Pier 39). When we go back to San Francisco, this is where we plan to stay, again. Great place for family, business, or leisure guests.

review.title: room was comfortable and clean and we will go back for sure
review.reviewText: very pleased with this hotel and we can not wait to go back

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our experience at the Radisson Sierra Point.

review.title: Quality is more than waht you apy
review.reviewText: The lobby is very beautiful. The room is very clean and comfortable. The inside pool is very good. The matress with power air bag is very good.

review.title: It's a good deal.
review.reviewText: It's only 10 mins from downtown. It's a good place to stay with comfortable sleeping bed, gym room, an swimming pool. However, there's no supermarket or restaurant around the area. (Except the cafe of the hotel which close early) Overall is good!

review.title: Great Restaurant inside
review.reviewText: There is not much around this hotel but it is super easy access to the freeway to get to downtown. The restaurant in the hotel is great. The bartenders are nice and all work well together. The beds could be a little softer.

review.title: Excellent location, good return for my money
review.reviewText: Very good restaurant

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: We loved it's access to the airport and that we could drop off our rental car at the hotel and then ride the shuttle.

review.title: Excellent! Will go back again!
review.reviewText: The original room we were intending to stay in was the standard room. The window was broken in our room so we were upgraded to a room with the sleep # beds. The most comfortable bed i have ever slept in, and the view we had was great. The restaurant serves great food and the bar is a nice place to wind down.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: If you rent a car in your San Francisco travel, I do not recommend to stay in the city. From here, it's just a 15 min. drive to the city.

review.title: Poor Attitude of Staff
review.reviewText: I turned in my rent car Saturday evening and expected to be picked up by the shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the airport and had to wait over an hour outside in freezing conditions and high winds. I called the hotel staff 4 times to check the statis of the shuttle and they acted like they could care less if I was waiting. I elected not to speak to the staff as I was so mad.

review.title: OK location...avoid the restaurant
review.reviewText: The hotel is OK. The restaurant and room service is dismal. On April 7, 2007, ordered breakfast. It was OK, but missing most of the cutlery, butter for the toast, etc. Let that one go. On April 8, 2007, ordered breakfast again. This time there were items I did not order, no butter, no jam, no cultery, no cream for the coffee. Phoned room service who said they'd bring those items up. Half hour later, called again, but couldn't get through. Went to the restaurant and they said they were still "working on it", as they were so busy. I took the above items up to my room myself. I asked to have the unordered item, the forced 18% gratuity and the 3 dollar room service charge removed, since I had to get these items myself. They wouldn't reverse the change because the manager wasn't in, and no one in the hotel could process a refund without him. I visited the front desk, and they said only the restaurant could reverse restaurant charges. Recommendation: OK hotel, awful food and beverage service.

review.title: Quality of Hotel Service
review.reviewText: Not atall satisfied with the quality of the hotel service. Wasn't able to make calls from the room telephone, on repeated requested nothing was done by the front desk. However, at check out time was charged $ 26.00 for call that could not be connected. Unbelievable. Never going back in there.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and we got an upgrade so it was possible to enjoy the sight from bay. Rental car is needed and it was easy to find and parking was free. The children enjoyed the poolarea. The breakfast was expensive and they do not offer a breakfast buffet.

review.title: Nice place, convienent location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice restaraunt, however I reserved a king size bed and received a room with two queens. Not complaining, just attention to details that seperates good from great

review.title: Loved It!! Loved It!! Loved It!!
review.reviewText: The SFO Airport Radisson was amazing. The people were fabulous, the rooms were very nice and the bed was so comfy!

review.title: Good hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: We thought this was a good hotel, conveniently close to the SFO airport. We were especially impressed with the restaurant at the hotel.

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: good for night stay, the bar is a good place to hang out, and it's the only fun place too. It's good for business trip or to sleep. If you are looking for more fun within a hotel, probably not this one then.

review.title: comming back next trip to S.F.
review.reviewText: this hotel was a pleasent surpries, very nice ,clean,and the staff was very good. when we come back to S.F. we will stay here because its only 7 minutes to downtown and AT&T park. thank you .....rick from los angeles..

review.title: Not Good.....just okay
review.reviewText: The room was just okay. Asked for non-smoking and got a smoking room but the front desk was great they found a non-smoking room for us, even with a pack house. The room was clean but the hallway was very smoking. The Bathroom was for a handicap person. It had a handicap shower, which means it doesn't have a tub or a shower base, so the water was all over the place.

review.title: Unpredictable at best
review.reviewText: The hotel presents a three-star appearance with one-star service. The shuttle service follows the drivers schedule, not the one printed at the front desk. Some of the drivers are friendly, some aren't. I wouldn't say the shuttle is old, but it's quite rickety. The food in the hotel restaurant, Xebec, is good, unless they are understaffed and the owner goes on vacation. As with the shuttle, they follow their own schedule, not the published times. I would expect more of a resort type atmosphere for a hotel that is so inconvenient to get to. This hotel is good for corporate meetings and people wanting to rough it. Bring all the necessities with you because there are no convenient shops or services around. The free parking is good if you rent a car, but I recommend saving the extra $10 a day that you would spend on the BART to get into town from this hotel and spend it on a hotel downtown.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is modern, clean and comfortable. The bedding was high quality and very comfortable. I like the design of the shower curtain rod which provides a wider shower stall area. I look for this feature in other hotel and don't see it too often. The overall stay was much more comfortable than I remember in previous stays over a year ago. The hotel front desk staff could still use a little more customer service training to make hotel guest feel welcomed. I appreciate warm words like "Hello , I hope you enjoy or enjoyed your stay. " I just don't hear those words from the staff, but I can live without the friendliness if the room is comfy and clean.

review.title: Great location to airport and city
review.reviewText: We stayed there because we had a hire car and the parking is very crowded and expensive downtown san fran so the free parking was a bonus. We travelled a lot in and around north california and the hotels proximity to the highway was great no matter what direction we wanted to travel. Never really needed any help at the hotel so quality of service is unknown however the hotel is very well maintained and the rooms were being cleaned daily. Free internet in rooms and also had 2 desktops with internet access for everyone.

review.title: Beautiful location!
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay for the airport and Monster Stadium!!

review.title: relaxed
review.reviewText: I always stay here when I visit San Francisco for business. I love to stay in 8th Floor because its beds are just nice.

review.title: very nice quiet hotel
review.reviewText: service was wonderful close to everything comfy bed

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was good about this hotel. The only thing I can comment is that the attached restaurant does not have much for vegetarians.

review.title: Nice Hotel in South San Fran
review.reviewText: Don't be confused by the name of the hotel - it is not the Bay waterfront. The hotel is actually located in South San Francisco and is about a 10-15 mile drive to get into SF. Overall the hotel was nice and we were pleased, just thought we would be on the bay.

review.title: Very good Airport hotel
review.reviewText: By far this Airport hotel is amonst the best I have stayed in for the price. The room and the hotel overall was very clean, the interiors were pleasing, the rooms were big, had a microwave, the internet was also fast enough. Had ample parking space, just 5 minutes from the Airport and about 30 minutes from Golden Gate. They do have a nice shopping mall also close by (about 3 miles). The only minus is that they do not have any restaurant or a convenience store at walking distance. Totally satisfied.

review.title: Great, but Breakfast too expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel was a very good hotel for the price. The only item of concern was the breakfast. Sunday buffet too limited and too pricey, similarly the breakfast during the week, special concern for people that are interested in healthy breakfast, very weak in this area.

review.title: Only good for overnight airport hotel
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel for business travel or for airport commuters. Although the hotel is quiet and quaint it's in the middle of the industrial area. Very thin walls you can hear the TV from the next room. The overpriced restaurant is only open certain times of the day and closes really early 10:00pm. (Keep in mind there are no other restaurants/stores in the immediate area) In addition, Staff were not friendly and maybe should participate in a diversity/sensitivity workshop. My boyfriend was standing in the lobby for the shuttle bus; when the car rental/hotel staff asked him "Are you lost." Keep in mind my boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and our luggage were placed beside him in the lobby. Although Brisbane is only 2 exits away from downtown SF I'm not sure if there used to seeing diverse guest.

review.title: Good location without the expense of being in the city.
review.reviewText: Great location for access into San Francisco and for being a short drive to the airport. If you don't have to stay in the city but want to go into SF once or twice, this is a good tradeoff in price/location. It's located right next to several Marina's with a nice jogging/walking trail.

review.title: Not bad for the location
review.reviewText: Water front location is nice for view and casual walks. Room service is above average. Eating outside of hotel restaurant requires some travel 3 to 5 miles. Same with getting gas. Easy to get to both SFO airport and SF inner city is a major plus.

review.title: Best Beds
review.reviewText: The hotel features "Sleep Number Beds," which provided us with an excellent nights sleep and a lot of comfort. We are even considering purchasing one of these beds for our home!

review.title: Super stay for a long weekend
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms complete with refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. Great indoor pool and whirlpool. The staff was courteous and helpful. One drawback - no restaurants (except hotel's) or shopping within walking distance. I would stay here again.

review.title: Clean and Close
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Radison because I had a late flight from the East Coast. It was very close to the airport, they had me checked in and in my room with minutes of my arrival. Great place to stay if you don't want to stay in SF.

review.title: Clean and convenient
review.reviewText: Easy to get into city or surrounding areas. Only drawback was that it's in more of a business park area and other than the hotel restaurant or the one next door there are no food options nearby.

review.title: Central location is very convenient
review.reviewText: Loved the sleep number bed. It was a very comfortable stay. Concerned about the light fixture in the pool.

review.title: Lovely San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great service. Only drawback was that the non-smoking room (on the non-smoking executive floor) had a strong smell of cigarettes. The view was so lovely we put up with it but it was a pity.

review.title: Great Park and Ride to SFO
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel about 5 minutes from SFO. Shuttle runs were extremely convenient. The beds were very comfortable and linens were luxurious.

review.title: Nice Hotel, terrible room service
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, clean and well maintained. The hotel staff were great. Our only bad experience at the hotel was room service. We filled out a card the night before for them to bring us breakfast at a specified time. We told them the number of guests was two and yet we only received one breakfast. We shared it, but it was cold, the hash browns(which were french fries)were cold and greasy. We asked for extra butter and jelly for our two sets of toast (sourdough and rye), we received no jelly and only unbuttered sourdough toast.

review.title: Rad experience
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, but the smell of cigarettes was strong in the hallway of the non-smoking section. On our first night, their was a loud party next to our room which awoke us. The hotel booted the people out after we called the front desk. We received contradictory information from front desk clerks.

review.title: Too Far From The City
review.reviewText: I chose to stay at the Radisson, because my daughter lives in the SE portion of S.F.. Nice hotel, but there are no outside restaurants nearby and public transportation is about a mile away.

review.title: Good Place
review.reviewText: Hotel was friendly and in great location to all the surrounding areas.

review.title: Nicel, comfortable and affordably
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay for a getaway weekend. In front of the nice lake and easy to get downtown, just get back to the airport and you can take the subway all the way. Staff is extremely friendly and helpfull. hint: don't forget to use the free shuttle.

review.title: Great View of the Marina
review.reviewText: The rooms all have sleep number beds which we loved. And the view from our room of the marina was beautiful. We would definately go back.

review.title: nice view
review.reviewText: part of the hotel overlooks the san francisco bay, very nice view.

review.title: Great location and beautiful bathrooms!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The rooms are a bit small if you're staying more than a few days, but everything else was perfect. Also, the restaurant there is pricey but excellent. Valet parking was also pricey but worth it because parking in Seattle can be difficult. Recommended!

review.title: great pool
review.reviewText: its kinda far from other attractions where you need transportation and its expensive.

review.title: Great dining for an airport hotel
review.reviewText: While the location and the clients (flight crews and Asian tourists) made this seem like another upscale airport hotel, the dining was of surprisingly high quality. A nicely decorated dining room with a professional and friendly staff, coupled with food that could be called cuisine prepared by a real chef made for a really pleasant surprise. In what is a great restaurant town, you don't have to feel at all bad for staying at a place convenient to the airport and eating right there.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel location is great, very close to the freeway and to our destination. Waterfront is amazing, you can walk and relax and enjoy the view. Service is great, although the gift shop is small but you can find gifts from outside which is cheaper of course. Otherwise, I will definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: Good value for SF Travel
review.reviewText: OK location, close to the city, Good Food and easy parking. Gym/Pool facilities are avergage.

review.title: Just one Night
review.reviewText: We checked in at 3pm and left for the city around 7pm. The staff was very friendly and I liked the idea of receiving a phone call about one hour after we checked in. We did need extra towels and received them timely. The bartender at the restaurant was very friendly and also served us a snack. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Very confenient location for airplane arrival and departure.

review.title: no thanks
review.reviewText: Noisy by the freeway...asked for something away from freeway and got the same area. Dark and old. Restaurant service and food was just not for me. To far from airport.

review.title: Very Disappointed, will not go back.
review.reviewText: Initially was very impressed with the appearance of the hotel. Everything looked clean and tidy, and was easily accessable. Booked a tower room, but were given a standard room.
