Complained, and were told we should have been given a tower room. The desk staff then realised they were over booked, and said no, we should not really have been given a tower room. After some discussion, we were given a tower room. We were very happy. When we arrived in the room, we found the window did not fit the gap, leaving an inch gap. Maintenance turned up with a hammer and eventually fixed the problem. We could not open the window, but it was better than the cold draught. We were told towels would be provided in the pool. When we arrived, there were none. We went to the front desk, and were told towels would be sent there, asap. After 45 minutes in the pool, none had turned up, so we walked, dripping water through the hotel, to our room. Overall, would never stay there again.

review.title: Great Location & Great Room
review.reviewText: This hotel was right of the interstate and right on the bay and close to the airport. The room was very nice with a sleep comfort bed. Very clean with white down comforter and crisp white sheets. I would stay here again.

review.title: Loved the amenities and location
review.reviewText: Loved the amenities and location. A perfect quiet get-away that was also very easy to get to the main tourist spots in San Francisco.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable and very happy with the hotel itself. Only improvement would be to have some off-site food services close-by, but as this hotel is in a commercial area, one must leave the area to find off-site food service.

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with the cleanliness of the hotel and happy with the price. If you need assistance with the area (attractions), get your own literature because the hotel staff will only direct you to the Internet --

review.title: Radisson SFO Waterfront
review.reviewText: Requested side by side, non smoking rooms because we were traveling with our kids. They gave us rooms at opposite ends of the hotel and one was a smoking room. We had to change rooms 2 times during a 4 day stay due to problems with the rooms. I would never stay here again.

review.title: Nice clean rooms - good location
review.reviewText: Only about a 15 minute drive from San Fran. Set in a beautiful setting on a harbor and pretty hill. Far enough away from the City to be relaxing. Traffic in and out of San Fran does get congested though. Hotel rooms were clean, spacious, and a/c was perfect. The food room service was good too. Hotel staff extremely nice and accomodating! Recommended!

review.title: Geat value for the money.
review.reviewText: Staff very accomodating, nice appontments in lobby and room. By comparison the room is what you would expect in more expensive hotels.

review.title: OK but not great
review.reviewText: Room was fine, very clean with small fridge and microwave. TV sucked as you have to go through 20 channels to get to an actual station. I just wanted to watch the World Cup. No restaurants in area so only choce is hotel restaurant which is way understaffed. Staff in general are helpful if you ask for something but do not go out of their way - maybe because there is not enough help? Surrounding areea is nice for walking, running, biking. You need a car or else take shuttle to airport and then take BART.

review.title: Nice hotel for budget conscious
review.reviewText: Easy to check in and out. The room is very spacious and the beds very comfy. Easy to find right off the 101. Big plus is that it is close to SF. Tried catching shuttle to Airport but it was late and front desk was not very helpful in that regard. Also, don't expect to get a great workout in gym, most things are broken in there. The cleaning crew is very nice, curteous and helpful. Price was great for hotel.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly service.

review.title: Hotel is nice but the customer service was more business than genuine Politeness.
review.reviewText: First, I must stress. Sierra Pont exit on 101 is your exit. Miss this exit, and you will not find this hotel. Once found, the hotel is a clean building with a nice decor. With the exception of one very nice lady at the front desk, the others seem to have only the limited level of politeness required to get you moving along to your room. Still, overall, between the safe environment, clean rooms, decent food in the lounge, functional fitness area and Free WI-FI, For the price offered, I would certainly return.

review.title: Great value but tough location
review.reviewText: Newer hotel so the rooms are clean and the property is in good condition. The location is a bit of a pain- its in the middle of nowhere with the added hassle of traffic.

review.title: Close Enough To The City Without The Price!
review.reviewText: Newer, clean and well maintained hotel with nice services. Executive level room has the Sleep Number bed which is cool. Room service is friendly but limited in offering and a bit lack-luster. Perfect hotel if you do business in the bio-tech corridor!

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Wonderful, clean, comfortable and peaceful. There is no place nearby to eat but the hotel's restaurant is great. This is the way to go especially if you have a rental car. Its a ten minute drive to downtown SF but, unlike downtown hotels, you get free parking. I highly recommend this hotel over staying downtown.

review.title: Quite impressed
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and comfortable. Xebec resaurant was nice also. Can walk after dinner to nearby marina.

review.title: Not adequately staffed, bad location
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel b/c my friends were staying here to rest one night before beginning our 14 day cruise. The hotel was nice, rooms were clean, but it was far away from any restaurants or points of interest. The only place to eat (the hotel restaurant) was terribly understaffed, and cabs are expensive in San Francisco if you want to go anywhere outside the hotel area. The morning we were to depart for our cruise, there was very little food at the breakfast buffet, and there was quite a bit of chaos - guests eating and leaving without paying, guests going back into the kitchen area to get cups and saucers for tea, etc. I have already told the Cruise Line about my terrible experience (as I'm sure 100 other people did too). I really don't think the hotel itself was bad; I think the management got caught with it's pants down and had some serious staffing issues.

review.title: Nice placeto stay
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel to stay. Although it's away from town, almost 8 - 9 miles but if you have a car to go around it's a good place to stay. Quite & peaceful. Rooms are very comfortable. A car rental counter is also there. I stayed here & rented a car. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. I would recommend it's a place to stay.

review.title: Very Satisifed
review.reviewText: The hotel was a lot more closer to downtown than i expected... i would definitely stay there again !

review.title: Great hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very close to the city. It was located right off the highway, which made it easy to get to downtown San Francisco. Rooms were nice and clean. Area outside the hotel were very safe. Definitely check out this hotel if you are going to San Francisco. I would stay again.

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText: Large comfortable rooms. Good facilities. Moderately-priced restaurant with excellent northern Italian cuisine. Convenient to SFO, downtown SF, and both sides of bay (reasonably close to San Mateo bridge). Not a resort hotel - you wouldn't have many places to walk with the kids, but a good "home base" if you are bouncing around the Bay Area on business.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: it's nice and comfortable, 15-20min drive from downtown, rooms were nice and clean as well.

review.title: Pretty good hotel for airport location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for airport location. No late check out .. though. Front desk doesn't have map of area (only SJC or SFO..pretty useless if you need directions in between).

review.title: Extremely happy!
review.reviewText: Hotel was easy to get to, quick access to both the city and the airport. Hotel staff was very cordial,professional, and very helpful with directions and suggestions for resturants and activities.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and pleasant to stay at. Had good, free high speed Internet access.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: Was there for a conference. Conference facilities were not impressive. Only one restaurant at the hotel, so you had no choice where to eat unless you had a car.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: Not good

review.title: Comfortable Isolation
review.reviewText: This hotel is set off on its own little part of the penisnsula just south of Monster Park. If you like solitude its great, and can be a quiet refuge from the city. But there are no stores, restaurants or Bars within walking distance and access is very limited. Room was spacious and comforable. After business in the City (8 minutes to downtown SF), it is a great place to walk by the bay just accross the road. Restarurant is only fair for overpriced limited entrees. I will go stay again.

review.title: Clean, Quite and Safe
review.reviewText: I like the hotel because it is clean, quite and safe. I have stayed here many times. The front desk staff could use a little coaching to brush up on friendly customer service. They were not rude, but they did not go out of their way to make me feel welcomed. Instead, they are very robotic and matter of fact in checking me in and out, but it's not enough to keep me away. I do like the cleanliness of the rooms, and I feel safe sleeping there.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Clean, comfortable room. Great decor. Will stay here again when in the area.

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Radisson for three nights. I had a quiet and comfortable room - with a bay view. Very good restaurant (I only took breakfast). Very attentive staff. Excellent location for trips to San Francisco and surroundings.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: I'm planning to spend another weekend in San Francisco by next month. Definitely i will stay again at Radisson Hotel. I enjoyed my stay there and i really like the athmosphere.

review.title: Very good place to stay
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I spent a week in the bay area staying in this hotel. We had a room facing the bay, and it was very enjoyable. If you pick the side facing the bay, there are no road noise to deal with and the view is better.

review.title: Great Hotel close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very modern and clean. The room was comfortable and the bed was great. The service was extremely friendly and they went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The only bad thing about the hotel is it's location coming from San Francisco. It's close but you have to take a freeway exit that dumps you off onto a side road. Coming from the south it's right off of the freeway.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. A little far from the action (Fisherman Wharf, Downtown SFCO) but is worth it.

review.title: Not very friendly or helpful~Rooms are clean
review.reviewText: On arrival front desk person was not friendly. Plus that day they had fire alarm drills that went off every 5 minutes from 9 am to 3:30 pm so that you could not stay at the hotel. No one could tell you how to get downtown or how to catch the BART train at the airport. Luckily we met some people from New York that happened to be staying at the hotel. They had figured out how the train ran and informed us. There is nowhere to shop or eat near this hotel and the shuttle driver speaks VERY little english. Your best bet is to stay somewhere near East Bay or downtown if you are going for travel. Rooms are great for 1 person otherwise bathroom is set up terrible.

review.title: Very pleasant place to say
review.reviewText: A very comfortable hotel with great rooms. Handy little gym and good indoor pool. Breakfast was substandard and a bit expensive but bar was very good and well priced. Perfect for a stopover.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Great location. 20 minutes from downtown. Easy to get around. Great restaurant & lounge.

review.title: Great and convenient but noisy on lower floors
review.reviewText: Was a great place but stay away from the lower floors over the Club on Saturday nights. Very easy to SFO and the City. Been here many times and always come back!!

review.title: clean
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and the help was friendly. The only problem was there is very little shopping or dining areas near the hotel.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel is about a 10 minute drive to downtown San Francisco (without too much traffic that is). Do not send for a taxi and instead you should rent the cars that they have available at the hotel. We received a car with insurance for under 45.00 for 24 hours (we made the mistake of taking taxi's the first day with prices ranging from a $30.00-$45.00 fare for just one way). The staff is very friendly in telling you where to go to and how to get to where you want to go and they even have a small computer room for you to go onto map quest if you need to do so as well. The fitness room is pretty small with a limited amount of machines, but the indoor pool is very nice. I didn't like the selection of food and the price of it (a little too pricey) at the restaurant in the hotel, but its better to eat downtown anyhow.

review.title: Very nice hotel near SF airport, with a fantastic restaurant attached
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and had all the amenities. The workout facility was nice because it had alot of equipment. The restaurant was superb. The food was fabulous from the local chef. The Italian food was real Italian, not like the other American restaurants that say they are Italian. In Italy, Polenta is one of the stables of the food for the whole country. You know you are in a real Italian restaurant when they serve Polenta

review.title: Would go again
review.reviewText: Room was clean and spacious for the price. Easy access to the airport. Quality of restaurant food was good although service wasn't comfortable.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Close to airport but not in congested area. Very quiet, clean and spacious room. A little hard to find at night. Great value for a quick overnite near SFO. Did not use any of the dining facilities so cannot comment; but dining is available in the hotel. Without a car you will not have other dining choices. Good outdoor running, walking opportunities along south SF Bay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located to Hwy 101 which made it a very easy drive into the city or wherever we wanted to go but just far enough out to be quiet and relaxing.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: First impression probably turned us off this hotel. Had to call 3 - 4 times to get the shuttle. It never did come for us. Also, had a bad experience with the taxi service the front desk arranged for us. Although 7 miles from downtown doesn't sound far it is. I would definately recommend spending a few more dollars and getting a place on the wharf. (taxi fare 1 way to wharf was $40.00) The hotel restaurant had limited hours and there was no coffee shop for in between meal snacks. And finally, the hotel assigned our room to someone else and gave them the key. Good thing it was in the middle of the night and we were in it with the chain latched. Who know's what could have gone missing.

review.title: Terrific Hotel & Great Location
review.reviewText: The Radisson was a perfect place to stay - a nice, newer hotel just minutes from downtown SF. Quiet location a few miles north of the airport, nice view of the bay, great staff and accomodations. Much less expensive than downtown hotels, and no parking fees. We took day trips to Napa Valley and Monterey Bay. Highly recommended!!

review.title: needs updating
review.reviewText: old and out of date....don't dare stay in a street side room, way to loud

review.title: A bargain just outside the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the customer service friendly. A major bonus was not having to pay $40 a day for parking in the city. It only takes about 20 minutes to get into the heart of the city (without bridge tolls). The only drawback we experienced was really early housekeeping right outside the room door on a Sunday morning -- and that's a big deal to we who treasure our Sunday mornings.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: -convenient location: immediately off the 101 (i had a rental and did a lot of driving via 101) -front desk people very nice (went out of their way to help me) -room service got a couple of things wrong, nothing serious -had a computer for guest use (i printed out several sets of directions via mapquest)

review.title: Good Hotel, Bad Service
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and clean. The front desk clerks were unattentive and bothered every time you need help.

review.title: Clean and Quiet
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and tastefully decorated in a contemporary style. Great staff, and I felt comfortable and safe. Love the open free parking. I could see my car from the room window above. Seamless checkin and checkout. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good place to stay if visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the airport (SFO) and only about 8 miles from downtown San Francisco. Clean and comfortable but the staff could be more helpful and more friendly.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: Close to San Francisco and airport - that made it convenient for early morning flight. Room was nice, clean, comfortable.

review.title: Easy access to both SFO and the city
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Radisson SFO at Sierra Point well over 500 times (I stopped counting at 400 nights). Here's why: - Easy access to SFO, the city and all points down valley - Free parking (and plenty of it) - Adequate or better CV and weight machines - Great pool - that the chief engineer keeps heated at exactly *my* desired temperature - Whirlpool - Great physical location on Sierra Point that is extremely inviting adjacent to the bay - Convenient access (100 feet away) to a great running trail that hugs the bay alongside the point - Fantastic restaraunt - Xebec - where I can order virtually food prepared the way I want it, whether it is on the menu or not - Great friends that I see only there - Customer service that is top-notch

review.title: Satisfactory Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the restaurant/bar serves a good menu. All interactions with hotel staff were positive. The shuttle to/from the airport ran on schedule.

review.title: "good for our needs"
review.reviewText:
We found the price, proximity to SFO, SF and the rest of
the area just right. delightfully not in town.

review.title: Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I was surprised at how nice the hotel was for the Expedia rate I got.  As a runner, I liked the location and for business, easy to go north or south on 101 for appts.  Only complaint would be that they charged $3. for a poor cup of coffee?

review.title: Radisson SF Airport
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Clean, great service, free shuttle to BART.  Would highly recommend.

review.title: Hotel by the airport?
review.reviewText: The room and restaurant were excellent.  The shuttle service was miserably slow on the day of my departure.  I selected this hotel because it is theoretically close to the airport.  When I arrived it took 35 minutes to get the shuttle and arrivae at the hotel and when I left it took 30 minutes of waiting time and another 20 minutes of ride time to the airport.
